text: Cheers! This place is awesome! Over 30 artisanal craft beers on tap with an ever-changing and always pleasing selection. The variety of beets is to be applauded, friendly staff and a fun atmosphere make this one of my favorite places in town. I come in regularly. They also have an impressive food menu.

This is an absolute can't miss in Phoenix. With 31 constantly rotating taps you will find old favorites and new. Beers do repeat on occasion, but there is always something different awaiting you.   If bottles beer is more your style you can ask for that menu and try something completely new. There are also 6 wine taps if that is more your style.   The food is absolutely phenomenal. It's all made in house so it tastes fresh and it is delicious. They have a seasonal menu as well. I really can't say anything bad ... Other than they are closed on Monday.

I super love that they have Spam and can add it to things! Love the different types of beer. I had #3, a raspberry wheat by grand canyon brewing; smell of raspberry and initial taste is the fruit with the after taste being kinda creamsicle-y. They also have draft wines.  So, to start off, we had the Mess, which was a mess, but a hot delicious one! The gravy that comes atop the fries was delish. The fries weren't too skinny and didn't get too soggy from the gravy but then again, I don't we let it sit long enough to get soggy. And the cheese curds made for a nice crunch with it. After eating it, I really wanted to add Spam and get a side of gravy lol. Maybe next time.  After the mess, it was now onto the pizza - the meaty treat. It certainly was a meaty treat for your mouth. It had all sorts of meat but with the added Spam, what can I say but 'heaven' (I'm Asian and I love my Spam). Next time, and there will be a next time, there should be a flight involved and another pizza with more Spam lol.

I went to Angels Trumpet with my husband (G) last week for dinner and drinks.   For the most part, I really liked the place. It looks like an office building from the outside and from the inside, it looks like a cozy place to grab a bite to eat and a beer. Their beer selection is pretty awesome and featured on a chalkboard on the back wall.  I ordered the Fall Cider by Woodchuck and the grilled cheese sandwich dinner. The cider was delicious and perfectly chilled. The grilled cheese was SO good! I love the fact that they put mint on it - so unique and surprisingly tasty! The fries were not that great because they seemed to be a bit undercooked.  G's meal was a burger (if memory serves) and the "chips". He said they were both good.  So, what we both didn't like were the awful chairs. They are wooden slats and very uncomfortable to sit on for any length of time. The place was only about 1/4 full and we couldn't hear each other even though we were sitting directly across from one another. The place has to do something about the acoustics - it is far too loud to be able to carry on a conversation. And, the only other negative was the lighting. Instead of real overhead lighting, they have gone with tiny candles on the tables. It was too dark to read the menu unless you had it right up against the table.  Other than those issues, the place was great!

My husband and I went here for date night with no baby.  The beer selection is great; however, they only have them posted on the blackboard above the bar.  The waitress wasn't able to give to many suggestions based on the type of beers we told her we liked.   On all honesty, if you work in an ale house you should know your beers.    I ordered the matador sandwich which was barbecue brisket with havarti cheese, mushrooms, peppers and horseradish sauce.  The waitress food was brought out and the sand which looked like roast beef.  I took a bite, sure enough it was roast beef and it was dry...super dry.  I asked the waitress and she came back and told me that she made a mistake and was supposed to tell me that the sandwich is now made with roast beef and the menus haven't been updated.  She of course apologized and I had to wait for my sandwich.  My husband, had finished his meal and they finally brought out a sandwich made with brisket.  The sandwich was definitely not worth the wait, not to mention I was eating alone.  The sandwich was supposed to have havarti cheese and I barely saw the cheese.  The meat was dry and had very little flavor.  On top if it all, the waitress didn't even comp the sandwich.  I don't ever plan on returning to this place again.  It's unfortunate we wasted a date night baby free at this establishment.

Great atmosphere. Tacos are so incredible. Don't even get me started on the pop tarts! TO DIE FOR. Great to come hang out with a bunch of girls and have a great time. Can't wait to try some of their ales the next time I come here (which will definitely be in the very near future)!
Great selection of beer and tasty menu of creative dishes (though definitely not a healthy menu). The garden out back is fun!

Disappointed the proprietor participated in a selfish and ultimately successful scheme to subvert a local initiative to establish a district to improve the neighborhood. He's got a great place, but for this 25+ year downtown resident, a shop that just opened in 2012 is a relative newcomer to the scene. I choose carefully where I spend my money, and the nature and character of the owners of an establishment influences that decision mightily. There are too many competitors downtown now. We now avoid Angel's Trumpet. I do miss it, but...
awesome parking for downtown location. Friendly workers and some strong beers. Good selection and they have a knack for good music.

First of all, what's up with the downtown area? I've been living in the suburbs of Phoenix for 20 years and I never thought of the downtown area as being a "happening" place. When we got off I-10 and proceeded south, there was traffic and people every where. We were really surprised.  We went to Angel's Trumpet on a Friday night and arrived around 7 p.m. The wait time was about 15 minutes and we were able to pass the time in comfortable chairs on the back patio. A waitress came by and offered us water or drinks while we were waiting. Even though it was about 110 degrees that day, the misters kept the outside area cool so it was comfortable when the first available table was outside.   Beer: The beer selection was great and they seemed to have various styles for everyone. I love amber beers, and although they only had one selection (Sunset Amber), it was a tasty beer. As is typical of most bar establishments, the beer selection was heavier on the IPA, porter, and wheat style beers. My boyfriend and friends tried several kinds (unfortunately I was the DD so I couldn't try as many) and they enjoyed each one. A particular favorite was Sculplin IPA. If it wasn't so hot outside I may have tried one of their wines "on draft."  Food: Amazing flavor combinations! It took us a long time to decide what we wanted to eat and none of us were disappointed with our food choices. I had a sandwich ("Bingo")  from the daily special menu with french fries which were served with marinara sauce instead of ketchup (delicious). We had the poptarts which is why we tried Angel's Trumpet in the first place. The seasonal poptart was bourbon peach which had a type of oatmeal crumble on the top (no frosting). It was delicious - flaky dough with fantastic flavor.   Service: Not great for us, but tables around us had much better service. Angel's Trumpet was busy, but our waiter was either not very organized or just slow compared to the waitress buzzing around to the other tables around us. I wish we would have had her instead. For instance, a table behind us on the patio was sat at least five minutes after us and we hadn't even been greeted yet. Then the people who were seated behind us had drinks and food (appetizer) before our beers even arrived. Our slow waiter was very irritating.  Overall: It's a long drive downtown just for food, but we will definitely be back (hopefully with the stellar waitress and not the slow waiter). We all enjoyed our time at Angel's Trumpet and liked the energy of that area in general. It was also fun to see so many different ages congregating in one place.
Really, really good choice. Outstanding beer selection, good menu, good staff. Don't miss the "Big Guppy" on the menu.

Certainly one of the tastiest burgers I have ever had was here. Unfortunately I cannot recall the name but it had bacon and an egg on it so you certainly can't go wrong.   They have a pretty great selection of beer available which they change daily however, they do not have a formalized beer list but rather provide a chalk board style selection of everything which is a personal pet peeve of mine but... its ok. I would suggest sitting at the bar or a close table if you plan to read it.   ** Updated to 5 stars. Have had amazing experiences since my first review and highly highly recommend their t.v. dinner night on Tuesdays. So good!!!!

I am sold the flights of beer!  6 samples of craft beers in one setting will sell me every time.  Exploring craft beers can be a tricky game...we've all ordered a beer that didn't fit our palette and you have to WORK your way thru it.  I explored 3 styles of beers I'd never tried and then finished with 3 favorites to satisfy the taste buds.  There was a nice variety of food on the menu.  They have an interesting take on wings with the sauce on the side. Tried one of the salads which was tasty, but left you a little hungry...especially since it was the same price as the wings.  That moved us onto the Sweet Potato Tacos, which area little more like empanadas, but really tasty with a pesto dipping sauce.  Living in the southwest for so long I'd like to some type of hot sauce on the table or a homemade concoction to bring the heat.  The noise is a little loud, but they'll get the acoustics figured out.  The openness of the floor plan and windows will make it a great year round place for a pint.  It's smack dab in the middle of the Evans Churchill district which is great for a pub crawl

I guess it's about time I got around to writing a review for this place. We eat here almost weekly, and have for the last two-plus years. We have a couple favorite servers but really most of them are good. (There have been some iffy ones in the past, but those seem to be gone.) Because of the service, we walk away almost every week saying how much we love the place.   Beer selection is always interesting. There are usually a couple that appeal to any taste. The flight option is great and you really get a lot of beer for the price. Wednesday's are usually their special event tappings and sometimes you can get a free glass for buying a beer.   We typically go on Tuesdays, which is their TV dinner night. This is the only reason I don't give the place 5 stars. TV dinner has been very hit or miss in the last 6 months or so. We've had some great ones and some terrible ones and some that are just okay. The old chef did a better job at being consistently good. But, if you get a good one, it's a solid amount of food for not much money. I haven't had anything bad off of their regular menu - wings are solid, burgers and sandwiches very good, guppy tacos are fantastic. The desserts are also quite tasty!  Parking can be painful since it's downtown. They have a small lot that is usually full. There are a few un-metered spots but most are metered (most accept cc's now at least).   Oh! Dog friendly patio, and they'll bring water for your pup. Only recommended in nicer weather though as they don't consistently turn the misters on when it's hot.
Obnoxiously greasy food is this restaurant's biggest flaw.

Service was horrible. Food was ok, but why in the name of everything holy are restaurants making their own Ketchup now? The Home made Ketchup here is terrible. If you are going to make your own at least offer an alternative.
Great beer and great food.  We had the pizza and it was very good to go with our flight sampler.
Incredible ambiance that matches a unique menu. The salads are delicious and the simple menu packs a punch of flavor. A huge drink menu will pair with any of the menu items. This place is a jem.

I liked it a lot!  The beer choice is great though there weren't too many IPA choices.  I'm not a fan of double IPAs nor the wheat nor the dark stouts so that limited my choices.    The yummy chef's burrito was great!  So large I ate only half and the other half in the morning.  I sat at the bar and had a hard time seeing the beer choices on the chalkboard wall b/c of the glare of the light but that's ok, I just stood up and walked around to read them!  Not a big deal.    Fun atmosphere and outdoor seating was great.  Friendly people everywhere.  I rode my bike here and just locked it up outside.  Nice neighborhood feel.  I will definitely return here!  The film bar across the street is a nice activity to follow up with after dinner and happy hour!

I love this place!  The food is really good and the service has always been great. It's my go-to place when I am with friends, clients, etc. And looking for a place to just sit, eat, drink, and socialize. Their beverage menu is very impressive and changes all the time. Every time I come here there is something new to try. Highly recommend this place!

Beer 5 star Food 3 star Service 1 star Atmosphere 1 star  Not as awestruck as I had thought I would be. Food was very hit or miss. Recommend reading the menu very well or you could get someone's attempt at a sweet savory burger that is too far in either direction to blend well.   Do try the wings and the hot pretzel. The Matador was pretty good too, reminded me of a Philly steak sandwich but on a pretzel bun.   My husband had the "Meat Treat" flat bread pizza. It was good but we had to ask the waitress where it was, she returned to tell us "they are remaking your order, it will be up in a few (was not a few) minutes."   I realize it's Friday night, and they were busy, but after our initial seating we had to flag the waitress down for everything and then she would disappear again. Once I flagged her down, she would immediately dart off, and I'd have to say "WAIT.." or she'd take one person's order and leave without asking if anyone else needed anything.  The ketchup that was served with the fries, was pretty awful. That needs to go.   The house pop tart, tastes very much like the Pillsbury dough boy made it. I'd recognize that overly sweet vanilla icing anywhere.

Always has a good tap list, and you can use TapHunter to see what is one tap. I love that that regularly update this. The food is good as well. It gets pretty busy on the weekends. I will say that the service is not great. One time me and 3 friends stood at the bar for 15 minutes without being asked what we wanted to order, all this while trying to get the bartenders attention, before leaving to go somewhere else. I have had other unpleasant interactions there as well, but have continued to go back due to the good beer selection.

Very generous owners donated gift certificates to teachers of a nearby school for Teacher Appreciation Week.  Our staff love this restaurant, its patio, and vibe.  It is a great place to decompress, laugh and rejuvenate after busy day.  Food is great and servers are friendly and attentive.

Great food, great beer, great atmosphere (except for acoustics which make the place hard to carry on a conversation.  patio when not so hot is much better).  Loved this place.  not anymore.  not with the plethora of other amazing restaurants downtown.  took another couple with us tonight. had 8 beers, appetizer, and food.  One of the girls ordered a beer that was listed as a peach flavored. she was thinking it would be similar to the 4 peaks peach.  turned out it was an awful tasting sour beer.  we sent it back  and requested another.  When the bill came we were charged for the sour beer.  Asked the waiter to talk to manager saying we didn't think we should pay for a beer we didn't drink.  She came back and said manager said he wouldn't take it off.  nice customer service!  on a beer that probably cost them a buck.   ruined an otherwise nice night.

I was in Phoenix for a couple of days for a conference and found this place this first evening, a Wednesday, and was impressed enough to bring friends back Friday. It is great! I don't know what the complaints in other reviews about the service are talking about. The Tractor pizza with eggs and brussel sprouts was even better than I was hoping. As a brewer and fan of Belgian ales, I was impressed with their selection on tap, and the choose-your-own flights made me very happy.
It was great!  We loved the fresh backed pretzels, shrimp flatbread, and plenty of delicious beer!  Nice staff and cool decor.  We'll definitely be back!

After our first visit a week after opening, it was obvious that there were some kinks to work out. The first visit, I was impressed by the beer selection. It was wonderful and definitely lead to our second visit. The misses to me the first go around were the food and the noise level. The outdoor patio was also very dark. The lighting was better for the second visit, but I have yet to retry the food. I got the pizza but wasn't impressed. Just an odd flavor paring. The noise level wasn't as bad this time, but that could have been because it wasn't as busy and  opening the doors also helped. Can't wait to get back for more good beer and great patio weather soon.

AWFUL SERVICE.  Selection changes daily, which makes it a fun place to go. A couple servers are good and knowledgeable. The food is ok, but overpriced for what it is. You pay for the trendy atmosphere.  We came in at 10:40, and as we were seated, they let us know the kitchen closes at 11, so we should order soon. At 10:50, we had to find a server. She had been servicing a nearby table, ignoring us.  If you happen to order anything you don't like, too bad. They will charge you for it regardless. Ordered a beer, and it tasted sour. They explained how they could not exchange it for anything else, and would still charge me. WTF Bad business to refuse to even offer something different. Worse to charge a customer for something they do not want.

We went here for a friend's birthday dinner / happy hour and they quickly seated our large party of 15 on the patio. The ambiance is...brightly lit, industrial warehouse look, definitely not romantic but I would say fun for a first date. Not too loud so it's easy to carry on a conversation which would make it a good place for a business meeting or lunch (note to self!)  I ordered the chicken, pesto & spinach pizza which was yummy. We also splurged on the homemade "pop tart" which was really more like a puff pastry turnover but was good. On Tuesdays they also do a "TV Dinner"  which a few people got and enjoyed. Someone else mentioned that there aren't many gluten free choices and my GF friend and I shared my pizza - she scraped off the toppings!  They have a decent beer (around 30) selection, which they write on a chalkboard because the beers rotate in and out. A bunch of people tried the beer flights and I sponged off my friends flights lol. I ordered a full pint of what I know I like (raspberry framboise & guiness). I'm not an adventurous beer drinker.  The service was excellent and our waitress was super friendly.  I'm only giving it 3 stars because somehow this place lacks the appeal of wanting to go back and make it an official watering hole. It's OK. Maybe if they added music or something it would  make it more cozy.

I took my son who has been living in Sweden to Angels since he likes good beer.  And he was noy disappointed.  The price was right for the quality of the beer.  We also enjoyed the food I had the sweet potatoe tacos and the were great.  He loved that so many varieties of good beers were on tap.  Definitely going again especially if all three of my son's are home.   Good beer good food good people

Okay, we have been meaning to try this place for a while, and on the way back from a WONDERFUL performance of Swan Lake by Ballet Arizona, we stopped in. Very cool vibes, great outdoor seating. We wish they would have more porters, stouts, or brown ales instead of so many IPA's...after all, it is fall! Beer was priced between $6-$8 a pint. Very attentive server, even though she was hopping through a lot of tables. We ordered the mess (a poutine of sorts) and the fun guy, a mushroom and veggie pizza. Both were seriously lacking any zip, just like the 2 stars, meh. I don't think the chef used any salt or other spices from the taste of them. Would we come here again? Nope, there are many, many other places that have much better food for the price and beer we actually like.

I'd give a 5 rating for their beer selection. I love that its constantly changing drawing you back to keep trying new beers. But I work downtown and have been wanting to go here for since they opened. They close at 11 everyday other than Friday and Saturday when they close at 12. They've been closed every night that I've tried to go. This past Friday I walked by just past 12 and they said they were closed. Even with a lot of people still inside. A lot of people heading to the Turf.   I finally had a chance to stop in when they were open. As I said the beer selection was amazing. I had no intentions on eating there since the menu seemed a little too far out there. We ate anyways. I had the nutter sandwich. Sounded interesting. Pb&j with raspberry-chipotle jam, banana, bacon and marshmallow cream. It was ok, but tasted like candle wax. I'm not sure why. My wife had the stroganoff burger. Not bad, the bun was burnt and cheese not melted. None of the food was hot. Fries were really good though even at room temp.  Their homemade ketchup tastes like sweetened marinara.   I would still recommend trying Angels Trumpet, but only for beers or even their wines on tap. Dine somewhere else.   We sat at a table inside and didn't have any issues with their service and didn't mind the noise. We could still talk to each other without yelling. The music playing in the background was good but could barely hear it.

I would prefer that you stay away from this place 'cause too many people could screw up the experience for the rest of us that have been gathering here since Matt & Sherry opened.  But the fact is that it's simply the best ale house west of the Mississippi.  Extraordinary beer selection, terrific food and a great staff.

I was meeting a pretty big group last night, and when we got there they were waiting to add another table so we could sit down. We figured it would be about 20 minutes so we sat at the bar for our first drink. A couple was leaving so we took their seats (their empty glasses in front of us...EMPTY). The bartenders waled by us and it was impossible to get their attention. When they did finally come over to us it was to talk over our heads to two customers waiting for drinks! We were finally able to make contact, at which point the bar tender pointed to the EMPTY glasses and just said "oh, those aren't yours." OK, even if they HAD been ours they were empty! You should ask if we need anything else.  SO we had our $8.00 drink then made our way over to join our friends. Someone mentioned a menu was coming...never happened. The waiter saw us, but we couldn't get his attention long enough to ask for anything. Now at this point, I didn't WANT to give them my money for their overpriced beer and mediocre food. I did finally get the waiter's attention long enough to ask for water as he refilled everyone else's water glasses. He still didn't ask my friend and me if we wanted food or any drinks. They were pretty neglectful of our table in general - the number of empty glasses and the lack of attention to refilling said glasses was crazy! Everyone had to track down the server in order to get their bills (except my friend and me since we had zero service = zero dollars!). It was such awful service that I ended up using their patio simply to catch up with friends (that was nice) and drink their water. I didn't spend one more dime at their establishment after that first drink at the bar, which is crazy considering I went their with every intention of having at least 2 drinks and food. I will NOT come back here - My desire to spend that much money on drinks is approx. zero if the experience is THAT bad.

Fun atmosphere, really quick getting my two flights of beer. Had the smoked pork outlaw burger. Pretty good! Lots of folks having a good time with beer on a Tuesday night. Will return next time my quest for beer brings me to downtown Phoenix!!

Found this place online & checked it out for the beer selection.  We were not disappointed, a great craft beer selection with flight options so you can try a few before you commit.  We were pleasantly surprised at how good the food was too.  Tried the fish tacos and a "fun-guy" flatbread.  Both were very tasty.  A warning on the fish tacos, if you don't like cilantro you should avoid them.  I love cilantro so they were great for me, but wife despises cilantro and she couldn't finish them because the cilantro was overwhelming for her.    The only thing that kept it from being 5 stars for me was the noise level.  At times it was hard to hear my wife from across the table.  It wouldn't stop me from coming back, but just know what you are in for.

Phenomenal place with an awesome environment. The beer taps rotate often and it's everything I would drink. Every freakin beer! The wine on tap is perfect too. Great balance. The vibe is neutral and fits any generation. They have a wonderful main stay downtown and this place is where you need to be. Don't think twice if you are downtown. Angels Trumpet is the bomb.

Had matador burger tonight spicy yummy. We also had another burger and the peanut butter pretzel dessert.  We have been here many times and always great service and food.  Bison hot dog,  the nutter,  all the apps. you really cant go wrong here   The beers change all the time so you never get bored. And they have the wine on tap so it's a reasonable price.    The kitchen DOES close an hour before the actual closing time , so be sure to make note of that.  Also, you wouldn't think it but they have a great sunset view from the patio.  Note the sunset time in PHX and don't miss it !!!! Cant think of any other ground level downtown place with a great view .
First time here and fall in love with this place. Great beer great food! What more can you ask for???
For a beer and burger place it doesn't get much better. Great draft beers, the Brewlee was on point and the house made ketchup was a nice bonus.

dropped by on a Sat night...had to wait 15 mins for a table so by the time I sat down I was a little peeved. from then on my experience was good; ordered a burger and a Flatbread accompanied by a couple of local brews. actually the food and beer was very good. if you want your burger cooked order it well done.  overall good experience.

very good..sometimes.. youll come across servers that wanna get rid of you if u like particulars and they dont see it your way..   the beer IS EXCELLENT! TRY to make it to special tappings when they have them.. you wont know unless you ask.. and the ones to  ask are servers that are seasoned and have been around awhile  and Thomas Brennaman the GM and Tap manager he knows his beer and how to please his guests.
Fantastic craft beer selection. If you like wings, you won't be disappointed with the "angels wings". Nice safe location downtown.

Cool place with lots of tvs and good food.  Went just before the Cactus Bowl at Chase Field and the place was really busy.  Nice place to chat and hang out with friends.  Looking forward to going back and trying more of the food and drinks.
A Phoenix favorite! Must try the tractor pizza, and if you're not in the mood for beer they have wine on tap.

Delicious food (The Chet! The Game On! The Chocolate Chip Cookies!), an outstanding beer selection, and a very friendly staff.  Unlike some of the other Yelpers, I found the beer selection process intuitive and the staff knowledgeable.  I'd recommend the tasting flight so you can sample 6 beers - for $9 a great deal.    The only thing I would change would be some sort of noise insulation as when it is busy, it can get really loud.  But an excellent place over all.   Go for weekend brunch!

Angels wins all around.   If you don't see a beer or a specific type you like (which I think is pretty hard) ask and 9:10 they'll recommend 1 that's close or they'll remember you next time you come in and they just might have it.   Food: 5 stars Beer: 5 stars Atmosphere: 4.99 stars (only dinged for .1 because it get's a little warm, but again it's Phx)  Enjoy it and try something you've never had before.

I travel all over the country and have eaten at lots of places. I have never wrote a review of anywhere, until now! This is the one of if not the best places I have ever eaten. Brewlee was amazing! On top of that service was just as good.

One of my top 3 places to go!  Excellent, ever changing beer selection. Loud enough where a loud child doesn't hassle others yet not so loud you can't talk.  Have gone with just my wife and had a blast and went with a group of 20 and had just as good of a time.  On our last trip, our server disappeared a few times for way too long, which was a bummer especially since we had a kid with a dirty diaper and had to get out of there but couldn't pay our bill.  But I won't hold that against the restaurant overall...the server seemed to be having her own issues.    Very diverse crowd, from retirees, to yuppees to hipsters, everyone seems welcome!

Come for the beer - keep coming back for the beer and the food!    Wide variety of craft beers, all on tap.  The menu is best described, I think, as 'Imaginative Bar Food'.  The Bison hot dog BLT on Flatbread is possibly the best sandwich idea it the world.  Friends had the Garden Pizza and raved about it.  The seasonal pop tart for dessert was extremely good too.  Reasonable priced with a great space indoors and out.  Dog friendly too!  Why 4-stars? 1. Service was spotty at times but I think it was just our server.  2. unless you are very knowledgeable about craft beers, do not expect a lot of help from the wait staff.  They have limited knowledge of all 31 varieties on hand.  So you could just guess and get something less than appealing to you.  3. This gives them room to grow!  It is my new favorite default downtown destination for lunch or dinner.
This is a cool place in a good location. Great beer and lots of selection. WAY too loud inside and the food is average to below average. Great place to meet for drinks if you can handle the noise.
Great food, amazing beers and good atmosphere. What more could you wish for! They brought out corn hole for the kids and a bowl of water for the dog. Love this spot.

Downtown Restaurant Rock and this jem Ranks way High on the list... must come and eat...Lol Amazing Beers on tap huge Wonderful ubscure selection...!!!   Well the  FOOD is a Haven for us Foodies !!! Eat On.... Tue...TV dinners so Great.& Fun

Downgrading a star. I'm here at least a couple of times a month. Since it opened, the quality of the food has just gone down. Service has as well. I've had waiters simply leave things at the table without trying to figure out who the order belongs to. I was hoping their bright start meant a bright future. They still look like they have an amazing beer selection, and the place itself is cool. But the food just isn't as good and service is suffering. I'm hoping for improvements!
I like the concept, and I am excited to have a good local beer bar down the street.  The menu is awesome, and the service is friendly, but they need some help with organization.

It was ok.  We got there about 9pm, place was busy.  Took about 5 mins to be acknowledged and about 5 more to place our order.  Waitress was nice enough but not overly helpful.    I asked about their draft wine, she replied it's draft wine.  Hummmm, I sort of figured that out already.  I was looking more for where it came from, house wine?  Etc.  My friends got beer and it was nice and cold.    I really hope it is in for the long haul.  It's a nice place to have downtown.  I think with a few tweaks here and there it could wonderful!  Fingers crossed!  .

One of my go to place these days if I'm looking to chug (I mean drink) some good beer. The selection here is one of the best I have found so far in the Valley and includes 20+ taps of a multitude of beer styles.  The offerings range from common year round beers and seasonals, to imports and some of the slightly harder to procure stuff (If only I had actually enjoyed that Bourbon County Brand Stout - woops).  Service is usually pretty quick even when crowded (as it can be on the weekends) and the food menu is delicious, sober or otherwise.  Definitely a fan of the wings, and spam sliders.  Need to try the tv dinners in the future.   They have a nice outdoor patio and seating area as well where you can enjoy a game of bags/cornhole.  Who doesn't like cornhole?  Honestly, if you are into craft beer or just beer-curious you need to try this place out asap.

Wonderfull joint. Kinda reminded me of a library walking up but inside far from it. Cool bar with huge beer selection. Nice themes for food on different days. Got the brulee burger with fried egg and sugar baked into the bun. Spectacular taste. Now that was a unique burger. Big, tasty, and sweet with arugula, onions and bacon. Definitely get that again. Huge portion. Had to share with the wife. Nice patio that allows dogs. Really enjoyed this place.

Angels received two stars only because it has a great draft beer selection.  Poor ownership/management decision to have last call @ 10:30 on a Thursday night and crappy acoustics ruin this place.  Downtown Phoenix has been dying to have a place like this.  So extend the hours of operation and install acoustics please!
Definitely stop in for TV dinner on Tuesday nights; as though the ever-changing draft list wasn't enough. Their wild game sausage is also tremendous.

I love the place. It looks like everyone comes here, no matter what's you age. You will see a college student and a retiree. I guess anyone will find a beer among 30+ available beers. The food is great. We ordered a couple of flatbreads and those were great. I can't wait to taste other things on the menu....

We were looking for a place with outside seating and followed the yelp reviews here. We all really enjoyed our meals (oddly we all got mexican: guppy (fish tacos), chet burrito and verde tacos). All were excellent. There was one item of our meal that was hugely disappointing however. There was a specials menu and Thursdays was tater tots. Not something we'd normally order, but for some reason it just sounded good to all of us. First off, there were no prices. This always annoys me when restaurants don't put prices on a menu. We asked the waitress who 'thought' they were $8, but assured us it was a big basket. They were small, but tasty, and for our party of 4 we'd guess we each got about 5 tater tots. She was right, it was a big basket, unfortunately there were hardly any tater tots in it.

Wish I could say something about the food or drinks, but the staff and manager were so incredibly rude to our large party that we left. We work in a large office nearby, and we routinely go out in large groups. Most places are very accommodating because they want the business- here, the manager acted like he was doing us a favor by allowing us in his restaurant. None of us will be back, and we're telling everyone in the office not to go here. Also, on a side note the bathrooms were disgusting.
Fantastic quality of food and beer. This is perhaps one of the best reasonably priced drinking establishments in Phoenix.

Great spot downtown PHX! Great number of drinks on draft.  Fish tacos were super good. Others in my group got the Old Fashioned Burger and the Pork Grilled Cheese. Fantastic food all around. Great location. Staff was friendly.  I will most certainly be back! Great job Angels.

I tried it for a second time... and yep I still hate it. The beer list is confusing - good beer but confusing, the ambience is atrocious, and the bartenders have a lack of knowledge about the beer. This place is very disappointing.

I wish there was a 2.5 rating on here. Let me start with the positive our server was super awesome and knowledgeable about beer as well as really friendly. If I were to rate the place strictly on the service it would be an easy 5 star review, however there were some things that just didn't measure up.    We found a table outside and the weather was perfect, so that was a plus. We proceeded to order a "flight" of beer. Which was 6 different samples of selections from the 25 plus handles that are rotated frequently (I think daily, but I could be wrong on that). Here is the first part of the reason for the 2 stars. There are 2 boards to read the selection of draughts that are being featured, and a menu that describes what each of the types of beers are for example  A "Lager" is..... or A "Stout" is..... However there is no correlation that I could decipher that would tell you what "type" of beer that the featured name stood for, so let's say number 22 on the board was Witte...If you are a beer rookie there was no way to know what type it was. This causes one of at least two dilemmas, you can either 1. ask the server what type of beer each of the 25 or so types are (which...."Ain't nobody got time for that" :)  or you can play a little "Russian Beerlette" and just hope for the best, at any rate there are some specific types of beer that I just do not enjoy, and I didn't want the server to have to reel off all of the specifics of each beers that was on the board. I love the idea of the constantly rotating types of draught, but they need to figure out a better delivery system for the patron. The other part of the review was based on the appetizers that we had, one of which was the pretzels. Maybe I am americanized and have been spoiled to food a certain way, but I like my pretzels soft all the way through and really doughy (if that's a word) and theirs just weren't that. The pretzels were not very moist and the selection of cheese and mustard was ok at best. I really hate giving two stars, but I gotta be honest about my experience.  Great concept, great server, poor execution....I might try again in a few months and see if they changed anything.

Great place: Nice selection of local brews. Really great to find a bar that doesn't sacrifice food quality. Four of us ate there and everything was excellent: guys raved about the burgers! Angel wings and avocado salad were also yum.  Only drawback was that the apple strudel could have really used a nice scoop of ice cream. Oh, well.
Great food highly recommend this place to lots of friends. Everyone has enjoyed it so far. I wish they were open for lunch I would eat there more often!

Unfortunately, my review will have to be brief, as was my visit.  My lady, kid and I were in town for the Thanksgiving holiday and made plans to meet up with a friend at Angel's Trumpet (his suggestion).  We only had a little bit of time, which sucks, because I feel like we could have spent all night there.  The beer list was impressive, and featured a number of top-notch brewers that we can't get in our current hometown due to distance/distribution limitations.  I was able to select one brew I hadn't had before and one of my favorites that I can rarely get...and it was on nitro.  Good Lord, it was beautiful.  It was like angels singing...or blowing trumpets or saxophones or something.  I was pleased to learn that they rotate selections rapidly, I'm sure that if I lived nearby I would spend plenty of time there finding new beers to love.    The atmosphere was awesome, the patio area was comfortable, and the appetizers we had were quite tasty.  Though our visit was short, our experience was very positive.  I will go back the next time I'm in town.

Had a red basket special (catfish poboy) and it just melted in my mouth ! And the tots were perfectly fried and the sauce was delicious. First time here, will be coming back for sure. Plus the waitor was very pleasant and informative.

Everything was great except the service. Hostess was unfriendly and the server even more so (Micah). Probably the most impersonal and stand offish server I've ever had. Grilled cheese was awesome. Fun ambiance. Unfortunate service.

The beer selection is hard to top & the freshness of all of them is amazing! You won't find crap in stock here! I had a red ale to start. Red ales are notoriously poor tasting as they are not very popular & sit too long(never fresh enough). This red ale was a game changer! Fresh, crisp & delicious. My boyfriend had a Belgian triple-also very good & fresh. We each had a burger. Mine was great & the fries were good too, just a lot to eat. His pork burger was a bit too rich for his liking, but he loved it, but his coleslaw missed the mark (fresh, but not exactly what you might expect coleslaw to be). The ambiance is nice, hipster/industrial type. I just felt it was a little less than welcoming (maybe too sterile). I will definitely come back & recommend it to anyone-especially beer lovers. Also, I can't wait for a Tuesday off to try their TV dinners!!!!

I really love the food, atmosphere and service here.   Sitting at the bar is a far better experience than at the tables.  Definitely go for Tuesday night TV dinners ($7 dinner, with $3 drink)... they have never disappointed me.   Love the deserts!  Very casual and fun place to go for dinner. I highly recommend this place to anyone.    The only meal I didn't like very much was the sausage plate.  The matador sandwich is my favorite.  But if I go on a Tuesday I definitely go for the TV dinner.  Burgers are also great!  Pizza is better at other restaurants, not my favorite thing here.  This pizza is more like flat bread.

Wow what a refreshing establishment in downtown Phoenix. Growing up here I never was very fond of going into urban Phoenix because there was not much going on, especially for quality young people.  Angels Trumpet is the sort of place you wouldn't expect to find in Phoenix, Arizona. It feels more like a chic-contemporary atmosphere of a more progressive city, Austin, San Francisco, Seattle...but in the desert!  I enjoyed the diverse (31) options of beer on tap, including the apricot cider. The menu had its roots in pub food but with a very refreshing and eclectic twist. The kitchen and chef clearly care about providing unique and high quality food. I ordered the 810 "sammy" with smoked turkey, bacon, avocado mash, and onions on toasted bread. The taste was phenomenal but there is nothing worse than eating a sandwich with parts without any meat. The corners of my sandwich were unfortunately all bread which was a shame because it had such an amazing smoky smell and taste.  My friend had a gourmet grilled cheese with a unique bacon-jelly, and she loved the taste. Our server Arika was very friendly, professional, and provided a great service  Overall I would like a little more consistency in the quality and presentation of the food, but it is one of the most unique, fun, and quality ale-house/restaurants in all of Phoenix. Definitely worth the visit. I will be going back anytime I am in the neighborhood.
It was good. The server was really nice, but nothing spectacular from other places we've seen.

25+ beers on tap and none are uber mainstream!  I love discovering hidden gems in the central/downtown area and this is my latest discovery.  My mates have been raving about this place and I finally found time to grab a brew with them.  The decor is your typical modern/hipster with a twist of vintage thrown in.  The bartender that night was a lovely young lady who I recognized from Roosevelt Bar (which is now closed).  She was very knowledgeable and gave me wonderful recommendations based off of what I normally drink.    In short, this is a great place to grab a brew and reconnect with mates you haven't had time to see.  I will be here again very soon.
You can't go wrong by going to Angels Trumpet. The staff is knowledgeable friendly and is a great place to have a beer. Come on down I'll be sitting at the bar.

After hitting up the food trucks at the Phoenix Open Air Market on Wednesday we went to grab some beers and dessert at this place. We had the apple pop tart, which was pretty flipping good. They change the flavors seasonally and had just missed the pumpkin one :( They have a rotating list of craft beers on tap which was pretty neat. And our waitress told us about the great brunch they have on Sundays! I will definitely be returning to try it out.

I remember being very excited when they were putting this place in a few years ago. I've been a few times over the years, and am not a fan.  The food is decent and the beer is plentiful, but the place has no personalty, or if it does it's a bad one. The huge patio is boring and kind of ugly. Service is so so. There are so many interesting and unique places downtown,  but this is not one of them. I'd be content to never go back. Still waiting for an actual local brewery to show up downtown.
Fun atmosphere. Good beer selection. Good food. But kind of a loud inside. I had the Churchill and it was very good.
6 flights of the sampler brew is the best way to go and try numerous kinds. Pork Animal burger is the best burger I've had. Definitely will be coming back.

I have been here twice and this place rocks. They have a fantastic selection of beer and the most amazing beer-battered fish tacos I have ever tried, The server was great and the ambiance is always nice.

Inventive food choices, fantastic beer selection, friendly fellow customers and receptive staff made this place my favorite Phoenix destination. And it does not seem touristy though located in a high traffic area.

Excellent beer selection. Any beer geek definitely check this spot out. If your looking for a bud light and a game your taste buds might explode here. But great atmosphere and nice TVs for games. Only reason I give a 4 and not a 5 is because the bartender was a little rude and never checked on us. Good thing another bartender was more than willing to help out when need be.

Amazing food. One of the best pizzas I've had in a long time. The Tractor with added jalapenos is crunchy, smoky, and just so good. The rotating beer list is always a fun scavenger hunt for new beer. Solid pizzas, great burgers, and unique beers. Count me in.

The beer selection is great and the food is delicious.  I had the best grilled cheese sandwich that I have ever had.  The ambiance is great all around with a great patio area, if you have little kiddos.

Pretty solid selection of craft beers Service is weak. Prices are too high.  As a home brewer and craft beer lover I was really exited about this place opening. Their selection of draft beers is pretty good, but on all three of my visits I experienced very poor service. Each time I've taken a seat at the bar and have had to flag down the bartender to ask for a menu and ask for a another round all while there has been only a handful of people in the place. I know that they've only been open a couple of months but this place needs to fix these issues if it's going to stick around. Come off your prices at least a buck for each specific pour and offer a happy hour. You're in the wrong locale to command such high prices.

I need to point out how accommodating the staff was . . .  I visited ATAH after the Strong Beer Festival; as you might imagine the place was a mad-house.  That's an understatement.  In fact, the line to the restroom was almost out the door.  Anyway, we were put on a wait for seating.  After about an hour we were notified that a table was ready.  It was the worst table in the place - the one RIGHT next to the line of people waiting to use the restroom.  My comment to them was a bit gruff - "hell no, I'm not sitting where I get to stare at drunk people's asses while I eat" (my apologies to the staff).  They didn't blink an eye or even once get a snotty tone.  They were very professional.  They put us back in the list and we were seated at a better table as one came available.  Once seated we were treated to fabulous service and amazing food.  I'm going back for sure.  Again, ATAH Staff - my apologies for being a difficult patron.  You handled it very well!

NYC prices in Phoenix? Nice idea but downtown Phoenix will continue to be second rate if this what is tolerated. Sub par customer service and food is lackluster. Been here 4 times now so I gave it more than a fair shake. You may ask why have I gone back then? My friends didn't believe me but we're all now in agreement. Another nice attempt that misses the mark in downtown Phoenix.

We have been going to Angels Trumpet since they opened. Let me tell you, this restaurant NEVER disappoints! I love getting a beer flight because, come on, they have sooooo many great options to choose from!  Every time we go, we start with the spam sliders. Oh my....so yummy! You have to try them!  Every dish we have tried, from the burgers, to the tacos to the hilarious t.v. Dinners are just really, really, really delish!!  This is a great spot for date night or out with friends. Grab a beer flight and enjoy the yummy food!!

Time to toot this ale house horn at Angels & Trumpets! While the ambiance could turn the music up a notch and open the dining area up, I was still pleased with the overall experience. The Avocado salad hit the nail on my taste bud heads but the homemade pumpkin pop tarts were the cherry on top! I see only bright things in their culinary future. Definitely would love to see some mural/art on the inside!
Celebrating two birthdays- the food was delish!  Meat pizza, green chili burro enchilada style and fries chicken  salad were all a amazingly! Definitely coming back

This place is great. They have a fantastic beer selection, there is always beers I had not tried yet. On any given day, there is typically around 25 different types of beer on tap. I prefer dark beer, like stouts and porters. They also can beers for you if you want to bring it home, called crowlers (32 oz. can). This pic is a chocolate porter called Achocalypse, definitely one of the best porters I have tried there. The food is ok. Not exactly your typical bar food, they have a good selection on the menu... I've had the Nutter, which is peanut butter, raspberry preserves, banana, marshmallow fluff & peppered bacon. Not bad at all. Definitely worth trying out.

GO TO THIS PLACE.  Tucked away in a little residential-esque building, Angels Trumpet Ale House is the coolest new place in RoRo to grab some brews. I went here with my older brother on a Friday after work and the place was popping. Strolled through the door (whose handle is an entire broomstick, wicked cool looking) and grabbed a table by the big bay windows over looking the patio. Not quite full yet but within 20 minutes the place was full and the patio was too. People really like this place. The beer was good, I got a cider and it was very tasty. We weren't THAT hungry so we split the Meat Treat  pizza and it was BOMB. The bacon was nice and crunchy and the veggies weren't slimy or overwhleming like they tend to be on flat bread pizza.   I cannot wait to go back here, especially this fall when the patio (which overlooks dowtown PHX) is nice and cool and enjoy plenty o drinks.
Staff takes pride of not caring.  "gives no ****s"  for service. Good burrito, tacos need to be three instead of two. If you are use to  attentive wait staff, go somewhere else.

Sat down at the exact time as the guy next to me, who was served promptly.  Had to flag down the manager to get somebody to take my drink order, and the place is only about one-third full.  Waitress, when she did come, got my order wrong.  Finally got my beer, Noche Dulce from Borderlands Brewery in Tucson.  It's a vanilla porter, and delicious.  Had a great conversation with another downtowner.  Enjoyed watching the staff serve beer flights.  Tried to go back later to take my daughter to dinner, but the kitchen closed at 10:00.  Too bad, because the menu looked interesting.
Good was AMAZING! My boyfriend and I went here for dinner one night while he was in town and came back for lunch the next day! Definitely get the hot mess!!!

Best burger place in town!  LOVE, LOVE, LOVE it!  I'm not a beer fan but my friends are and they are way pleased with the assortment of varieties available.  The crowd is urban hip and very attractive.  I have been several times and not had a bad experience yet!  Oh, and the French fries are to DIE for!  Mmmmmmmmm

This place is SO good. Found this gem on yelp and I am so happy I did. I couldn't pick between one of their popular burgers and their fish tacos. Ended up picking the tacos and they were GREAT. highly recommend.

Cute backyard area. Fish tacos 10 out of 10, I will be returning, honestly some of the best in the valley. Calling it a house made "poptart" does it a disservice, and I love poptarts. Flavor at the time was banana walnut, a la mode, and I'd likely hand over my first born for another. Needless to say, you should save room for dessert. Beef burger was beautiful looking but surprisingly bland despite the trimmings, we even got it with the egg.
31 different types of crafts on tap + some wines + great food what more can you ask for! Been here twice in less than a month, and will be def going back. Totally work a try :)
This restaurant is quite possibly my all time favorite.  Been coming here since they opened,  lots of great beer and the food is phenomenal!

I don't get it. OK the beer selection is great, beer is good. The place was packed when we were there, full, busy... The service was good, no wait at all, attentive. No issue there. But the food, is mediocrity a trend downtown Phoenix? The Chet was dry, untasty and spicy enough so you can't feel what you are eating, the avocado salad had a slice of avocado laying on dry tasteless greens. Just not good. Go for a beer with friends, yes. Go grab a bite and enjoy beer, no. Loved the setting though, great job on that. Went there with my date, wrong choice.

Love it. Hip indoor-outdoor bar/restaurant in downtown with loads of seating, 31 beers on tap and a good food menu.  The building is huge and its got a great modern feel to it with exposed brick and brushed concrete floors. There are lots of windows, so it feels nice and bright on the inside. There's a huge bar and loads of tables and hightops, but even late afternoon on Saturday this place was packed.  The outdoor area is fun, with Adirondack chairs and Bags, and an awesome view of downtown. And the outdoor patio area is dog-friendly! Next time we'll be bringing the pups!  With 31 beers on tap you're spoiled for choice. And they rotate the beers with some local and national microbrews, so its easy to try something different.   The menu is stocked with, interesting appetizers (spam sliders!), big hearty sandwiches and cheesy flatbread pizzas.   Will definitely be back!

The Cobra Bar & Angels Trumpet combo is hard to beat.  The Big Guppy fish tacos are the best fish tacos I've ever had.  Beer selection is endless.  The layout is nice, but can feel cluttered. Side dishes are a bit stingy too (I'm Korean, so I have higher expectations when it comes to side dishes).  The Big Guppy fish tacos are the best fish tacos I've ever had AND I'LL SAY IT AGAIN AND AGAIN.

This place has a really chill, almost a hipster feel to the place (normal for downtown PHX).  All the servers are "cool" and no one is in a big hurry.  We split this steak sandwich with fries and we also split a flight of 6 beers to get an idea of what we'd order as our "real" drink.  I ended up ordering the Old Chub (Scottish Ale) and it was dark and amaze balls.  I enjoyed the beer and the food was average but definitely homemade so I would say the quality is good (a little bland but nbd) instead of ketchup we got some tomato blend.  I personally would have just enjoyed the ketchup.  Someone dropped a glass and I swear they swept for like 20 minutes (hipster slow) The bathrooms are unisex and clean BUT---- it smelt like piss in there..... I dunno I think the urinal might be the culprit..  There are 31 craft beers on tap and I am a huge fan of craft beers.
Solid selection of beers on tap, and a great patio! Food...haven't loved any of the things i've tried (pizza, smoked chicken legs, grilled cheese).

Terrible service on Saturday 2/13 although the restaurant wasn't full. The beer was ok, food was ok. But we will not be back. Literally- we waited 15 minutes for the server to even acknowledge us. As more people joined our party, they also waited 15 minutes or more for him to return.  Also, the server was kind in splitting the check but then he did not return exact change... I did not appreciate this.

So far, so good... Friendly staff, clean... Beer for days... Pretzel (rolls) are tasty!! Custom beer flight.... Can't wait to come back and drink my way through the rotating board. Unassuming from the outside but the funs through the door... Get on in here!

Great food, great service, large selection of draft beers, will definitely be back. You can't go wrong with the Big Guppy or the Brewlee Beef Burger . This is definitely the place to go if you're downtown Phoenix.

Have been here several times and every time it's a hit....from the great selection in beers to the food. Everything is great.  We love the fact that it's always a different list of beers. Their hamburgers and fish tacos are delicious!  Their homemade pop tarts are great too...sometimes, that is all we have (and beer too, of course). Great laid back atmosphere, a great place to come hang out with friends or to have a date night. Love it!

If I could give a negative star I would. I have been three times and all three times the service was horrible. Tonight we walked out after not being acknowledged for over 15 minutes. I wish I could say the bartenders were hustling but they were actually chatting amongst themselves instead of looking for eager patrons.  Makes me very sad considering all of the great beers they bring in.  I will not be going back.
The animal burger and the fish tacos are amazing!!! Lots of beer choices but I'm there for the burgers! The putine is pretty good too.
A great spot for beer lovers! So many beers to choose from and you can make your own sampler.
I have only been here when it is really busy. I have been happy every time. The food is good and you can't beat their crazy selection. Great place.

Great food, service & atmosphere! I brought my in laws & out of town guests tonight, we all had a wonderful time! Good variety of beer, outdoor seating while we waited for a table was perfect, very comfortable. The service was excellent; knowledgable, accommodating & friendly staff! The food.... Wow.. Worth writing a review about! as a group we chose everything from the hot wings to sausage plate for apps. Main course: grilled cheese, burrito, pizza, fish tacos & cheeseburger! All items were rated A+ by my family! I felt like a hero bringing them here! This is not your average bar food, the flavors, seasoning & creativity in each meal were great! My personal fav: Churchill grilled cheese w/ bacon jam. Yum.  Highly recommended for any gathering! :) we will be back!

31 taps and probably the best mix in Phoenix. Food was fresh and delicious. Wings are oven baked, awesome! The big guppy, fish tacos were breaded with the right consistency and the fish was fresh. I will be back!

Beer and Pop Tarts! That's all.  Well, ok the other food is good but not great. The beer selection is impressive with a wide enough variety to offer something for everyone. Patio is nice but just a bit on the urban sparse side. Overall, a great place to compliment a casual evening out.

terrible first experience! Dirty kitchen crew outside smoking in an apron I could see the filth from where we parked a block away. No one greeted us while we wondered around trying to figure the place out, as several employees walked past us some even making eye contact. After figuring out it was seat yourself, again first time in, we waited for a very long time for service. Contemplated going elsewhere, decided to stay and then figured out what we were going to order for both appetizer and lunch and read most of the beers on the board...still no server! Decided to go to Pita Jungle for lunch where we had a great time, great food and above all great service!!

Loved this place. We went with friends a while back and everyone had a good time. Liked the set up, the atmosphere, ect. My husband and I split a few appetizers and a sandwich because we always try a bunch of things on our first visit somewhere. Nothing was a let down; we liked all of it and that's saying a lot from my picky husband. We went while I was pregnant and I was super bummed I couldn't try any of the beers after I saw the huge selection. My husband got a flight though and I thought it was clever how the glasses are served in cupcake/muffin tins. I've been really wanting to go back since and try some of the beers myself and the homemade pop tarts.

Stood there with mouth agape perusing the chalkboard again, again and again.   The pressure to choose the right beer... no, make that the perfect beer!  Do I feel like a larger today? (yes)  IPA (yes) Amber (yes)  Stout (yes).  With thirty some craft beers and wines on tap, beer drinkers are frozen with indecision which probably is annoying for the bartender.   You just can't go wrong here --  you just can't.  The problem is both good and bad: the kegs are constantly rotated so you can never develop an affinity for a favorite beer (bad) but you're always discovering new beers (the good).  I never met a beer I didn't like.  Any rate, I stopped in for lunch and a beer.   Today, I ordered the Big Guppy tacos and wow!  4 good size strips of beer battered cod in two tacos with slaw, guac, salsa and some killer beans!  With food though, you can establish a favorite and the BIG GUPPY is now my favorite and comes highly recommended!  Then again, the Wild BLT wrap is  a hard one to kick to the curb.     Oh yea, that one beer become 4 or 5 as conversations at the bar are easy to start and difficult to end -- especially with all that good beer flowing!  Kind of reminds me of the public houses back in the midwest -- (those with fish fry fridays!)

Was really excited to try this place.  I'm a big fan of German, Irish, and Belgian beers so I was convinced that I would really enjoy my experience here.  I came with my wife and a few friends and decided to try the beer flight.  Unfortunately most of my beer choices were unavailable.  How annoying.    On top of that the service was sporadic.  Ordering took a really long time because the cranky server was always buzzing by our table, but never stopping by.  The beers I ended up trying were just so so.  Another problem with Angels is that I actually enjoy talking to people, which at the decibel level maintained in the ale house is pretty much impossible.  Due to the awful service I chose to decrease the tip for the server.  Probably to about 10 percent, which considering the service was generous.  The server then had the hutzpah to follow me out and ask me if I had a problem with the service and ask for more money.  I complained to management about this, but they did nothing. Suffice to say, I will not be back.

Amazing place, no signage so you might miss it. It's nice and open inside, great selection of craft beer and the food is to die for. Betsie Boop was our waitress she provided great service and recommended the Brûlée Burger, hands down the best burger I have ever had. Will definitely be going back.

The rotating tap may be the best part of this place. They never are low on beer and if one runs out, it is always replaced with something just as yummy but maybe a different style, so your pilsner you had an hour ago may have become a Stout. If you like or well, love beer and want to try more? go no further. I really like the layout of the beer wall and the choices seem endless and they always let you sample, cheers to that.

Normally I go here on Tuesday for the special they run with the TV dinner. This time I went on a Thursday for something different. The food, as always, was amazing. Get a flight of beer, having to choose from 30 craft beer is hard and the flight lets you try lots at once. The service is always friendly and fast.  Love this place and you will

FOOD People are griping about the creative license the owners took with the names of their food, but my issue is over the fact that it is almost always tepid. I don't know if it's the server's fault or the cook(s) not timing things correctly but I don't think I've ever had a sandwich/burger that seemed freshly cooked.  Two or three weeks back, I dined with a friend and he ordered one of the "specials"- some sort of veggie sandwich that had decent ingredients but the different flavors just didn't go well together. I don't think he even ate half of it.  As a heads up, they make their own 'house' ketchup and if you don't like the taste, you are SOL since they don't have store-bought ketchup.  BEER Maybe people love how often they rotate their beers but I'm not made of money and can't hit up their place every 2-3 nights for their $6+ beer. I'm also not really a fan of how their beer menu is presented- the bar area doesn't need to be that crowded. If they had a weekly rotation, they could print out weekly beer menus. My favorite bar in IL did this and it worked out just fine. Maybe learn how much beer to order or be okay with not having 31 'flavors' at all times?  Also, people rave about how amazing having flights are (really?), but I don't think it's a really good deal. The pours for the flights are about as much as the pours for a sample- if you're with at least one other person and you both get 3 samples, BAM! a free 'flight.' Increase the pours on your flights, or decrease the pours on your samples, otherwise it is infinitely cheaper to keep saying "Can I have a sample of X, please?"  SERVICE Not consistent.  I'm not sure how many have actual beer knowledge but I'm betting they use the 'beer list' as a crutch. I get why they have the beer list as I'm sure they don't want to answer annoying questions over and over but this is the ONLY place I've been to that does this and I would honestly prefer a beer menu and use google if the server can't answer my beer question.  OTHER I've been here a handful of times; twice when it was really busy (2nd night they opened and the grand opening). What you'll take-away from your experience is how incredibly LOUD it is inside, whether they're crowded or not. They need to invest in some dampeners or something, and considering how much they charge for their beers ($6 is the average, a few $5, rounded out with $7 and up), I'm sure they can afford it.  While I like the idea of their TV dinner night, I went once and the experience was lackluster. It's on the patio and the screen is TINY. Unless you're in the first 'row' or two of tables, you won't get a good viewing experience. In addition, you can't hear anything. I thought they'd have it streaming on speakers or something, but no. So if you're expecting to watch a movie, expect to be ignoring it instead.  I love their mural. It's maybe my 2nd favorite in PHX (after the 'illegal alien' sombrero one on Calle 16, also by Lalo Cota).  They don't currently have a happy hour but they do have a 'Ladies Night' on Wednesday. $1 off drafts.  They don't allow smoking on the patio. However, their patio is dog-friendly although I've yet to bring my dog since I live walking distance to the Main Ingredient (they have all day happy hour on Sundays and Mondays! $2.50 drafts, folks)  I expect I'll bump my review up to **** stars eventually since I really like the appearance of the place and the beers they bring in. Maybe after I get a hot sandwich?

Took the wife on the evening date. Ordered the outlaw bun, spam sliders and angel wings. All mediocre at best. The wings were exceptionally dry almost burnt. Despite the average food. Atmosphere and presentation was great. I love the setting of angels trumpet but the food probably only taste good after youve downed a few beers from thier awesome bar and draft selection.

Some serious love went into this place and you can feel it.  Huge outdoor patio to swill some good brews (along with a nice, simple, sleek inside space).   Go...drink...be happy and support the local folks who played the part of Santa Claus and stuck this awesome gift under our collective Phx Xmas tree.  The evolution of downtown Phx continues.  BOOM.

GREAT food, great service, great beer selection.  We had a lot of fun and, if i lived here, would totally come here all the time.  Definitely the spot if you like better quality food and craft beer.  Not too expensive either... about $30 bucks for 2 beers, an an entree and an appetizer.
Excellent food!  Excellent beer!  Good prices!  Full of good looking but not pretentious people!  A home run on what an ale house should be....

Angels Trumpet is a great spot to grab a drink with friends and kick off a night downtown. Table service is sometimes a bit slow, but they have a huge selection of rotating drafts, and every Tuesday they do a TV Dinner that gets you a full meal including dessert for roughly $8. They are able to accommodate large parties as long as they have a heads up, and have been the landing spot for the No Pants Light Rail Ride the past few years. Go!

Despite the reputation that downtown Phoenix is an afterthought for going out, Angels Trumpet is a refreshing reminder that the downtown area is actually vibrant and full of choices. The revolving draught selection makes each visit unique. On top of that, the kitchen provides both fun (TV dinners, anyone?) and trendy takes on traditional dishes.  The big sell to AngelsTrumpet is the thirty ever-changing beer options. As soon as a keg is tapped, a new and often drastically different brew replaces it. I have some bars to go to for "the usual" and I have Angels Trumpet to explore lesser known breweries.  I have on multiple occasions also gone with the beer flight. Given the vastness of the beer board and my own unfamiliarity with smaller breweries, for a very reasonable price you can order six three-ounce beers.   The beer and atmosphere speak for themselves. Have a drink at the bar, at the table, or outside on an Adirondack chair. You can't go wrong!

Wine on tap... All California.  Can I get an AZ option?  Beer selection on fleek.  Big guppy tacos- beyond delicious!  Nice crispy hot fish with a spicy Slaw served on the side.    Saturday night at 10:30pm we sat at the bar and enjoyed the casual ambience. A tad noisy but appropriate for the time & setting.  Walking distance from the Nash & across the street from Film Bar.

i was torn about this one...we were looking forward to the craft beers and wines on tap. i was underwhelmed by the wines. i was also surprised that they served both the malbec and the imperial stout cold instead of room temp... the salads we had (avocado and cobb) were awesome...my friend was underwhelmed by his flatbread pizza...found the chicken dry...it was fun to try something new, but next time, we'll probably try another new place rather than returning here...another thing, it is wicked LOUD in the restaurant...the acoustics are out of control. you're far better off sitting outside...
Awesome beer selection, location and ambiance. Food is not the best but that's not what this spot is focused on.

My hotel recommended Angels Trumpet because most restaurants were closed for the night.  But they are open til midnight.   Staff was friendly, they had a big beer and wine selection.  And my burger was one of the best I've had all year!
Great beer selection.  The wings and sauce were out of this world.  Cool restaurant.  Loud inside on a busy night.

Great food, enormous beer and wine selection. Wings here are amazing, but also like the fish tacos and pretzel buns (rolls?). Really into sour beers right now and they usually have one (sometimes two!) on tap. Alway fun to check them out. Service can sometimes be great and other times slow. Thought its typically only slow during the usual busy crowd times (Fri/Sat night) and week day evenings are much, much better.   Love the huge patio!

Hmm. Really struggling to decide what to rate this place. That said, here are the highlights.  The building is really cool. Open concept with wood, tile, and brick. The beer selection is large and rotates during the night. Crowd as good as well. Pretty crowded.  Taking all that into consideration here are the lowlights.   The staff does not seem to be very knowledgeable about the beers they serve. Our waitress said that one of our choices was good choice. When we asked what was good about the beer she followed up "I am not sure. I have not actually tasted that beer". Just odd. Also, the system by which the update the beer list is a bit slow. We asked about a few beers. They turned out to be out of them.   All in all, I would definitely go back. Hopefully, they get the kinks worked out of the system.

Food was Ahmazinggg!!' Britney our server was awesome! Came for a quick trip visit and love trying new places! Found it on Yelp and love it! Great atmosphere  we had the summer special shrimp scampi flatbread so refreshing light and tasted phenomenal! Va-va-verde brisket tacos so flavorful, homemade chicharones. Best was the wings couldn't help ourself they were a perfect blend of sweet and spicy. Had two beers and they were great! My favorite was the homemade poptart!

Fantastic beer selection - the bartenders will make great recommendations and let you sample any beers on tap. I had the va-va-verde with brisket and it was good bar food in a great atmosphere. Will definitely go back when in town

The food was very good.  I've been there twice and had the Matador (roast beef sandwich) and the paisano pizza.  Both were fantastic.  The beer selection is amazing!  A chalkboard covering an entire wall behind the bar lists the current offerings.  About 32 total and I've tried 12 so far.  Get the flight of six samples of your choice.  They are busy so be prepared to grab a beer and wait for a table.  But the wait times really aren't too bad.  I'll be making this place a regular stop.
A Haiku Review of Angels Trumpet Ale House:  Attention beer nerds: This is your official bar. I'll see you there soon.
Great place to get your drink on!  Great outdoor seating and some badass choices of beer. B

I went back - this place consistently under scores.  No knowledge of beer from the waitstaff.  Takes 15 minutes to realize the beer you ordered is tapped out.  Busch League.  Patio still lacks lighting.  I won't be back sober.   Look:  Place is well done and I liked the clean look to the taps and backsplash.  Very loud, to the point where you're shouting to the person across the table.  Once the weather improves, opening the doors to the patio will help the noise.  Does this place have lights out on the patio or was it closed?  People want to sit outside at night if the weather is reasonable.  Beer:  Overpriced.  Local brews (4 Peaks and Lumberyard) were $6/pint while everything else was ~$7-9.  Yes, craft beer is more expensive but not everyone is willing to pay that much for a few beers.   Food:  Very tasty, diverse and I thought they could even increase prices.  The 810 was great.  Overall:  I've been looking forward to this place opening for a year now and was let down.  I'll go back in a few weeks, hopefully the bugs are worked out.  If they don't improve, I'll just buy a 6 pack of good beer for $10 and sit on my patio, which has lights.   Also, not sure if they have a happy hour but they need one.

OMG - I hate writing this review for I've heard so much about this place!  We've been meaning to check out this place since it opened especially since the Roosevelt had closed.  We had family visiting over the long Columbus Day holiday and needed a night out with just the two of us especially since it was my birthday!  We even left Grandpa at home to try this place by ourselves!  When we arrived we walked into a "please seat yourself sign."  Hard to "seat yourself" when the place is packed.  We finally was offered a table at the back per a group who graciously gave up their table for friends who were a no show.  This was a table with a perfect window view of behind the scenes of the keg taps.  We waited about 12 minutes or so before a "waiter" felt bad for us to ask if we had ordered yet.  We asked for a drink menu only to be told we should have either looked at it on the way in or take a step outside to see it!  We told him what we wanted to drink and he said he would do the best to match our needs.  We get our drinks and the menu looked good and we figured out what we wanted to order but then another 15 minutes went by without any waiter attention and we decided to head off to another local place that we knew we would get better service.  We were forced to simply leave a $10 bill on the table for no one every came back to check on us and we promptly made our way to the door!!!!  I don't think we will be making our way back here anytime soon, we really should give this place a 1/2 star but we liked what they did with the place ;o).

Smoky wings, Outlaw burger, grilled cheese, ginger beer and a poptart were all great choices!Nice portion sizes and great covered open air sitting. Would definitely return. Husband's only complaint was No Titos! (But this is an ale house!)

Amazing!!!!  We first ordered "the mess" which is basically poutine and so delicious! They definitely do not skimp on the portion size. We could barely finish half of it, but so good  My husband ordered fish tacos as an entree which he loved and I ordered the Churchill with bacon and a side salad. Delicious! Our server was Jake (name on ticket at about 7:45-9pm on Friday 8/18). He was so friendly and attentive and I'd love to have him every time we come back, he made the first experience for us memorable. I LOVE friendly staff (I was a waitress for 5 years).  Food arrived very quickly and was just like we ordered. Very cool place that I felt was non- judgmental... Come as you are. Love this place! We will back soon

One of the newest places in town and it's already one of the best.  The beer selection is most impressive and the largest I have seen in Phoenix.  Some local, some independent brew and lots from Germany and Belgium.  I'm told the selection will always change a bit.  When one keg runs empty it will be replaced in back with a different selection on hand.  Expect to see some variance each visit.  The food menu boasted some interesting selections and they've made an effort to put unique selections or spins on traditional bar fare.  I tried the Spam sliders.  They were okay but that's all on me.  I learned I did not care for Spam too much.  Went for something new and wasn't too pleased but I live and learn.  I know there are items on the menu I would surely enjoy.  Service was great: quick and friendly.  To top it off, Angels Trumpet Ale House sells growlers!  Awesome.  Come in and enjoy and leave with a growler of your favorite beer.  Keep in mind the growler selection may not be open to everything on the menu.
