Located across the street from FilmBar, this is in a great location and can easily be incorporated into a fun night out.    Angels Trumpet Ale House will become one of my regular haunts along with FilmBar and Revolver Records.

I went here opening day late afternoon, met up with some fellow beer freaks. Overall I'm pleased! Building marking signage is on the south side wall, and parking is available in the dirt lot next to that wall as well as limited parking up front. Furniture is simple butcherblock tables, well laid out. The beer bar has a large chalkboard above it, 31 taps and several wines. Music is there, but not loud at all. Room acoustics might use some work, it gets a little loud in there but hey what do you expect with a house full of yapping beer freaks?!   Good variety of beers, offering the major breweries we already know such as Deschutes, Odell, Warsteiner (Dunkel), Epic, Sam Adams (a new style!), New Belgium, Green Flash, and more. Kegs blow all the time and something different is put on. Beers are priced $6,7,8. Snifter served for high ABV beers, PROPER TALL PINT glass for regulars and tulips for Beligian styles. No American "pint" glasses which actually serve 12 oz. plus head, those are for ice water.   **** INSIDE SKINNY:   The place has an outdoor patio out back, and now that the weather is getting cooler IT'S SUPER NICE OUT THERE for sunset and after. In fact it's really nice for a date with a candle on the table. Get one on the rear edge of the patio rather than near the door, it's quieter.  Sampler flights are available for a fair deal! Pick 6, write the tap numbers on the paper, and they'll be delivered in a muffin tray oriented with the paper!   So now on to the food! Yeah get ready.  The menu is gourmet scrumptious, and I CANNOT WAIT to try some of those things! These dishes have flavor combinations that will blow your mind just by reading them, and the choice WILL be difficult. You'll just have to convince yourself you'll try the other dish next time.  My recommendations:   The Chet: ($8.50) - Tortilla stuffed with fries, chorizo, black beans, roasted corn,  grilled chile peppers, chihuahua cheese, adobo sauce and crema. I saw this one, nice grill marks on the tortilla. SPICY.  The 810: (sammy,$8.50) Shaved smoked turkey, peppered bacon, avocado mash, pickled red onions, adobo sauce, side of pickled jalapeno long slices. Choice of side - I recommend the fries, they're flavorful and perfectly done.  Meat Treat Pizza: ($10) 10" Flatbread pizza with peperoni, sausage, smoked bacon, LEEKS!!!, smoked mozz, roasted tomato sauce. Saw this one, the toppings just POP at you! Nice size too!  Warm Sausage Platter: ($10) Wild game!! Brat! Chorizo! with mustards and relishes. This comes out and it's SPECTACULAR.  Haven't had the burgers, but they look and smell scrumptious. My friend had the Southwest Burger.  I guess you can see what flavors I like, haha. Leeks for me ANYWHERE are a pleasant surprise as well.  Based on the most recent visit, I now upgrade to FIVE STARS! Very attentive and accurate service. My friend's iced tea was never neglected, and our large party was checked on every so often. (Gratuity added automatically for larger parties. 6 or more?)  So.... give this place a try, I think you'll be happy. After work for dinner would seem to be the best time before it gets too packed.  Nevermind Hungry Monk, EAT HERE.
Fun spot!   Tractor pizza is amazing!!
Great atmosphere, nice list of beers, and some tasty food.  I got the guppy tacos, and they were great.  Two huge fish tacos, cooked perfectly.  I will definitely return next time I'm in Phoenix.

My dad picked this place cause of its variety of beers. I wasn't expecting much cause I'm not big on beer. I was pleasantly surprised... their food was delicious. My dad had the wings and I had their Farm Flatbread and homemade strawberry poptart for dessert and it was all scrumptious. Only down side is they have a small parking lot and I'm not familiar enough with the city to know any close parking lots. So worth trying to find a spot to check this place out though.

Great food great beer, service is a little slow at least when I usually go which is late so maybe it is not like that all the time. It has an outdoor space that has great atmosphere. I usually get a flight of beer because they have so many. Servers are very educated on the beers they offer. I have had quiet a few of their dishes and don't really favor one over the others everything is really good and has a slight variance to what you would usually find in the exact same item elsewhere.

Can be a very loud atmosphere, but absolutely amazing selection of beer and the food is awesome.  Tried some very hard to find and some amazing beer here.  The best part of this place though is not something I would normally try; spam sliders. Absolutely amazing and cheap. Normally go in with some buddies, get some beer and sliders and it's normally a completely reasonable tab at the end of the night.

Saw this place listed in the AZ Republic as one of the ten best new places in 2012 and decided to check it out.  We sat at the bar and had a flight of misc brews.  Thought that was fun. Some we liked, others not so much. There is a great selection and I would like to return.  The atmosphere is upbeat and simple. Loved the keg pendant lighting along a row of tables and the patio. The place was busy on a Wednesday night, most patrons in their 20's/30's. The location is ideal. The menu was eclectic. The recommended Mastadon sandwich was boring although the fries a winner. The bison hot dog was delicious although the accompanying coleslaw a miss.  It was pretty on the plate with craisins and feta but dry in the mouth with no dressing or herbs. Next time we will enjoy a few beers and skip the food.

I live within spitting distance of this place and I love it. It's just a great place to come, drink some strange beer, eat some unique food and chat. The staff is always extremely competent and knowledgeable about beer, though they don't small-talk much as the place is almost always packed! The owners are consistently there working along side their staff, and they take a lot of time to speak with regulars and make sure the service is on-point. The husband/wife team run a tight ship and their love of this business definitely shines through.   If you ask me, the only problem with the place is that the inside chairs are pretty uncomfortable, but I usually sit at the bar so it doesn't really matter.   This is the type of business that helps a city grow and gain character. A beautiful, clean, professional place with good service at a great price. I'll always be coming back.

NEVER GO HERE! WAITED AN HOUR TO BE SERVED! SNOOTY WAITER!  So my last review, though strongly worded, was pulled down by Yelp. When I inquired why, no one responded so I am reposting this review because I value your time and money just like I do my own.  I arrived at Angel's Trumpet at 10pm to meet friends. I am always leery of new places my friends pick. They just show up without checking reviews or they listen to bad reviewers who rave about the place. Angel's Trumpet was bad except for the Beer selection which is exciting.   After ordering my first two beers at the bar the waiter showed up and asked what I wanted at 11:00pm! An hour after I got there. When I said I was starving and wanted food I was informed that the kitchen was closed. I was busy socializing with fellow medical school classmates that I have never been out with (we call it networking since these will be my colleagues) to notice the time so when the waiter (and that's what he made me do...wait) said the kitchen was closed I was shocked to see an hour went pass. I tried to order a round of shots and was told they do not have liquor. I tried to order a glass of wine and was told that they do not have wine. I tried to order a beer and was told they were closing in 15 minutes. I asked for a beer menu and was told that they do not have menus. WHAT DO YOU HAVE! I was informed that I had to go up to the bar and read the big chalk board behind the bar for the beer selection. I pointed out, if I have to go to the bar to read the beer selection then why would I bother coming back to order through you when the bartender is right there in front of me!  I grew up in the restaurant business so I know circumstances are all based on timing. I saw the four star rating this place has so clearly many people like this place and have very good experiences. Maybe it was bad timing, but for me the waiter was an HOUR LATE, THERE WAS NO MENU, AND I WAS DENIED EVERYTHING I ASKED FOR FROM THE WAITER. To make it even worse the waiter copped an attitude because he is bad at his job. I have bad mouthed this place for a month now and I will continue to bad mouth this place to everyone I meet. Having Yelp pull down my review just angers me even more and I will now post on every site I can think of in the near future.  I never saw but one waiter maybe two that night. Way too little for such a big place.   IF YOU VALUE YOUR TIME AND MONEY STAY AWAY!

I have been here three times, and now feel compelled to write a quick review.  Visit #1: About a year ago, we were checking out a "new" place in our neighborhood. Beer was great, service was so-so, food was not good. The ambience was loud and lively, super hipster-friendly, and they have cool wooden tables. Nice, we thought; but the food sucks.  Visit #2: Gave it a second shot, figured we ordered wrong. Nope. Food sucked again. I like good pub food, and I like to try interesting combos like bacon & pesto, things marinated in beer, and gamey appetizers like buffalo meat or venison something or other. They have all these things, and we didn't like any. We ordered a few items, and the waiter said they were out of several ingredients b/c they were changing their menu. Place was still packed, beer flight was interesting.   Visit #3: We saw some killer pics online of their "tv dinners" and succumbed to our boredom and gave this place another try. Maybe the new menu was better, or they got a different chef or something. Nope. Food sucked again, and waiter was dull and silent. That's a grand total of around 4 appetizers, 8 entrees, and about a six-pack worth of crafty beers. Nothing great here food wise.   Tips: Stick to just getting beer. They have no ketchup, only a tomato-paste thing for your fries/tots. Wait staff looked like they would rather be across the street at Filmbar.

Yet another reason to spend time in downtown Phoenix.  As a 20+ year Phoenix resident, I never thought I'd want to spend fun time in downtown, but that's changed.  Many great places to go, and Angels Trumpet is at the top of that list.  One of the best beer selections in the Phoenix area.  Funky vibe, good service.  Food is good, but not great - otherwise I'd give it a try.  Once you go - you'll come back often.

Great place to go for some amazing food and a huge craft beer selection. I have been multiple times and I am never disappointed. They have great pizzas, sandwiches, burgers and a really nice atmosphere.

AWESOME! Food is great had a burger and flatbread, beer selection is great and the ambience is the best! My new favorite place! Next time I'll bring home a growler full of good brew! Everyone needs to go there!

My husband and I had a dinner at Angel's Trumpet for ~15 friends to celebrate our elopement. We came in at 2pm on a Sunday. It is an awesome space. Perfect open-air seating and spacious layout. As soon as we got there, the manager immediately started putting a row of tables together for us on their patio. Our server, Brendan, was clearly knowledgeable about the beers (noting their alcohol contents, nuanced flavors/characteristics, pairings) and provided polite and timely service. Our food was delicious! Brendan also gave my husband and I a FREE and absolutely scrumptious homemade pop-tart: chocolate cherry, so GOOD. I will let my photos speak for themselves. My *ONLY* complaint is that it was really tough to find an updated menu online. Their business website needs work. Other than that, I had a wonderful experience. Keep up the good work, Angel's Trumpet!

This place is great. Simple decor and casual. Love the 80s music! The Spuds Taqitos were amazing! I'm vegetarian and found plenty to eat. I give it 4 instead of 5 stars because they had the patio doors open, and we had to swat the fly's away. That sucked. Our server was great and attentive. We will come back!

Overall I give it a 5-Star. Food, Service, atmosphere, etc.Went in on a Thursday night (first time). Husband had the chicken sandwich and loved it. (he can't stop talking about it). I had the fish tacos. So good!. Trendy and a fun place to hangout. As the early evening went on, the place got really busy. I would say after 7, there may be a wait for a table. When we're back in Phoenix, we'll definitely stop in again.

Mat and Sharry Engelhorn have a big hit on their hands. Angel's Trumpet Ale House, so named because of the meaning of their last name and their passion for all things craft beer, is my new favorite place.  Service: Generally speaking, opening nights are fraught with disaster, poor service, and mediocre food. Not so with AT, everything was as amazing as I would expect it to be when the place wasn't jam packed with people. Our server was pleasant, pretty speedy, and explained a few details to us. She was in a hurry, but she didn't hurry us, and that's a really good thing.  5 stars for service.  Food: The FOOD! Oh yes the food was incredible.   I can think of no greater sin than soggy wings, but these wings were crispy and tender, with an incredible spicy buffalo sauce, and a delicious bleu cheese dressing. Instead of throwing a few carrot and celery stalks on the plate, they were made into a salad with a few radishes for spice and color. Let me say again, the wings are AMAZING.    My honey ordered the pizza with peppered bacon, sausage, pepperoni, and leeks - it was crispy, just enough cheese and sauce without being overwhelming, and the ingredients were amazingly high quality. I ordered the Southwest burger, and it was incredible. I love that you get to choose your protein - I chose beef, and the beef patty was moist and perfectly cooked/seasoned. My only "complaint" is that I wanted MORE Adobo sauce for a bigger kick, and maybe a bit more cheese, but those are easy modifications to make next time around. The burger bun was light and delicious, with perfect flavor to compliment the patty and toppings.   They also have featured seasonal dishes on the chalk wall as you walk in, and they sound absolutely incredible.  Dessert was fantastic and a fun play on childhood treats. We ordered the seasonal pop tart which was strawberry rhubarb, and it was delicious. The filling wasn't sickening sweet like a normal pop tart, and it was spread between layers of what looked to be a modified puff pastry or phyllo dough. The top was drizzled with a fantastic thin frosting, and finished with sprinkles of pink sugar for a playful and crunchy touch.  5 stars for food!  Beer: Their beer selection on tap is magnificent. So many beers I know and love, and many that I had never tried/heard of before. I tried two new IPA's and they were both splendid. The pour was great both times - one in a pint and one in a tulip, the head was perfectly poured with just the right amount and appropriately sized bubbles. Their beer folks know their stuff. 5 stars for beer!  Atmosphere: I loved walking up and into ATAH. The slump block building reminds me of my childhood home, and their metal grate dividers outside are genius and rustic. The inside perfectly blends the beauty of the wood rafters and block walls with bright colors, natural wood chairs and tables, concrete bar top, and tile backsplash. And you can't miss the massive amount of windows to let in the sun and the gorgeous sunset views. It was a true pleasure to take part in the best time of Arizona summers at this amazing pub. Oh, and I love that they have three unisex bathrooms, it is a nice relief from the standard multiple stall setup that precludes you from privacy in your most private moments.  5 stars for atmosphere  So that's 5 stars all around, and I only expect it to get better with age. I'm going back tonight, and maybe tomorrow, and definitely Sunday. I'll be here a lot., you should definitely try it.

Comfortable place, lovely outside tables, great for groups (esp groups who love craft beer!)  Our server seemed rushed, but all our orders were fine- their version of fish tacos (called the guppy i think) was crispy & hearty.  the ole fashion with grilled chicken was solid- a bit on the dry side, but it hit the spot.  the homemade poptarts are a fun thing to end the meal with- i took mine to go, just because i was charmed by the idea but we needed to get going- but hot with ice cream they would have been divine!  oh well, there is always next time- i'm sure we will be returning esp when any beer lovers come to town!  it would be easy to spend a whole sunday here, drinking, nibbling and talking!

We waited over an hour to get seated with a server that seemed completely annoyed that we were there. It's really sad that the service was so awful and unfriendly because the food was actually very good. I'm not sure I will be back though for some server who's job it is to enhance my dining experience, to roll her eyes and be "annoyed" by me. No thanks!

Updated Review (5 stars): Been here several times and it's earned 5 stars by now.  We've never had a bad meal here...in fact, the food is always top notch, service is good, environment exactly what we expect.  People we've gone with have mentioned that they like their beer (we still don't drink the stuff).  The Matador is always a staple and the vegetarian taquitos are great (we're not vegetarian).  We've also had the tacos and one of the other burgers.  Old Review (4 stars): This review is coming from people who don't drink beer. But we love the food! Have been here twice, and both times the food has been awesome. Big, quality hamburgers and brisket and the seasoning on the fries is great. Plus, who doesn't love homemade ketchup? We'll be back!

This has just become one of my favorite Ale House's/Pub's not just in Phoenix but in the world!  It's got a great vibe right in the middle of Phoenix's emerging Central City area with lot's of good beers on tap and great food - We visited last on First Friday and were expecting it to be crowded when we got there around 5 pm but it wasn't too bad - It did get busy later around 7 when we left though - Need to go back to try more of the food - excellent and well priced!

I'm very disappointed with the service. Small blonde hostess had a face that something piss her off! We sat next to entrance and every time someone came in she was not smiling just blank stare. Our server was also such a disappointment she look like she can careless if we got helped or not. The only reason I give this place two stars is because the guy with long blonde hair was super nice and attentive and I think he was the busser. So sad this place has the worst service it has a lot of potential to be great!

Don't know anything about the food.   The drinks are awesome! I would recommend this place to anyone. Their craft beer selection is outstanding. The enviroment during happy  hour and evening is great! It is walking distance to downtown and across the street from Phoenix downtown market.

We arrived at 5:30 on a Friday and it was not as busy as expected, given that it is also March and the height of tourist season. The place did begin to fill up by the time we left an hour later. We have had beer here before, which was good, but we were sticking to food and no alcohol tonight. I could have used a good beer to wash away the taste of one of the most foul-tasting salads I have ever had. The avocado salad sounded promising and I had high hopes. Unfortunately, it had a taste that my partner described as "stale beer." Yup. That was it. Something obviously went terribly wrong with the dressing. I left most of my salad untouched but our waiter didn't ask if I liked it or not. Come to think of it, we hardly saw him. I contemplated other meals I could have had for the $11.50 this lettuce monstrosity cost me while my partner ate her wings. Nothing special, she said, but she did appreciate having three different dipping sauces. Coke comes in a can so there are no refills and the iced tea tasted like the dregs of instant. Overall, it was a waste of $30.

This is another great addition to places to hangout in downtown phoenix. The owners are super nice and the space is great. Lots of excellent beer on tap and the food is really good. The even have a few Vegan options and they are very yummy.

If you love craft beer, this should be your go-to or a night out when visiting downtown phoenix. The ever-revolving selection of beers on tap and available beer flights make beer-tasting an adventure. If I had one complaint, it's the difficulty of finding seating for a group every time I've ever visited, even after calling ahead. This is a great problem to have, but it's a solvable problem.
Great menu choices. Awesome feel and vibe w descent service. Would certainly return. Loud interior for a Sunday night. Overall great place.

Stopped in here after hiking for a late lunch and beer. They have a great space! Indoor area is modern and open. Outdoor area is shaded and has misters to keep it cool. There are Adirondack chairs and corn hole available outdoors. Beer selection is large but was under-whelming in our opinion. We were trying to stay with local beers but the sign outside didn't have Brewery names or locations so you would have to ask the server for this information. We had the wings and a burro for food. The wings were AMAZING. Great sauce called moose drool that you must get. Finished up with the homemade pop tarts which were raspberry churro I believe and absolutely worth it. Parking lot was small but we got lucky getting a spot. There is parking around the area if you can't get a spot in the lot. Definitely worth checking out!
One of my favorite places! Love coming here for a laid back night with friends, to enjoy great food and awesome beer.

First time here the other night, and it will definitely not be the last!    The vibe is cool and I kind of felt that if I were a dude, I would have needed a gnarly beard or fancy mustache.  Tons of beers!!  Huge line of taps with numbers, so you are forced to read the large chalkboard above.  It was a little much for my brain, so I just asked the server to pick a tasty stout or porter for me.    I was pleased to see a decent amount of veg-friendly options (veggie pizza, veggieloaf sandwich, daily special with a veg option, grilled cheese).  I opted for the grilled cheese (I know...I like cheese sometimes, don't hate.) that came with pesto and tomatoes, fries and a side of house-made roasted tomato ketchup.  It was all divine. M'lady had the vegetable pizza, which came topped with lots of seasonal veggies (watermelon radishes, squash, fingerling potatoes, mushrooms, onions, and more).  It was equally as pleasing to the palate.  Our friends ordered the special, fish tacos.  Came with two tacos filled with fish and fried calamari and toppings, rice and beans.  Spicy, but very good and flavorful.  Back to the beers for a moment:  I only ordered the single bevvy, but our friends ordered a flight (any six beers of their choosing) and it came in a cute little muffin pan:)  Kudos all around from the decor to the food!  These folks know what their doing and I like it, I really like it!!

Great place. Have been here twice now while visiting Phoenix for work. Very good rotating beer list. There is always something good to try. The food menu is great too. Weekly specials and it's often not the norm. Get the spud tacos as an app for sure. If you go on a Tuesday and they have the TV dinner, get it!
Cool spot with great food and an amazing beer menu. It's become our favorite "I don't want to cook so let's go out" spot.

I have yet to have a bad experience and have been there plenty.... I would take any person here even if they dont drink, the menu is unique and delicious... The Tuesday TV dinner is a fun thing to do on a Tuesday night and the price is right ($10).  The beer taps are ever changing so you always can expect a new experience..  There is a lot of pride in ownership, everytime I have been one or both owners have been in the building walking the floor.  The staff can sometimes be aloof but never anything too bad and something that will be worked out over time and experience... A great time!

Quick beer and plate of fries, cheese curds and gravy. In Canada that's called Poutine, in AZ its called "the mess". Loud open atmosphere with a plenty of seating. Not stellar food, but plenty of beer options.

First time I came, some kind of beer fest was going on so place was packed! No space for me so I turned around and went somewhere else. Well I came back and really glad I did. Beer selection is awesome. I ate prior to coming so didn't order any food.  I did my usual which was a flight (6 beers here) and had the waiter select them for me. When I told him I was letting him choose, he told me I made his day.  He chose some really solid beers. And I finished with a 7th beer, a cranberry cider which he claimed was the best cider he's ever had. It was mean good. I think very close to one of the best ciders I've ever had also. Great choice for a great selection of craft beer. Will try some food next time.

Okay the food was good, delicious creations and vegetarian friendly. The only problem I had was when that huge Marmaduke dog showed up and a couple of the Waitresses/Waiters went to rub him. I saw not either of them go and wash their hands. That's the only reason they don't get five stars.
Great handles! Best pop tarts in the world. Lots of fun! The taps rotate often. The patio searing is okay. Overall a great place downtown

I can see how this place can be popular but they really skip over some details. The pizza was under cooked but the fish tacos were bomb, the beer was amazing but the bathroom was out of soap. Had my Pizza been cooked properly and the bathroom been stocked with soap I easily could've given this place five stars but those are two critical criteria's I judge a place on. So, if you're looking for a bar with pretty good food and yard games...bring your hand sanitizer and you won't be disappointed.

This place has a good selection of beers on tap. I really like that they change up the brews when one is tapped out. The food is also tasty especially the brewlee burger. They also have wine but I'm more about the suds. One of my to go places to grab a brew and have some good bar foods. Excellent place!

I'd had my eye on this place for a while and we finally got in to check it out this weekend.  Nice open area with a good sized patio too.  We sat at the bar to watch the Derby since we ran out of time to get anywhere else.  They had it on TV but without sound, oh well not a big deal.  We loved their beer selection and the bartenders were all on top of everything, helpful and efficient.  We had a great time and all the food coming out of the kitchen looked awesome.  We only tried their 'pretzels' which are actually just a few little loaves of pretzel bread, not the same but not terrible.  The stools are not the best and not very comfortable but in the end we enjoyed ourselves and were glad we got the chance to visit.
Always good food, but the beer is why we come here.  The beer and wine selection is great.  Would like a few more local beers and wines from bodega pierce would be a great added selection.

My friends and I came here for dinner, and we were shocked to have gotten a table for 6 instantly at 7:30 on a Saturday.   The atmosphere: Chill. The chalkboard with all the different beers they had is cool. The crowd seemed older (at that time) and was just hanging out. Our waiter, however, seemed kind of all over the place. We didn't see him much after our food order was taken; we had to wave him down because we didn't get two items and the table was more than halfway done with the food. He said later on that the kitchen or runner staff was new?? So I'm not sure who's "fault" it was. He tried to fix it by comping the app and giving a 50% discount on the entree. I guess at that point, what else could he do?   The food: it was ok. The burger wasn't anything special. My fish tacos were good, and I was thought the portion (2 pieces of fish per taco) was a generous ratio. But I didn't care for the fries, which appeared to be poutine - good thing they were free right, ha! The fries tasted kinda burnt, overdone...and that ruined it for me.   The beer: good things throughout the table.   Overall, maybe a place for beer and not a meal.
Great staff, food and beer. The beer selection is always changing and never disappoints. The food is great. Not the best but really good.

Found this a week ago, been 3 times. Food is great, service is great (kudo to Brittany, Betsy and Braden). So far we've had the "outlaw" burger, the ? burger the one with the fried egg on it, the flatbreads, the sausage snack, the pop tarts, the dessert flatbread, and the salad (the one with avocado). I didn't like the fries but my wife loved them. I loved the cole slaw...vinegar and oil dressing not mayo. We went on TV Dinner night (Tuesday)...fried chicken dinner - excellent.  We've asked them to "customize" things like the salad and they accommodated us 'no questions asked' happy to make us happy.   The beer selection is excellent ...on the downside, when the keg is empty, they move on to the next one. So we had the Scotch Ale (great!!) in the beginning of the week, but on our return it was gone...we were forced into another discovery ...we tried one of their 6 glass samplers...we picked the 6, and discovered a new "favorite!"   The clientele is a mix, old, young, casual, professional. Tables and chairs are basic but comfortable, inside or out on the patio.   Depending on the beverages ordered we've been out the door for $30-$50 for two of us on each of the 3 visits.

My friend suggested this place after the gun show last weekend. The burgers we're awesome me. Very complex yet the beef taste wasn't covered up. The beer was ice cold and the service was outstanding. I'll be taking the rest of the family to this place soon. The pretzel appetizer was very very good. They have some nice looking salads on the menu but when I saw the burger go by I switched it up. The buns are perfect. 5 stars for sure!

Rob was the best server we've had in a while anywhere. He's usually the bar keep so I guess we were lucky to get him for a table server. But that's ok I'll just follow him to the bar next time. Rob was pleasent, beer informative & then some. We had the wings which are delightful but if you're not a couple or don't like sharing dipping sauces then ask for extra. The wings were crispy perfection & hot (temp). Just great! We also ordered the warm sausage platter & boy freakin' howdy was it a platter. Definitely either getting one or the other next time but not both. Just a lot of food. We could have easily  shared amoung 4 people. However I'm happy to report 3 beers & an hour later we managed to get all of the meaty goodness down. Thanks Angels Trumpet Ale House for the great service, food & of course BEER! We'll be back.

stopped in for dinner last night. It was our 2nd time there since they opened. We previously just had some pints on our first visit but was looking forward to checking out some food. We ordered some flatbread and a burger. The flatbread came to our table 30 minutes later and it was cold. Our server was busy with other tables around us and did not even ask us how the flatbread tasted. We waited another 15-20 minutes and the burger never arrived. The server never did come back to our table to check on us which was pretty weak.  The co-owner noticed our frustration and approached our table. I explained the situation and she was very cool and apologetic although was making excuses about the horrible service.  The server finally came back to our table after seeing the owner talking to us (weak)....anyway, I asked the owner to comp the flatbread and bring the check for the brews we ordered.  I understand they are trying to work out the kinks with the kitchen problems but the server really dropped the ball and did not apologize. I was quite surprised when the bill came back to the table and saw the beer was not comped by the owner (we had 2 pints and a sample tray)... Before the bill arrived I had specifically stated to the owner it was our 2nd visit and how we wanted to come back again. I told her I was impressed with the beer menu and thrilled they had Saison Dupont on tap that evening. Anyway, I paid the bill with a $0.00 tip and we left...worst dining experience I have ever encountered in my life. I am hopeful with time they will be running an efficient kitchen but our server was piss-poor and the fact we had to pay for the beer after the fiasco with the food was unacceptable.

I have been back to Angel's Trumpet quite a few times since my original visit and they continue to improve!! The waitstaff has been very helpful and friendly, and although they (understandly) can't speak with authority about all of their beers, they were always willing to get me one of the owners - who are beer gurus - to answer my questions.  I finally got to try a sour/wild beer on tap!!   The weather is so nice this time of year, and I love it when they have their big garage door open - which also helps the sound level quite a bit.   The homemade poptart is a fantastic, fluffly, baked puffed pastry with delicious filling and cream cheese frosting - think a gormet toaster strudle.  The ketchup is very interesting since it is made in-house and its nice to actually taste that tomato flavor.  I NEED to try their fluffernutter (peanut butter + marshmall fluff) next.

Only gave 4 stars cause long tables are hard to get out of. The food was very good. We had pretzel bites with amazing mustard. I had tacos, very filling.my ding complains had the fish, grilled cheese. Very noisy but a great patio.

Picked this place based on the reviews from yelp while at a conference for work.  If you like scratch made food with eccentric ingredients you will love this place.  Hip clientele and a nice outdoor patio make this a great weekend, dinner, lunch or weekend eatery.  Beer is great.  They only keep small kegs of beer so the selections changes continuously throughout the night.   Beer selection is on a chalk board.  Fun!  I had the matador and it was great.   We shared the sausage plate and wings and it was probably too much for four people.  I would save room for the entree.

Angel's Trumpet is one of my favorite stops to hit in downtown Phoenix. Really nice atmosphere, excellent and friendly service, and a fantastic rotating beer list. Definitely a good spot to grab a bite & a brew. Super bike friendly w/ a great patio area.   Tuesday's are the best, when they have a different weekly "TV dinner" special for only $7. You get a variety of delicious items that fit within a certain theme, served on cute "school lunch" trays.
Good place to meet up for a drink after work. Good selection of brews, wait time too long.

Enjoyed my first experience. The server recommended the flight to start so we could try 6 different types of beer. The food was delicious! I'm not big on getting salads when I'm out to eat, but we split the Avocado salad with The Tractor flatbread. SO good! I will go back just for that salad!

I can see why people might complain about the customer service. The hostess (we'll call him stuck up hipster dude) was un-engaging and sort of rude. Fine. No problem... we'll just sit at the bar. The guy at the bar (we'll call him lumberjack) was helpful and allowed us to try a beer before we made a decision. We liked the bar, it was comfortable and friendly.   The beer... I love the selections. There is a constant rotation of what is on tap, and the prices aren't bad at all. I supposed the chalkboard style menu can be a bit confusing, but it could be worse. Beats printing out new menus every day.  I got the rodeo burger with extra bacon. HOMERUN. So awesome... the fries very were good, I liked the ketchup substitute they serve... it fit the meal perfectly. I left with a happy stomach!  We eventually moved to a table once our group showed up. Again, stuck up hipster dude wasn't much help. I picked the table I wanted when he couldn't find any words to use.   Our server was soft spoken and reports from the other side of the table were that he was a bit drunk (based on smell). He did his job well though. We got our orders and drinks refilled. Functional alcoholics don't bother me too much.   My friend loves this place and I can see why, I'll be back for many more visits.

Outstanding daily beer selection with fantastic food, excellent service, and approachable ambiance.  A go to place every time I'm downtown.  With over 25 beers on tap, you are sure to find whatever brew wets your whistle from pedestrian to bold and food that is far above average to accompany it.  The Angel wings are awesome with 3 different sauces, the smokey brisket on/in anything is amazing, or go lighter with the 810 sandwich.  The staff won't lead you wrong whatever pint and/or plate you choose to bury your face into.

The food is pretty good and the beer selection is great. It's a little noisy in there but not so bad. There is outdoor seating as well.  I've been here a couple times and the problem with th is the staff.   The waiters and waitresses can be pretty inattentive to those sitting outside, especially if you're just getting drinks and not food.  I also watched a bartender refuse to serve a customer because the customer hadn't tipped him for his last drink.   Basically, a lot of the staff has that can't-be-bothered sort of attitude. If you're okay with that then you should definitely go. If you like to have some respect, you should try elsewhere.

Great, Great, Great. Did I mention Great? What a cool spot, I'm sure to be a regular. It's located right across the street from Filmbar on 2nd st and Just South of Roosevelt. I LOVE the huge selection of beers. I did the sampler, which cost a measly $9 and allowed me to try 6 beers (around 4 oz each). 3 of the beers were great, 3 I hated, but that's the bonus in getting a flight! I also had a sausage sampler with housemade chorizo, some germain sausage and wild boar sausage. All of it was awesome. it was served with housemade ketchup, a fwe mustards, grilled onions and some potatoes. I can't wait to go back and get the same plate. Awesome ambiance, I was suprised how bright and airy the interior was.

This was part 2 of our food adventure and it did not disappoint! The place is very aesthetic. Love how they set up the place. It's a seat yourself type place and they have a ton of beer on tap.   Pros: +nice and relaxing feel, inside and outside seating +there's a beer sampler you can get so taste multiple beers for 10$ +the food is delicious!   Spam slider was a unique twist on using spam. The chicken quesadilla was also amazing! Love the pickled onions on there. It was part of the seasonal menu too so not sure if they serve this all the time.   We wanted to try dessert because we heard it was good but the flavor of tart they had that day did not sound appetizing so we passed.   Cons: - can't think of any
If you like beer, might be the best place in AZ.  Prices are great and the staff is really down to earth and helpful.  30 beers on tap. Food and atmosphere is up scale but very homey and relaxing

Every time I've been its been ok. The menu is limited and a couple of times Ive gone they have fun out of dishes. Good for them to to sell enough that they run out, but then you leave your customer trying to figure out plan B. They are always rotating taps when something runs out which is cool. I want to go back for the TV Dinner, we just always seem to miss it or they've sold out.

Had a great happy hour here after work a few weeks back.   Great venue with a ton of seating both indoor and outdoor.   Large beer selection with roughly 40 beers on tap so everyone in the group should be able to find something they like.   Food was solid. Because they had the smoker I went with the brisket sandwich which was well done.
This is a great place!  31 beers on tap and Great food.  The beers are ever changing and they have an awesome selection/variety.  The food is very good.  Fun place to hang out!!!

Oh. My Word. HOW have I never yet reviewed you, Angels Trumpet!? Of all the many places I've come to adore in the Valley, Angels Trumpet Ale House remains King of the Hill. I can still remember my first time there - the way my eyes crossed when I saw that massive chalkboard loaded full of delicious craft beer options!  Angels Trumpet Ale House officially offers THE BEST selection of quality craft beer in the Valley. It offers THE BEST grilled cheese sandwich, THE BEST burgers, THE BEST fries, and THE BEST ketchup. Did I just say THE BEST ketchup? I did. Angels Trumpet makes their own ketchup and it's good enough to drink on its own! (Seriously.)  Angels Trumpet Ale House is THE FIRST downtown eatery I introduce my friends (and any newcomers) to when given the opportunity. It is THE FIRST restaurant on my mind when I get hungry. I now live all the way up in North Scottsdale and still make a point of traveling the 45+ minutes south and west just to eat here.  The beer list of 30+ craft beers rotates constantly, so you've always got fresh new options to choose from. The beer flights are VERY reasonably priced and serving sizes are always more than adequate (for both food and drink). The homemade pop tarts are freaking delicious, too, and I don't even like sweets or dessert foods.  If you have yet to experience the Angels Trumpet difference, you need to. And don't just go once: visit a few times - get to know the menu. I've never ordered anything here and been dissatisfied. The ambiance is wonderful, the service is outstanding, and the food/drinks are out-of-this-world delicious. Give it a try!! I'm confident you'll love it!

Visited Angels Trumpet Ale House yesterday. The location is great. It is right downtown, perfect location. The ambiance is very casual with a beautiful patio. The beer selection is amazing. We had the verde tacos and they were amazing. Service was stellar. Sad I haven't been here before. I for sure will be back soon!

While walking I had a thirst for a cold pint. Out of the corner I find this Alehouse opened, chill and relaxed atmosphere. So relaxed you grab your own menu and have a choice of community table, bar, outside seating, or perhaps a lil couch. Service was friendly, ordered local brew 8 Street pale ale and sweet potato taquitos with leafy pesto! Delicious. Highly recommend.

The burger had a charbroiled taste and it came with this marinara sauce. the French fries were seasoned with sea salt. They also have a great selection of beer but I really couldn't  tell you  how it was.  The restaurant had a environmental friendly outdoor look. They also have bottle coke

I'd never been here until yesterday, when we stopped by as part of the Urban Ale Trail. I was very pleasantly surprised at how the employees handled the craziness. While some of the other locations were packed and short staffed, these people were on their game. They have a great beer selection, and a really great staff. I'll definitely be back.

We traveled from Prescott to the Phoenix airport and stopped in to have a bite before our flight. We ordered the avocado salad with smoked turkey, the cemita sandwich, the big guppy sandwich, along with interesting brews and draft wines. This was the best meal we had on our thanksgiving trip! Reasonable prices, knowledgeable staff, and the culinary highlight of our week. Good job!

Enjoyed the great selection of beer and the burgers.  If you like old school, try the spam sliders!  This placed is unused and slightly weird.  But it is very clean and laid back.   I am a fan and when I come back to Phoenix I will make a stop for sure!

Love this place when I'm in the mood for a craft beer flight and some great food. I've had the poutine which is delicious, and I most recently had a burger and asked for the poutine gravy on the side for my fries. It was also tater tot night, so my friend and I had those for an appetizer. The tots were good but nothing to rave about, but they came with three dipping sauces, which was nice. There is great seating outside, but I prefer to sit at the bar so I can fully view the beer offerings as they often change one or two taps during a two hour visit! This is a downtown staple for me.
Really fun place!  So many options for adult beverages!  Came here after a dBacks game (we won!) it was busy! Good food too

This place has an awesome selection of craft beers and you can try a 6 for only $9. The only down side is trying to figure out which ones to try and the at least my server wasn't too eager to help me choose. So so I randomly picked the 6 I thought sounded good, I wasn't disappointed but I don't know a whole lot about beer so it should have been nice to get some suggestions. So the service wasn't too spectacular but the beer was fabulous and the food was pleasant as well. I had the pretzels and wings. Personally I like that the wings come with the sauce on the side because I enjoy crispy wings and it's way cleaner. Oh one more thing since this place is located downtown there are very few parking spaces so be prepared to park a a meter.
Good times would go again great beer selection and wings were really good. Great atmosphere...try new a new beer or two! If you are not a beer drinker they do have some wine choices available.

Always looking for the next great place to grab a beer and while hesitant due to it's awful name and terrible logo (figured this couldn't be a good sign), I decided the beer devotion claims on their website were enough to pull me in.  I'll start out by saying there is nothing worse than a "beer bar" carrying all the same domestic brew you'll find at your local dive bar. I can go anywhere to grab a tasteless lager, a slightly hopped pale or predictable red ale. With the recent explosion of craft over the past few years, I figured that so many of these places would pop up and easily be done correctly...WRONG! While many bars attempt to have a "craft beer garden" they still play it safe and that's unfortunate. ATAH does not, and that's why I was happy to give it my official seal of approval.  Walking in, I had no idea what to expect. I almost drove past the place and wasn't entirely certain which door to enter through (I think there was only one but I don't rememeber it being marked very well). Upon entering, we weren't greeted by anyone but the bar is where I head anyways. Simple concept inside, clean and hard to miss what's on tap. We ate a BBQ chicken sandwich, it was average...but I wasn't there for food. The beer selection was fantastic, offering a wide variety of brew and probably something to please everyone...and with 30+ taps, if you can't find something you like, that's your own problem. I loved the fact that they offered a handful of beer I had never seen on tap anywhere in Phoenix before, which is something pretty rare around here. This tells me what whoever is running this place isn't afraid to charge that extra buck or two for something a true beer lover will be happy to see on tap.  Also, I must mention one more thing I liked about this place. While AZ brewers and Crescent Crown sit around and try to push this whole "Drink Local" campaign in our faces, this place had two local taps. I thought that was just enough for what they could afford to offer based on tap real estate and respect local brewers. There is nothing more frustrating than a bar that thinks it's a good idea to gather tons of AZ beers and serve them all in one location. Here is a tip to any bar owners who think AZ beer is good for service: AZ beer is NOT good for service.  Great place and I will be back.

After going to a great show downtown, we were looking for somewhere to go to have a couple of beers and some food. A friend suggested Angels Trumpet Ale House.   We arrived about 9:30pm on a Saturday night, fully expecting a crowd. We were relieved to see there were many open tables and our party of 7 was sat right away. Great! We're off to a good start! After studying the menu and deciding what we wanted (we were starving and thirsty), we patiently waited for a server to come and greet us. 10 minutes went by. No server. 15 minutes. No server. 20 minutes. No server.  While I would usually be understanding if it was busy (I used to be a server myself, so I have a high patience level), MULTIPLE servers were walking past our table looking like they had absolutely nothing to do. One male server was actually strolling around whistling with not a care in the world. We were absolutely in shock at the lack of acknowledgement we received by anyone other than the hostess. After waiting 25 minutes and still not being approached we all got up and left. On the way out, the hostess said cheerfully, "Thanks for coming in! Have a great night!". Sure, we probably would have had a great night if we actually would have been served.   It takes a LOT for me to complain about service. As I said before, I have been a server, and I know how stressful it can be...when it is BUSY. This place was NOT busy and had plenty of servers. We ended up leaving frustrated and hungry.   We will not be giving this place a second chance, nor can I recommend it to others after the experience we had.   Horrible service. Absolutely horrible.

My fiancé was in the mood for beer & a burger so I started my Yelp search. I've had Angel's Trumpet House bookmarked for a while now, so when that came up, we immediately thought to try it out. They have a very small parking lot in the back, it was full when we arrived but we were able to get metered parking right across the street. There was sign at the door saying to grab a menu & seat yourself, so we did. We really wanted a table outside to enjoy the beautiful AZ weather & were able to grab the last one right as we walked outside.  We got a flight of beer to start off with. The only one I really wanted to try out was the Apricot Cider, my fiancé ordered the rest. He got the Breakside Stout, Daily Wages, Dragonhosen, Fruitwood, Brown Shugga. The Breakside Stout was his favorite, followed by Fruitwood, then Brown Shugga.  I had seen some really impressive photos on Yelp of the fish tacos so I decided to get the Big Guppy for my meal & my fiancé got the Outlaw Burger with a tomato & french fries.  My meal was very colorful! The fish looked perfectly fried with a bright secret sauce (as listed on the menu) & corn relish on top, pico de gallo & avocado mash on the side along with refried beans & spicy coleslaw. Everything tasted absolutely delicious! The sauce on top of the fish had a bit of heat to it, the pico added a bit of acidity, & the avocado mash was really creamy and added a cooling effect. The refried beans also had good flavor & a bit of heat, but the spicy slaw didn't have much flavor. That was probably the only disappointment, however I would definitely get this dish again!  My fiancé really enjoyed his burger. He's not a huge fan of BBQ sauce on a burger, but he said this burger tasted good. I only tried a bite, which tasted really peppery, but the tomato he asked to be added made the whole thing. I did snag quite a few of his french fries. They came with a side of tomato sauce which was interesting! It seemed like their substitute for ketchup.  Overall, the atmosphere was good, the beer was good, & the food was really good so 5 stars! They have some specials, & we'll be going back soon to try out their TV dinners on a Tuesday.

If you choose one place to eat for the rest of your life, pick up a fork and STAB YOUR WAY INTO THIS RESTAURANT because damn. Angels is one of my all time favorite restaurants. I would boycott its destruction. I would stand in front of a tank rolling at me for this restaurant, and I would sacrifice my first child to the food gods to LIVE at this restaurant. Do you love burgers? Go here. Do you love beer? Go here. Do you love pizza and homemade poptart desserts?! YOU GUESSED IT, GO HERE! The beers, the plethora of beers, are listed in chalk behind the bar, which showcases simple taps running from one end of the bar to almost the other side. The selection is out of this world, even cider drinkers, like myself, find something. I have -no joke- had dreams about the pretzels and cheese dip. Not only is that my favorite thing in the world, but Angels does it better than anyone. It's a great app to share and its freakin fantastic. Living that cheese life, bruh. I have had tons of stuff on this menu so i cannot discuss them all buuuuuuuuuut any burger is worth it. They do everything, from buns to condiments, just right. When I say these burgers are a hot mess, I mean it in the best way. Like the Kate Upton of burgers kind of way. Sexy and full figured. The Meat Treat pizza is my go-to because, if you read my bio you'd know, I freakin love meat. This crunchy pizza crust has the perfect meat to cheese ratio and is super easy to heat up the next day. When I eat out, you better believe I am bringing home leftovers so I can eat tomorrow. You know what's up. Girl's gotta eat. If you're looking for a fun night out with beers and kick ass cuisine, this gastropub is your stop. The beer bottle lights and the high top tables along the north side of the restaurant are perfect for large groups. I had a party there and we took up three long high top tables inside that connect to three long high top tables outside; they were separated by a wall that completely opened up the upper half of the wall with sliding windows! If food is life, then Angels is where you should be living it.   There may be a wait, but that's because EVERYONE ELSE KNOWS that this restaurant is the bees knees. Suck it up, wait with a drink at the bar, and eat until you realize you should try to set up vacancy there.   Also, their fish taco game is on point. And their fries could stop wars. Just sayin'. It's the simple things.
Went there last night.  Had a great experience...fun patio, great beer and food.  A must go to location in downtown Phoenix!!

Five stars just for the beer selection. Four stars for the food and four stars for the service. Never a disappointment. Location is 5 stars and this place is clean. Overall, I round up and it gets the five star.   I am not a five star tramp stamp.

Great modern spot and an amazing beer selection. The hostess had a major attitude problem and the service was awful, it took 10 minutes for someone to come to our table. I'll try it again but if hte service is the same I won't return.

What a great place! Went here with a bunch of people from work for happy hour. They were crazy busy, but still gave good service.   The grilled cheese I had was amazing. I can't explain the delicious combination of flavors, but it involved honey, bacon, & various cheeses. Go there & get it ASAP. I can't drink beer, but I had a good New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc. Overall a great experience.

So Great!!  Some fantastic food!  There is great craft beer and wine, but the food is to die for!  I had a grilled cheese, with tomato and pesto and then they added bacon jam.  That's right....bacon jam!  It is like heaven!!  I finished off my meal with their homemade pop tart!  It was filled with peaches and had goat cheese and mint on top!  I can't tell you how great my entire meal was!  The bartender helped me select beer that went with my meal....just awesome!!!  Run...don't walk there!  I'll be back!!

We stopped in for lunch and had the Brewlee Burger and the featured sammy of the season. It was a lightly breaded chicken breast sandwich with a jalapeno ranch and thick cut bacon on a brioche. It was delicious especially when paired with a Witte brew beer and and a four peaks light hefeweizen beer. We are both planning our next adventure and may do a flight of beers with a their flight of sausages (the appetizer).

I love this place.  I go to a lot of places.  Some try to be too ambitious and fall on the face with their overly-complicated menus. Some try to take things down to a more simple idea and end up overshooting, making everything bland and too usual.  Angel Trumpet has no such flaws.  They're also not perfect, but I can justify that 5-star review.    Let's get it out of the way:  The chairs suck, they're kind of uncomfortable and rigid.  The beer prices are kind of what we like to call "astronomical" for a mostly poor beanly-fellow such as myself.  The food can come out a little slow.  It's all true, if someone else said it in another review, I can back that all up.  And yet, I don't really give a damn.  This is a local joint in downtown Phoenix peddling 31 different beers that are always rotating.  Not a "regular" beer in sight.  It's what downtown Phoenix has been clamoring for.  And if you're coming to an ale house, you're coming to drink first and eat later.  Still, I like their food.  Stroganoff burger...oh man.  I'm such a sour cream whore and, I love my food saucy and wet but I hate soggy stuff.  The bun stood up to the stroganoff sauce and the sour cream and the mushrooms and the juicy medium-cooked beef perfectly.  The 810 sandwich with hand-pulled turkey works in spite of the overly-southwestern theme (pull back on the adobo a bit, it can taste like the restaurant equivalent of "taco seasoning" that every white person I know uses to make tacos) because each of the ingredients is high-quality.  The bread is fresh and crisped.  The ribbon chips are amazingly thin.  People have griped and complained for literally decades that downtown doesn't have any neat, laid-back places to have a beer and be a human, with most places downtown still ready to serve the post-5pm cattle herd and nothing more.  Here you have a genuine Phoenix experience.  Don't gripe too much.  Soak it up.    We'll will be back there.  Will you?

So my 1st time here.  I'd love to say the place is ok but all things human related here bring it down.  Allow me to explain.   So you walk in, awesome! Tons of unique beers on tap, outdoor patio area, sand pit area to play cornhole/bags!! I said to my friend "great call"...then the disappointment began.  1st off...no beer list.  Oh wait...there is..it's on a chalkboard back in the main area and a completely obscured moving chalk board across the patio.  Ummmm WTF? I have great eye sight but I can't see around the fatty, heat lamp and dude with his ass crack hanging out.  Ok, so I guess this is a "get up and look at board" type of service.  Great.  So that's what I did.  No description of beers other than a #, name, type of beer.  Guess this place is for professional beer brewers only.    2nd...service took forever...and it wasn't even that busy.   3rd...food...also took forever for a simple pizza...ahem..they call "flatbread".  I guess i differ on that.    4th...beer...well, I can't complain here...I tried a sampler and they were good. Some real strong ones in their rotation of 27+ beers.  So at least they got that right.    Note to management.  Really that hard every day to sit down and write out what beers are available that day and a little description and then photocopy that 100+ times? Really? Chalkboards? Basically your laziness=causes customers more work...and people don't know really what the hell they are ordering. In other words...not all IPA's are the same. So can ya fill some people in?  If you are a big beer fan and brewer by all means, this is your place.  If not, I'd say seek your libations elsewhere.

Wow.  I drink a lot if different beers but this place is incredible.  Of the 30 or so beers on tap, I had tried 6.  Great vibe, nice people and a knowledgeable staff.  Food was great.  One suggestion...try the beer sampler, six three oz pours and you can try everything.  One more thing...alcohol content probably averages higher then normal...be careful.  A great place.  Thanks for a great experience.
Food is very good. Drinks are too expensive. Waitress charged us almost full price for half of a beer when the keg ran out. And a shot of wine was $7.

This place rocks.  Great location, plenty of parking available, awesome service.  LOTS of beer options and wine on tap.  The staff is educated on the huge beer selection, and very friendly.  I don't think I've ever waited longer than 10 minutes for my food.  Tuesday night TV dinner is awesome, creative, and the quality is good.

We went on the unofficial opening night and the place was packed! The owner was at the door greeting everyone as they walked through and we randomly got a free beer, which made for a really nice bonus! The atmosphere is really cool and laid back and you cant go wrong with their beer selection. A little pricey, but worth if for the beers on tap. I cant wait to go back!

Can't believe I've never been here! Cute concept, kinda like one big room! Tons of beers on tap and a large back area to sit outside and enjoy the phx weather! The green chairs outback kinda gave me a cafeteria feel! Prices are pretty good we ordered the pretzels which came out warm and soft (ask for extra cheese Bc the one it comes with won't be enough).  Also ordered the wings crispy and tasty! For the main dish we got the outlaw burgers cooked perfect nice and moist and the bun wasn't soggy was just missing something? Little lack luster is the taste dept, the fries it comes with are crunchy and perfect giving me five guy fry vibes! The side sauce its served with tasted like spaghetti sauce, I'd pass on that  next time! Overall cute spot will defiantly be back to see what other beers they rotate in on top!
Great fish tacos. That's all I've had the few times I've been there. I'm a creature of habit so when I find something I like I stick to it.

A world class beer bar in Phoenix with delicious food. This is something special.  I used to find the chalkboard beer menu a bit difficult to deal with, and it's still a hassle occasionally, but the excellence of the beer selection and the tap maintenance, the deliciousness of the food, particularly the burgers... I go every chance I get.

I really wanted to like this place.  I was in with a friend a few months ago and we had a great bartender and I had a couple of beers but we didn't have any food.  This time I came back with family and and we had food.  This place suffers from the more is better and more bacon is even better mentality that is in vogue with those that don't understand balance.  The meat pizza was good but over topped which made the crust go soft and bacon dominated all of the meats.  My wife had the summer berry salad special.  She liked it but said the dressing was too oily and didn't have enough vinegar.    I had the Garfield which is a turkey wrap with bacon and cranberry aioli.  The only flavor was bacon.  I really missed the cranberry flavor.  A simpler version done at SunUp is much more balanced.  The beer selection was skewed bizarrely to +7% ABV beers.  There were only a couple of "sessionable" beers available.  The ESB I tried was flat and tasted more like a brown.    The house ketchup it terrible - it isn't sweetened and tasted like canned tomato paste.  It is bitter and sour and really ruined the decent fries that came with my sandwich.  If the place could lose some illusions and pull back a bit it could be a great spot.  Oh, the place only had a few tables of people and noise level was horrible, maybe that is why the waitress missed my iced tea order, although the staff seemed to have no problem talking to each other for long stretches.  Given the spotty service and the fact that one of our glasses was dirty and my daughters soda had something floating in it, I won't be quick to come back.  My wife commented that the bathrooms and the dining area were very clean.

Pros - Great beer selection, constantly changing, and you can tell the owners have a serious passion for the topic.   Beer Flight from anything on the board is a tasty treat for experienced beer drinkers, or a nice way for less serious drinkers to explore.  The food was good.   The building itself is interesting on the inside, and has a fun vibe overall.  Yay for a new place in downtown Phoenix, especially next to the great FilmBar!  Cons - The servers don't seem to know much about the beer. We had to order by number because our server was so confused. This might get fixed with experience and training, but I would expect an "alehouse" to at least nail this out of the gate.  The menu has some glitches yet, which our server warned us about. It took multiple trips to the kitchen to figure out which food they had/didn't have. Kind of took the fun out of trying to pair our beers with our meals.  Main building was so noisy we could barely hear anyone our table. Outside wasn't an option because it was pitch black. So if you go at night, you get to see or hear everyone else in your party, but probably not both.  Parking Lot is a trap. We watched seven cars in a row pull in, realize there was nowhere to go, then back out onto the street to find street parking. Surprised there was no accident.  In spite of being told no smoking on the patio, several people were smoking and none of the servers or managers seemed to care. So is smoking allowed or not? Who knows. Mildly annoying by itself, but I think an example of the bigger problem that not everyone here is on the same page yet. Your visit will likely vary widely depending on when you go and who takes care of you.  I had an okay time, but have no desire to return. Giving them 3 stars because I love their idea and love to see something new downtown, and hope others try them out while they work to raise their game.

I liked this place! The service was great which is most appreciated. The place was quite packed, but since it's open seating/seat yourself it was difficult to find a spot to accommodate a 9 top. Several of the employees helped us gather a table. They have an extensive beer list on the chalk board, so although it was a little tough to read through them all and choose, it was exciting to try some new brews! Food items were simple favorites with a unique twist; fish tacos were delicious and everyone else seemed to like their picks too! Seems like they have some fun special happy hours so I'll definitely be back. Again, service was awesome!

I didn't get a server to come over for almost 10 minutes, I went in the late afternoon and I had a weird feeling that the food would be blah so I paid for my drink and I ended up going somewhere else.

Always great beer to choose from and the food is great.  I love the flat breads.  So yummy.  Hit or miss on the wings.  The first time we had them, they were AMAZING.  The 2nd and 3rd time? Meh.  Wish those would be consistent.  But overall..super great place to hang out.

Great rotating selection of beers and great food to pair with them. They have excellent flatbread pizza and some of the best burgers in Phoenix.   Staff is great overall and if you can't decide on a beer, ask their bartender, Cory. She's great and can always pick a good one for your taste!

I've been here multiple times. I'm a guy that loves beer.   The ONLY reason why I'm NOT giving this place 5 stars...They have a HUGE, actually 2 HUGE chalk boards where they post the 30-40 or so beers they have on tap. Which is awesome. But I like to sort of have a selection of different types and a history on the beers, like where they are from ect... The servers usually know but not every beer. So you either have to ask, know or look up on your phone, plus it's sorta hard to read, just overwhelming.   Other then that, the patio is dog friendly. I've spent a day or to on it drinking with a friend and her dog just relaxing. They even have water bowls for the dogs.   The food selection is a bit limited but they best thin on the menu is the meat pizza, the shit is probably one of the best pizza's i've ever had.  Oh and you can fill up your personal growlers here too.

I couldn't be happier, I asked Jake to surprise me with a flight and described what I liked and he brought an amazing selection. Love the ambience of the low lighting and music you can conversate over.

What a great place. It has great staff and good vibe. located in a part of town you wouldn't expect and brings you next to Film Bar, another fun place. I've been many times now and have ordered the wings ( A+) burgers and flat breads. The desert I could only comment on it not being the greatest, but fortunately we fill up before getting to desert so we never order it. The beers are all good and the staff is excellent at guiding you to the right choice. The patio is dog friendly and fills up quickly. I love this place and find myself going back as a loyal customer.

Few places in Phoenix can be rated top 10 places to eat. Logically. And Angel's Trumpet happens to be one of those places. And this place deserves to be in that bracket for sure. Their food is fresh, and their beer selection is incredible. The beer flight is a classic, tried and true method for trying new beers without having to chug entire glasses down.  I came here with a friend and discovered some really interesting favorites that I hope will be on the menu. A beer I tried had a very herbal, sage taste to it in its finish and it paired very nicely with the burger and fries that I got.  One thing to note, while I did give this place a full five stars, I personally don't recommend the brulee burger when drinking.   "But Russell, why did you give this place five stars if the brulee burger isn't five star worthy?"  ONLY when drinking. See, drinking can cause hypoglycemia. But then you ask, well, eating a brulee burger, which has sugar, seems like a good idea right? Here's the thing, it's straight up sugar. Which, for me personally, makes me feel sick. Eating potatoes or any form of slower intake of carb calories mitigates the stomachache issue. But maybe that's just me.

1st visit. post golf lunch on a Wednesday afternoon:  Lots of available parking.  Cool ambiance/atmosphere. Half indoor, half outdoor. Whatever works for you.  32 beers on tap plus wine. Good selection of varied brews.  Low key wait staff. No rush, no pressure.  Pints, tulips, and snifters, depending on the beer. Something for everyone.  Hummus, pita, & veg, to start. Awesome.  Paisano (?) Pizza - today's special, was fabulous. Great crust that held up, didn't get soggy. Tasty sausage.  $52 (before tip) for 5 brews, appetizer, pizza. Completely satisfied.
What a great place for a large selection of micro beers on tap. Staff friendly and helpful and my avocado salad was delicious. There is a nice seating area outside too. We'll be back for sure.

Met up with a friend to have a few drinks and service and drinks were great. I didn't order any food, so can't say much about that. The bartenders were very helpful in choosing what you fits your palapte.

We loved it here.  It's VERY busy on First Friday - just an FYI.  It was a minimum 30 minute wait at prime dining time and very hot inside the restaurant.  Outside of that, the staff was friendly though a bit "flaky".  I assume it's b/c they were very busy.  The tap options were endless and as others have mentioned, rotate as they go throughout the evening.  It's a great way to keep you coming back for more!  They have a beautiful patio with a lot more dining tables and that is where we got to sit.  I love eating outside in perfect AZ weather!  We got the veggie flatbread which was DEEEEELISH and can I just say ...Oh. Em. Gee with regard to the wings.  They were roasted to perfection and served with three sauces on the side, which was ingenious! I really enjoyed that touch so I could mix and match the sauce.  I am still drooling over the amazingness that was the wings!  Get them.  The beer options were also wonderful and the price point is average.  I would have spent more money here but I was jet-lagged and had to get back to the hotel before I passed out at my table after my two beers.  Light weight here.
Large craft beer selection and great events.  The food is great and the atmosphere is contemperary trendy.

Love this place, food is delish and the beer is always different  and we love that! I always get the flat bred and my husband loves their burgers. The atmosphere of this place is really chill and laid back, we will always go back to Angels Trumpet!

Service sucks!! Was a "slow" night so we were told to pick a table. Sat down for literally 8 minutes before being approached by a waitress to tell us that she would bring menus. She then disappeared and a couple sat down right beside us and received two glasses of water, silverware, and menus before we were even visited by staff again.   The food was just ok. Which was a disappointment because the menu is very ambitious and if excecuted properly, would have had a high ceiling. I would say the wings were very good by themselves but not a huge fan of the 3 dipping sauce options. The bruless beef burger w/ egg was good but you can't really go wrong w/ a burger when cooked right. I want to give this place another try, however my poor customer service experience is really preventing me from doing so.  I was also interested in trying out some of the large selection of beers, however nobody offered or even attempted to gauge my interests of trying anything from the varieties offered. I guess I just made up my own mind, will not be going back to this place. Bummer, was really hoping for good things.

This spot has a cool vibe but what was not cool was the fact that the sprinklers on the outdoor patio were not on continuously.  It was over ninety degrees out and the sprinklers were only on every 15 minutes.  When I asked that they adjust it, they never complied.  You can't offer outdoor seating if you're not going to offer some concessions for the heat.  We live in the desert!   As for the food it was ehh.. I ordered the BBQ burger.  Too many onion straws and the BBQ sauce just wasn't good.  It added no flavor value.. The highlights were the bun and the side salad.

My friend and I stopped in tonight for dinner after and were pleasantly surprised with everything! We split the spam sliders and each got beer flights and flatbread pizzas. Yoooo   Beer Flights: stouts are still not for me but everything else was delicious and the cupcake tins were cute.  Spam Sliders: all my friends are super hype about spam and I've only ever had it in masubis so these were yummy! very flavorful and the buns were perfect.  Flatbread Pizzas: I love that you have an option to add fried eggs on top. Eggs make everything better. The fun-guy was one of the best pizzas I've had in a while.   Great service and atmosphere too! Would definitely come back to sample more beers and try the pop tarts.

I am giving this review 2 stars for the fact that out of the innumerable amount of times I have gone to Angels Trumpet, this visit was among the worst. The good: our Fun-guy pizza and wings were pretty tasty. The bad: our order took an extra long time to come out; we had to request the additional sides we initially placed and then request another blue cheese because the one our server brought was hotter than our food initially was when brought out (why?!); the two adjacent tables (who came after us) received their food and checks and left before us; and then the server asked us to pay for another tables' check that was the same amount because he screwed up. We paid it without asking for our check to be corrected because we wanted the heck out of there and it was getting busy. I certainly hope this was a unique-one-time-bad experience that won't be repeated. I will request a different section if that server has my table again.

Chose to stop in here last week when I arrived into Phoenix kinda late for work and they were near where I was staying and open late and boy am I glad I did. Great food, great service and even better selection of craft beers on draft. Cool laid back feel and could def see how it'd be a fun spot to hang with the large open outdoor patio area. 6 wines on tap and 30 some rotating beers ranging from local selections to others from around the country and loved that they offered samplers as well. I ordered one of their sandwiches in wrap form (which I found out was possible from a guy that worked there) and was very impressed in how it turned out. Would def come back here if I were in the area again.
Great beer but very crowded; though we did go on first Friday. I would definitely go back but would make sure to get there early to ensure we get a table.

A fun, chill place with a rotating list of beers on tap. Many of the beers they feature are adventurous and unique, and you're not likely to find them on tap at other local bars. Get a sampler flight so you can try a bunch of them!   They have a few wines on tap too, and their food is great!

Angel's Trumpet is one of my favorite places to eat and drink in Phoenix. I like to try new beers and have never left this place without trying 4 or 5 new ones (via the flights, not full pints - otherwise this would be a review of how nice the toilets are to barf into).  Their burgers are heavenly, their desserts are rad and I can't express enough my longing for their chipotle ranch. I would fill a Camelback full of that stuff and hike Camelback mountain with it, if it wasn't so frowned upon by my doctor.  If you've never been, check this place out. Good food, beer and service. If you really like beer and chipotle ranch, stay very far away because you may never escape.

31 one brews on tap not including the wine! We had the wings, burger, and tacos. The burger was put together perfectly with a carefully cooked piece of beef and egg. Nothing but a mouthful of flavor in every bite. One of the better burgers I've had here in the valley. The fries could use a little love. The naked wings- on point! Three different sauces to dip in, fried in a good batter/seasoning. Moving onto the tacos.... No shortage of flavorful fish, dipped in a good batter and fried perfectly. The beans are to die for, my only complaint was the shortage of beans... Next time I go, I will order an extra side of beans. This place is a must try with a hipster feel to it. You almost feel like you're somewhere else. They provide water bowls for your animals on the back patio. Great job!!!!

Great food, ample beer selection, friendly staff and awesome music (80's alternative - OH YES!). I highly recommend sitting out on the patio for a pint if you're downtown. We had burgers, sandwiches, and wings with both the spicy/tangy and the sweeter sauces.  4-stars because I would like to see more local taps.

Great beer selection and casual yet hip ambiance . Burgers cooked  medium to order and you can substitute with a chicken or smoked pork patty. Only one salad dressing on an all spinach salad. I would pass on the dressing myself as t was a bit blah. Great service and good prices.

So this place had beer, and it's cool looking, so that's something. Unfortunately it has the same interior sound comfort level as a wood chipping factory. That is to say it's so freaking loud you will not, and cannot have a conversation. Clearly the owners are aware, as there are a handful of acoustic tiles on the ceiling, but they need considerably more.
