Service was so so, our server kinda tried but she had way too many tables to be effective. I ordered the pretzel app and I have never seen greasy pretzels until now. Their pretzels are more like mini-baguettes and they are super oily. The app came with a mustard and some kind of warm cheese sauce, allegedly. It was so weird, there was 0.0 flavor in the cheese sauce. None. Nada. Zip. The only thing it had going for it was that it was warm.  Our app came with no napkins or flatware and it took 20 minutes to find someone to bring napkins.   Overall this place is better than a kick in the nuts- but it's not a comfortable place to chill with a cold beer.  It only makes me miss The Roosevelt even more than ever, and for that I tip my 40.

I love the atmosphere and I love the beer. Also our server, I think his was Sean, was excellent and very attentive but without being annoying. If Angel's Trumpet had vegan options, that's the only thing that would make this place better!

Cool place.  Lots of beer on tap.  You can get you beer custom canned to take home.  Really sweet machine that does it.  They have nitro on tap huge plus for me. Indoor outdoor place which is great in the warm Phoenix evening.  Food looked great too but didn't eat.  I want to go back for food.

Delicious! Great atmosphere, food and Brittany  was great! I had the outlaw burger it was very good. Portion was huge. My husband had tacos and my friend had the bbq brisket grilled cheese. They both enjoy their meals as well. We all had local beer and they were all great!

I love this place for their many rotating taps, because they almost always have at least one Sour on the menu, and the service is usually very good.  However, their food leaves a little to be desired.

I was looking forward to their opening and now I feel I need to wait a few months longer before I try again.    On a Friday night, a hostess/server greeted us after a good 5 minutes of waiting by the door and asked us if we would be ordering food since the kitchen was backed up.  If we were to order, our food would arrive well over an hour of our arrival.  Naturally, this was all the information we needed enough to say "No, we're just here for a beer or two."  Soon after, we were seated and placed an order for 3 pints.  We waited a good 15-20 minutes for our beers.  During that time, we noticed lots of servers standing around one POS (point of sale).  It looked as if servers were waiting in line to put in their individual orders.  Our suspicion was confirmed later that evening, only one working POS.  I wonder why they didn't have a backup plan-paper tickets?  I would think people would be more inclined to walk out on their tab because of the excruciating wait than management have to worry about losing money with paper tickets.  Our waters were refilled twice before our first round of beers arrived at our table.  Two of my buddies call this place the "Water House" because that's all they got when they visited Angel's Trumpet Ale House.    Once we received our beers, we asked her to place another order for another round of beers because we figured that we would receive our 2nd set of beers just as we finished our first ones.  It worked!  If ya plan on having another beer, be sure to place an order as soon as the first beers arrive so that you don't hafta wait long for your second beer.    I think the night was best portrayed by a sneak peek that I got of the owner- he was rubbing his temples and obviously under stress.   I am inclined to give them a star or two more once the timing has improved.    Great building, good ambiance, wonderful patio (hope it's pet friendly), excellent location and a good selection of beers.    Oh, I like the idea of three bathroom choices instead of the typical two.
What can I say great food and loads of choices for beer and wine.  The menu is somewhat limited but the quality is there.  Really like this place.
Gonna be short about this place....GO! If you like tons of crafts, great bar food and a chill vibe.

Headed here on a 'red basket Thursday' with some friends...WOW! This little gem is tucked away and when you find it, you won't regret it! The variety of beers is amazing, truly something for every palate. We got two flights and tasted a dozen different fantastic ales, stouts, blondes, IPAs, you name it. This day's red basket special was a brisket chili dog - delicious! Then we found The Mess (poutine) on the menu... *drool* They do it right, with delicious seasoned fries, real cheese curds, and thick turkey gravy. Everything we tried was stupendous, I recommend this spot for all!

So glad I finally got to stop into this place before a concert! Wow I am impressed.  Great beer selection. Loved the ambiance. Their food was excellent,  had the taquitos  as an app and tacos as dinner. Yum! Definitely recommend. Located near  Cobra Arcade which is another cool spot to check out afterwards. Can't wait to go back again!

I came here last night to try for the first time with my friends and I loved it! We all got beer flights for $9! There's a board of about 30 different beers to choose from. I would definitely recommend the 805 and the Raspberry Cider. The flight comes with 6 3oz. cups in a muffin tin. It was cute.   This place has an inside and outside seating area. Our waiter was super friendly and helpful. I would recommend this place to others.

Coming from San Diego a huge place with tons of craft beer and places on every corner this place definitely reminds us of San Diego and would come back to enjoy the cheap flights six beers for $10 you can't beat that. They have a so, so variety of beers. Def would come back. Food was good. Vegan options, so that's a plus

Cool place. Best selection of beers on tap! Beautiful clientele. I just wish the skinny dude brooding behind the bar would smile. I don't like to be grimaced at when I am trying to chill with my $7 beer!

This is a super unique and fun bar in downtown Phoenix with a great selection of local craft brews. I stumbled upon this place a few weeks ago after a Suns game and was pleasantly surprised with the great atmosphere and trendy vibe. They have a great mixture of new and old. Recently went back to have an early dinner on the patio and had another great experience. I highly recommend the sausage platter as an appetizer and definitely do a flight of beer to sample their selection.

Flight of beers to sample the ever changing menu of craft beers is what I recommend. About 31 choices on draft of local breweries! Server was very knowledgeable and recommended great choices also. Burgers were great and so were the seasonal home made pop tarts! Food and drinks were reasonably priced.

YUM!  The chalkboard of brews and wines on tap rocks! This is a definite must visit if you're around the convention center at all. It's an easy walk from most hotels and will keep you out of the crowds.  I got the gaucho tacos and a glass of red blended wine. Be forewarned, the wine will be chilled (which isn't all that unusual). The tacos arrived with spicy coleslaw and beans. I mixed some of the guacamole in with each taco which also featured mango chutney. It was delicious! I couldn't eat fast enough! This place is a solid restaurant choice with a fabulous ambiance. Don't be scared off by the location, it's worth visiting.

Angel's Trumpet is a nice addition to the downtown Phoenix food and drink scene! I love the dog-friendly patio and the rotating list of beers. I always feel inspired to try new beers here because I can do flights of SIX delicious beers!   Most of the food is great(spud tacos--delicious!) and service has been good each time I went. My only complaint is that it gets REALLY loud in there when it's busy. Loud to the point where you might be yelling for your companion across the table to hear you. Apart from that, it's a great place to hang out with some friends.

Really tasty burger. Had their BBQ but had to add basics like tomato/lettuce and avocado. Solid meat and cook temp and enjoyed their home made sauces. Do wish they had standard mustard. Their fries were good not great. They were a little mushy. Beer selection was slightly limited but I am particular to a hoppy IPA. The one I had was decent but was not fond of their 3 taste per table. I get trying to limit over tasting but I did not even get to try one and that bothered me customer service wise. Service was overall standard.
Was very underwhelmed by the food. Gravy was very different on the poutine, a gelatin consistency and I felt as if the slaw did not pair well with spam on the sliders.

Came here for a friend's birthday celebration.  I didn't eat but my companions seemed generally satisfied with their food.  I had a cider that was delicious.    The service went from good to bad.  At one table, we were served promptly and the waitress gave us separate checks.  We changed to another quieter table and were told by our new waiter that he could not split up the checks.  That caused a huge headache amongst our group and we left with a rather negative impression.

They don't have an coke products and very few non alcoholic drinks. That is not very good for DD drivers who are trying to be safe. Also the service was super slow tonight.  I wanted to try the nutter and add the marshmallow fluff but of course they couldn't get that right either. I thought the place was a bar but its a family place with obnoxious kids running around in outside area. I wasn't impressed as much as the last time I was there.

I love the huge variety of beers they have. The environment is very laid back and relaxing. This is a perfect place for catching up or hanging out with with friends. This is only my second time coming here but I've loved both occasions and with definitely be back

It was quite crowded on the night of first Friday event. Service was a bit tough at the bar -- not that responsive to our orders. But once we got out table, we were taken care of pretty quickly.  For those ale drinkers seeking some new options - do try out this flight combination: 6(kunig Ludwig), 18, 19(corne du devel), 23(krombacher), 30(saison), and 31. Quite tasty!  Also tried the farm pizza from the menu - have to say the pizza was tasty and the cheese on it tasted expensive ;) though it seemed as though they poured a whole salad packet onto the pizza to give it a "farm" feel, overall the pizza was delicious an with the flight -- perfect combo!  Good place to hang out and chill in downtown phoenix!

Like all new restaurants, this place could stand to have a little more insulation to keep the volume levels below deafening on busier nights. I've come to avoid Angels Trumpet on the weekends just because I know how unbearably loud it's going to be inside. Thankfully, the patio is enormous, well shaded, and nicely laid out. So if there's availability you can find solace outside.  The beer selection is, of course, unbeatable. There's something new every day, so you better not fall head over heels for a certain brew because it won't be there for long. The service has always been impeccable and I've come to really trust each server's recommendations.

This place has a really great beer selection and the service was great. The food here was really good and had great portions. They give you samples of a beer before getting it, which is really cool. This place looks terrible on the outside, but the inside is really nice.  I did have one problem...the parking. It's terrible, I hate having to park on the street.

such a great place! cool atmosphere, GREAT food and GREAT service! I'm not a huge beer drinker.....so I was super happy that in addition to their plentiful craft beer list, they also had craft wine! My husband and I will definitely be back!

TV Dinner Tuseday is SO FUN! When we went, we had buffalo chicken nuggets, bleu mac'n cheese and a bunch of other awesomeness! Dessert is decadent. Prices are fair. Atmosphere is fun and family friendly! LOVE this place.
What a great stop....loved the spud tacos! Had a delicious guppy with all the sides!!! And a tractor pizza!! Loved it!

Within walking distance of downtown Phoenix , this restaurant / beer palace is amazing.   A very eclectic selection of local beers as well as a few of my Belgian favorites. (Chimay... I got the last glass before the tap ran dry!!)  The food is phenomenal. The pizzas are a must!  I will be returning in a few weeks for another visit.   Customer for life!
Great place to go for a beer in downtown Phoenix. Some nearby places like cobra and film bar too. We had the tacos and they were great, would recommend.

Definitely enjoyed visiting Angels Trumpet Ale House during a recent visit to Phoenix! Their outdoor area was quite nice and had a large canopy covering all of the picnic tables. We lucked out that it wasn't SUPER hot out, so we were happy to soak up the warm weather. Their beer selection was huge so we decided to try a few by getting a flight. We didn't end up having dinner here, but their food selection seemed to be pretty good as well. I'm honestly struggling to remember the names of the beers we had, but I am confident that you should check this place out if you're in the mood for a Phoenix brewery hopping day.

What a strange experience... Busy Friday night, out with a friend.   Waiter was... busy? Also inattentive until I made mention of not liking my food. His initial response to me saying I did not like my obviously un-eaten meal was, "Ok. Well... they may not take it off the bill... The chef makes that decision..."  Um. Ok... waited.. Then he came back to say, "They want to know what was wrong with the meal." To which I gave him feedback (I had the Matador: both the meat & fries tasted unseasoned).  ... waited... Back again with, "They said we have to charge you for half." At that point, I ended up asking for a manager.  ... waited... The waiter returned to inform me that, "Because it's such a busy Friday night, the manager is trying to deal with stuff & they can't come over. But they went ahead and took the whole meal off your bill."  ... Ok. By then my friend had enough and went to speak to the manager himself.  My friend came back and said the manager had been very kind and understanding, agreeing that he had tasted some of the food and noticed it was a little off. He apologized for not coming over to the table, and agreed it should have been handled well. He also said he had told the waiter to let us know he was going to talk to the chefs about the quality of the food.  ... so... All the nonsense leading up to the conversation with the manager was so unnecessary. I don't know why/how/where the communication broke down, but a customer should not have to "testify" in detail to why they did not like their food. It was uneaten. I wasn't lying.  Unfortunately, as close to my home as this place is and as great as it had seemed going into it, I will not be returning.   It's one thing to have mediocre food OR mediocre service...  but you can't have both.

Food and beer here are amazing.  I live downtown and try my hardest not to go here all the time since I want to try other spots. The service is pretty good even when busy and they have a TV so I can watch some games.
Met up with my friend and her mom for some day time drinking. Was not disappointed with this place. Great beer selection and the poutine dish was perfect. Will absolutely be returning

I can start by saying, their food was GREAT. I had a pizza with an egg which sounds crazy until you have one. I cant complain about the food one bit!   My boyfriend loves beer, so this place to him is a no brainer! Their beer list changes literally daily [they changed 3 different ones while we were there] so you gotta check the menu when you're there.   However, I'm not a huge beer drinker, but I do enjoy some cider and a glass of white wine on occasion. My only wish for this place was they had a few more ciders. Guess I'll have to go back to their revolving beer list to try again!  Also, I thought this place was super hipster urban and fun. They have a great patio as well. If you're downtown, CHECK THIS PLACE OUT!

The atmosphere at ATAH is definitely cozy with a hipster vibe. There are a lot of beers for you to try and I made the mistake of ordering a pinot noir, which was served too cold. I would suggest sticking to the beer if your'e a wine snob; it is, after all, an ale house.  The empanada I tried was pretty tasty. Wings are nicely portioned but I'm not sure if the accompanying sauces matched very well. I also had a few bites of the sausage platter, which was hit or miss. Service was very slow. I gauge slow service by jokingly contemplating a "dine-and-dash." I would never actually do it, but when I keep thinking about it, a server somewhere doesn't want to take our money. So overall, ATAH didn't leave a great impression but I'm willing to give it another chance.

This place is in my top 5 restaurants ever, seriously it's that good. Their Tuesday night TV dinner special is always off the charts good. I've had more then I can count and they never disappoint.  I wish I could say I was exaggerating when I say I've had everything on their menu over the years...and there's not a single thing I didn't like. This time around we had the meat treat pizza and one of the newer items on the menu a fried chicken sandwich, the name of which I can't remember for the life of me but it had a jalapeño ranch on it that was ridiculously good. Whatever you do don't forget to order a homemade pop tart! The flavors are seasonal and it currently blueberry with a balsamic rosemary reduction on top. I wanted to lick the plate.  Oh man I almost forgot about the beer. A rotating selection of 30 craft beers, yes please! Get a beer flight for 9$ to try 6 at time. It's one of my favorite parts about going.  If you're still reading this and not on your way to Angel's Trumpet for dinner tonight Idk what you're doing with your life!

Spot had me excited at first. Has seemed to have gone downhill some. First time in reminded me of some breweries in Oregon, but to be fair there's nothing like the breweries in Oregon. Clean newer outdoor indoor seating. Solid rotating selection of 30 or so beers. Some food is unique and clever. Crowd can be a bit dooshy on most nights. Days can be better, like on a Sunday afternoon. It's not just the ASU influence. Service is weak. Kind of a hipster aloof arrogance to too much of the staff. Yes when crowded the ambience is uncomfortable. The noise is like a crowded dive bar but the environment doesn't match. Parking can be difficult but it is downtown area. For the pricing, the experience should be much better. Owners probably making enough to not notice the management flaws now, but eventually these growing problems will catch up.

Went there for dinner and drinks last night. Another reminder of why I need to spend more time in downtown phoenix! Amazing place. The server was super friendly and very knowledgeable of the beers on tap, gave us great recommendations and I got to try a handful of them.   The food was great as well. Their burgers are well known and I had fried riblets which were delicious!  Overall, great experience and great prices. Thanks guys!

I wish I could give a better review on this, but I only stopped in for a half hour or so. We stopped in on a Sunday afternoon,  pulled up and the private lot was full so parked on the street right outside. It looked like an absolute dive until I walked in and boom, the place really opens up and is really nice! Great casual, noisy environment and was pretty busy, but quick, friendly service with tons of different brews. A little pricey, but that's to be expected at a place like this. I can't wait to go back!
What a great place!  Awesome beer selection, food and atmosphere. Downtown Phoenix has a much needed gem of a draft house. I will be back as much as i can.

Stopped in for dinner and drinks on a recommendation from family.  Did some reading up before going in and were excited by the selection of craft beer.  Pictures of the food left us eager to try a few items too.  We got there early to beat the crowds and were promptly seated.  After a few questions and some pondering we both ordered our beers.  They came out quickly.  I enjoyed the selections, something for every type of beer connoisseur.  Service was very good and we were never left sitting.  Our waitress was very personable.  We both got entrées, a brisket sandwich which was OK (not a lot of flavor), and a burger.  I was disappointed because the burger looked to be a frozen hockey puck type.  Definitely formed by something besides hands.  I was expecting a more handmade type thing at a place with this much gusto.  Still tasted good though.  Fries were also very tasty.  We also splurged on the homemade pop-tarts.  They were awesome!  Highly recommended!  Overall, we will return for sure, just maybe not right away.

The only knock I have on this place is that they're closed on Mondays. Great food. Great beer. Awesome happy hour (2-6). They have 30 something beers on tap. The burgers are awesome. The pizza is awesome. Relatively inexpensive.
Exceptional craft beer selection. 31 rotating taps. Nice ambiance, good service from knowledgable staff, and good food options.

Excellent beer selection. Best fish tacos I have ever had. Very cool vibe inside.  The service was top notch also. Three of my friends and I got a table for 4, and 2 others showed up later and got a separate table on the opposite side of the restaurant. We asked the waitress for a larger table to seat all of us. They stopped at nothing to make us happy. Even on a busy Friday night, they were able to cater to us and eventually got the 6 of us together well before we began eating. The waitress earned her high tip. We'll be back again, no doubt.

WOW do we love this place!  Craft Beer (so many different craft beers) and wine on tap.  The wings are unique and fantastic.  Great for a big or small group.  Nice outdoor area with bags to keep you busy.  The service has been consistently good.  We have never gotten a spot in the lot but there is plenty of on street (pay with app) parking.

Last night we went to Angel's Trumpet with our friends Andrew S. and Erin M.  It is a cool new local restaurant and bar in downtown Phoenix that opened a couple of months ago.  They have a huge variety of draft beers and a great selection of food that you can choose from.    We were going over the menus and Andrew S. was telling us about the Spam Sliders.  That is right I just said "Spam Sliders".  They were pretty amazing. The Spam was fried the perfect amount and it had feta and coleslaw on it.  I will definitely be back for those sliders.

I love gastropubs. I'm a sucker for  fancy bar food. And Angels Trumpet serves just that.  Usually, when I visit states and cities, that's the search word I use on Yelp "gastropub"  I chanced upon Angels and further review of their patron photos and menu, I realized they had poutine -- and it looked legitimate too! Fries, gravy and most importantly, cheese curds.   We were staying in downtown and had no inkling Angels was for the most part, on campus, a hangout for college students, nearly 2 miles away.  We already felt old-ish complaining about the seemingly endless walk, well, after stepping inside, in the company of all the hipster kids,  we felt even more ancient haha.   The menu was interesting, though wasn't unusual for gastropub fare. We ordered a variety of things: chicken wings, poutine, a burger which had onion strings (forgot the name) and the churchill grilled cheese.  I won't go into detail into each entree because they were all just OK. The item I enjoyed the least, surprisingly, was the churchill.  And of course, as expected for many hipster spots, NO regular ketchup. Well don't worry that didn't affect my review.    I really, I mean really enjoyed the poutine.  It reminded me of my days on Montreal when I ate it literally, thrice a day.   If I ever returned to Arizona, I would come back for the poutine.  Much more accessible than Montreal.

Had bookmarked this place ever since it aired on Check, Please! Finally visited two weeks ago and was unimpressed. Service was lacking with poor attention and no enthusiasm by the waitress. Over priced bar food. Ordered the wings and flat bread pizza. Wings were ok but then again I could have found wings anywhere. Pizza was large and enough to take home leftovers. Really nothing special to say. Bookmark removed.

So, so good. BBQ chicken salad is amazing. Casper pizza with salami, feta cheese, leeks, and honey drizzle is seriously amazing. Beer cheese pretzels are amazing. Beer selection is very impressive. Love this place! Wish it were close to my SD home!

Our favorite tap house in AZ!  Angel's Trumpet has a fabulous selection of beers...I have been exposed to so many delicious drinks here.  Love that you can select the beers you want in your flight!  Also, the food is amazing!  As a vegetarian, I am usually stuck with ordering a vegetarian burger at other places, but they have a TON of choices here.  I love the grilled cheese....with pesto and honey.  YUM!  Stop by and check it out!

Began the evening with a flight of ipa's.   The selection was outstanding and the bartender patiently answered questions about each brew.   They break the norm of craft brew houses I've been to by not saying "everything is totally like amazing" 10-20 times.  They asked what we liked and matched our food preferences with good beer choices.

Really enjoyed my visit. Thank you betsie Boop for the amazing service. Had the brewlee burger and was super impressed. Cooked medium rare and they nailed it. Fries were ok, chipotle ranch sauce was a highlight for me. Plenty of beers to choose from. Nice atmosphere. Great place to enjoy some food and beers with friends.

I loved the beer selection!  My feedback is that the inside seating is quite noisy.  We were fortunate enough to be there on a beautiful evening so we could take advantage of the patio.  I plan to do that again.  I don't think my evening would have been nearly as enjoyable sitting indoors, as there seems to be nothing to absorb the sound.  Waitress was a little slow getting around, and we had to wait a bit for our tab.   I will be returning for a social event this week, hopefully I'll be able to have a 4 or 5 star experience, in which case I'll upgrade my rating.

Really enjoyed Angels Trumpet Ale House.   Great assortment of delicious beer. The food is really good as well. I recommend the fish tacos... they were surprisingly good. The only reason I am not 5 stars on these guys is some sub par service from a server and a bartender.   The 'Beer to go' option is epic. You can pick your favorite beer from their tap and take it to go in a sealed house beer can. Pretty cool  Highly recommend this place!

I've heard only good things about this place, and I was meeting a friend for dinner on a Saturday night, so I decided to give it a try. The dining area is very spacious and they have a huge patio. We were seated promptly and then asked what we wanted to drink, their beer menu consists of 30+ beers all listed on a chalk board above the bar. I wanted to try a bunch so I decided on the beer flight, our server was very helpful and informative in the decision process. I told him what kind of beers I liked and didn't like and he wrote down his suggestions for my flight. All of the beers were very tasty and I decided on a few faves. For our meal, I chose the casper pizza and my friend got the fluffernutter, both were very good and the portion size was large.  I will definitely return to try more beer and food, as it's good spot for getting together with friends!

Stopped here for lunch while we were walking around downtown Phoenix. It was worth the walk, but I would suggest driving. They have a small lot. We started with the spam sliders! The cranberry slaw threw me off a little but it was surprisingly tasty with it. I added sriracha for a little kick. Delicious! I got the avocado salad for lunch. It was  light in flavor but still filling. I love the combination of the yellow beets, mint, avocado, and grapefruit.  My sister got the big guppy. The guac was creamy with a hint a citrus! Her boyfriend for the original salad with brisket. The brisket was smokey. They had a few beers; all of which they liked. I had the abita rootbeer, made with real cane sugar. Very refreshing and strong in flavor. The price was reasonable and food incredible.

Really great Burgers and Flat Breads! Their beer selection is always changing and fun. Very casual and "hipster" environment. The staff is usually pretty friendly.  Parking is difficult.  If you are downtown and never been here, you definitely need to check it out!

pleasantly thrilled with this place. Food was delicious and beer great. service was quick and attentive.  I had the tractor flatbread pizza which was an unusual combo of bacon,  brussel sprouts, and sunny side up eggs,  but it all worked together perfectly! hubby had the Matador with beef brisket, onions, peppers, cheese and horse radish dip with a side of Cole slaw and that was yummy too! I would definitely go back, especially for happy hour!
This place is delicious!!! So many new and fun types of beers to try. The food is so good! The fish tacos are to die for!

This is a long overdue review from several months ago.  I went with a group of friends for brunch and got a dish with a rotating wild game.  I can't remember the name of it any longer.  The game that day was alligator sausage if I remember correctly, and my table ordered four of them.  One of my friends asked for something to be held out of his.  After some good conversation our food started to arrive.  Strangely, everything but the three unaltered dished with the rotating wild game came.  When our server stopped by he was surprised that they were all missing and went to investigate.  He came back and told us that the printed copy that went to the kitchen was difficult to read and looked like there was only the special request my one friend wanted even though all four were on there.  He rushed the remaining three dishes out, and they were excellent.  When It came time to settle up our tab, our server had the manager take the three delayed meals out.  We didn't ask for that and no one in our group had any kind of complaints about the service.  He got a great tip out of it.  We had a great experience and will definitely be making more trips here.

The food here is amazing! Try the wings with the brown ale sauce and the outlaw (it's a southwestern burger) They make all the food themselves and it really shows. I found myself scarfing down their homemade catsup with particular vigor, and I'm not a catsup lover... Or even liker. Be sure to get the poptart for desert, it's always good. Of course I have to mention the 31 craft beers on tap and the trendy, hipster ambiance; but honestly I'd come here for any one of these awesome attributes... This place has it all! Want great service? Ask for Cindy. I've sat with her a few times and she always takes great care of me.
Ridiculous selection of beers. Parking is limited but ample street parking nearby. Angels Trumpet has a patio with mist sprayers for hot summer nights.
This place is in A class by itself. Can't compare with anything else in the valley. It's Awsome.  Great food. Clean restrooms. Not to crowded.

Bomb a$$ wings, the "Mess" (gravy fries),.place is awesome! Right across from the Film Bar on 2nd St just south of Roosevelt. Dog Friendly! I've taken my Dog here a few times and sat on the Patio,..he LOVES it! Super bizee during 1st FRI. Great Beer,..friendly staff!!

I live pretty close by so I'm not sure why I didn't try this place sooner! We went on a Saturday afternoon so it was quite busy but not so much that it felt uncomfortable in there.   First, the place is much bigger than I had initially expected and very very good for large groups (I know where I'm having my next birthday!). They offer, I think it was almost 30 at the time, beer choices. I went with a flight so I could try a few different ones I'd been eyeing. They all tasted great but I don't drink quite enough beer that I could really say I knew exactly what I was drinking. Along with the flight, I ordered, "The Mess," which is essentially poutine. It was soooo good! The fries were crunchy, the gravy was stewy, the cheese curds squeaky! Although I made it my meal, it can definitely be shared amongst the table. Also at the table were the well talked about spam sliders and grilled cheese sandwich. All good choices!   Overall, a great experience! I can't wait to come back for a TV dinner Tuesday, another new beer, or a pop tart!
Great beer selection and place to come with your friends!
Love this place. Chill atmosphere with plenty of beer to choose from. Food is good with good portions. Like that they have wine on tao as well! Definitely a good to!
Lots of good Oregon beers, should replace Full Sail with Double Mountain.  Food was good.  Fairly high hipster quotient, it'd be right at home in Portland.

Fantastic beer selection & the food was great. With 31 beers on tap this place is for serious beer lovers. They even have 5 wines on tap. The food was great; the wings had 3 different sauces for dipping. The service was prompt & friendly. I will definitely go back!

What?!!! Darn, I hate being pressured. Okay, a review. First, somehow, 'my' bartender always recognizes me AND know what I want to order; next, I love love love the clean white tiles for the splash back of the taps; next again, I love the chalkboard of beers on tap; they have a dog friendly OUTdoors patio; the bar has PLENTY of room; the (small) growlers are cute (see the pic); the NAME of the place; the door knob (know knows the significance? It has NOTHING to do with angels); the beautiful cross stich the Fates featured in the hall leading to the water closet; okay, I much prefer incognito, but did I mention my server? Thomas; the food? Every plate that leaves the kitchen/is served to the person sitting near me looks delectable.   Okay--done

We popped in here for dinner with the fam on First Friday last week and had a good experience! Despite it being PACKED, we were still seated quickly and service was prompt!   We were pretty thirsty so started with beer & wine! If you know much about this lovely place, you know that they have a very impressive beer list! So if you're a beer lover, this is your place. I, however, am not much of a beer drinker so I went with their Pinot Grigio on tap! It was light and refreshing! To start, we all split the pretzels. Oh man, they were hot and delish. They were served with mustard and a beer cheese sauce. For my entree, I got the 810 sammy but swapped the bread for a wrap. It had shaved *smoked* turkey, peppered bacon, avocado mash, pickled red onions, and adobo sauce with pickled jalapenos on the side. I love that they give you the option to have it in a wrap (on request only). It made it a lot lighter! I would for sure order it again.  All in all, this is a fun, trendy spot in Downtown Phoenix to come with friends, coworkers, family, you name it! They have something for everyone, and DEFINITELY will please all of the beer lovers in your group!
Didn't try the food but it looked great. Super busy when I was there but that just means they're doing something right. The beer on tap was great!
Great food! We had the Poutine and Spam slides for appetizers and beer. Cool vibes and great local selection.

I like the new kid on the block. Delicious drafts and wine on tap. Great service, nice location, and homemade freaking poptarts. I've gotten entrees and sides, wine and smiles. I am quite satisfied with this place. That is why it has earned my five.

I've never seen so many beers in my life. And try the tacos stuffed with mashed sweet potatoes, green chilis and cheese.  YUM!  The place was packed on a Saturday afternoon and now I know why.  So many more things to try on our next visit AND definitely a lot more beer to try!  I loved my beer, its #31...some Pilsner thing.  Perfect for me.
Great food, lots of great beer and I think the prices are really good. We always feel we've gotten good value from our experience there.

Beer selection was excellent with 31 micro brews. No bud light here. Great happy hour with $3 for 3 diff local beers.  Homemade pbj, grilled cheese and moose drool ale wings. The deserts are most impressive with home made pop tarts and salted flat bread with house made peanut butter house made marshmallows Dark chocolate chunks and honey drizzle
Amazing food! Great service and great beer! It's such a fun atmosphere and popular with the locals. They even have a lawn to play corn hole!

Such an awesome joint! They have one of the best salads (for a person that is TRYING, to eat healthy) and the most ridiculously delicious burgers (for someone who doesn't care about their weight aka: my husband). We've tried multiple burgers, deserts, and drinks, and they have all been yummy. Definitely love there home made ketchup and different take on ranch! We'll need to head over again real soon!

It's a great restaurant - plenty of space, lots of open architecture and multiple places to see what the drink options are and how they change. The food...fantastic. Parking can be tricky but if you're willing to walk a bit, you'l find something.

Been here a couple of times now.  It's pretty much the closest thing to a microbrewery you'll find in downtown Phoenix.  Tons of beers (and some wines) on tap and the choices always rotate.  This time around I got a Hefe from a brewer in the Czech Republic.  For lunch I got what was essentially a BLT on steroids with super thick bacon, lettuce, tomato, as well as pesto.  Really nice compliment to the beer.  The place wasn't too busy since its a Saturday afternoon, but I'm told this place is packed with downtown workers during weekday happy hours.  They have a nice outdoor patio that is ideal when the weather permits, though I kind of wish they'd put something else out there like cornhole toss, a live music stage, or something along those lines.  Overall, the food is pretty good and the service I've gotten here is pretty friendly.  The food and ambiance won't knock your socks off, but the beer selection is really hard to beat.  Nice to have a decent brewpub downtown.

Maybe I shouldn't have had such high expectations. I was so stoked on coming to this Ale House. I have had it on my "to-do list" for about a year. When I finally got the opportunity, I was super disappointed. I did really like the building and the bar set-up, the atmosphere was alright, the patio was pretty cute, but nothing special. Just like everything else.   To start, they didn't have the first 2 beer's I asked for. The 2 Sour's that were on their tap that evening were out. The bar tender handed me 2 samples "Here try these." I thought. Ohhh well that was nice of him. Well... lucky for him I am not very picky. The beers he handed me were NOTHING like Sour's. Not even Ciders. I'm pretty sure they were Pale Ales. Ok, whatever. So I picked one of them.   When we were seated it didn't take long for the server to see us and our friends. Pretty friendly guy. But that was the end of that. Our server was hard to track down the rest of the evening. Especially at the end of our meal, when it came time to pay. We sat there for a good 20 Minutes, we waited to catch him and ask for our checks.  The food was probably the most disappointing part for me. The best thing I had was The Mess: house fries, brown gravy & fresh local cheddar cheese curds. But even these were lacking of much needed flavor. The Cheese Curds were the best part. Salty and creamy. For our meals, my husband and I split both the Bbq Brisket Grilled Cheese: root beer braised brisket, pickled onion, tomato, smoked mozzarella, fontina, house bbq sauce  And the Nutter: house ground peanut butter with raspberry chipotle preserves & banana. The Brisket Grilled Cheese, #1 Where's the cheese!? Nowhere to be found. The BBQ sauce was gross. Not tangy or spicy, just bla... The Brisket itself was fine. And then for the Nutter, no flavor. Just nope. I had such high hopes. Dashed...  And here's a pro-tip. NO TALKING, you won't be heard. This place is SO LOUD.   I may have set my bar and expectations too high.  If I do go again, I know what to expect. And that is that.
Absolutely love this place and I cannot wait to go back. So many amazing beer choices and the food is fluffing good. Thank you for an experience like no other.

This place is pretty cool, not sure about the food.  When we got there it was not even 6pm and our server told us they were out of Spud Tacos and he would let us know how long before they made more.  We got a flight of beers.  I only liked 2 of the six he selected.  I am not a beer drinker, I like them light and not too hoppy or lemony.  After about 20 minutes we saw another server and asked her to inquire how long before the Spud Tacos were available again.  She came back and said 45 minutes, wow.  How long does it take to cook sweet potatoes in their kitchen?  We were not going to wait for them and we were glad because I read the review on the New Times about an hour later and it was not glowing.  I think this place has potential.  It is a little bit too noisy, I think they should consider putting some noise absorbing tiles.

I came here about a year ago with a few brothers and a cousin. This place had a delicious burger, had some type of Spanish meat or something. I spent about 1 hour trying to locate this place on yelp, finally found it! Great atmosphere and I'm coming back soon for that burger!

If it's a Tuesday and I'm in Phoenix, then I'll be at Angels Trumpet for TV dinner night. For $8, you get the most amazing selection of dishes. Each week is a different creation. Last week I had meatballs, pesto pasta, mushroom salad, garlic bread, with a cannoli cheesecake. Even if I'm not in town, I check the Facebook page each Tuesday to see the TV dinner meal.  On days other than Tuesday, I enjoy the pizzas. My favorite is the Tractor with 2 eggs, bacon and a variety of cheeses.   The continually rotating beer list is always top notch. Great variety and selection from breweries around the country. If there are a couple I have my eye on, the beer flight is a good option.  Always a great meal and drinks at Angels Trumpet!

I have a hard time deciding what to write about Angels Trumpet, not being a fan of beer, it's hard to give any of the breweries around town a fair shake. On their menu they've got items like spam sliders, home made pop tarts, flatbread pizza. Their beer menu is lovingly written on chalkboards around the bar and there's a huge ton amount of them; a real measurement BTW, look it up in any engineering book, if you can't find it right away, just keep looking.  Again, while we've already established I don't really love beer, I have partook from time to time, it's unavoidable when all your friends are doin it ;-)  I do enjoy their tasty salads, have sampled a number of other items from the menu and have never experienced anything I wouldn't order again; except for maybe that weird dessert pizza thing. It's like a big mixture of things from around your kitchen that you would make and scarf down when you've had one or two-welve to many. I love the hip downtown atmosphere and it's a great spot to gather with friends or randomly run into them, cause everyone is usually already there.  Happy Yelping Phoenix!

Second visit, solo this time. I arrived at 11:30 on a Wednesday and there were a dozen diners. I was greeted right away with ice water.   They had big wooden tables inside and out, plus seating for 20 at the bar. The loud music was popular 70's rock, like WHAM and the Police. Their beer selection was incredible, with over 100 beers available.   I ordered the Porky Sandwich, with fries for $11.95. Since I was working I had to eschew the ale.   My lunch arrived in 11 minutes.   The sandwich was served on toasted sourdough, with lettuce and spread, with homemade ketchup on the side. The ketchup was more like a BBQ sauce, which was better.   The fries were hand cut, seasoned little gems of yummy.   I still can't find any issues with this place, which is awesome.

This place is amazing.   Terrific atmosphere, great beer selections and amazing food.   Love that they have the revolving beer list so each time I come I can have something new.   The food is terrific. You have to try the homemade pop tarts. Looking for a good sandwich? Try the 810 with the pickled jalapeños.   This place is exactly what downtown Phoenix needed.

Angels?!?!?! Trumpets!??!? Count me in!  We decided to continue the night of fun and games at this place as:  1. It has beer 2. They VERY have flights 3. They are open late for those of us that are night owls  We arrived and the place was pretty much clearing out. The first thing you notice is the dozens of beers written on the chalkboard, the tell-tale signs of a hipster joint. The staff seated us promptly and we had a chance to look around at the pretty standard Oak table decor, with a jukebox machine thrown in "just because."   Since we were waiting we went ahead and looked at the board for our flight selection. For those that don't know what a "flight" is, you choose 6 beers and they serve them all at once in glasses. Simply put, it's a beer tasting except you drink it all. I order all the strongest beer on the menu because...I'm dead inside and have nothing better to do.  They also make home made poptarts which of course I had to try. The poptart comes with a bowl of vanilla ice cream as well. For some odd reason it took like 30 minutes for my poptart to come and another 10 for them to bring the ice cream after I reminded the waitress after one of her long disappearing acts.  I seriously couldn't finish the flight, but it was great! My stomach was so full of liquor and food from the night I could only finish 3.5 glasses (and just sipped the rest.)  Overall, good quality and they give you value for your alcohol consumption. My friends even found a beer that they've been searching for a vendor back in Chicago for months now since we visited this place! Would love to try a couple flights next time.  4 out of 5 stars

First off the food and beer selection was 5 stars. All of that was great. We ordered the pretzels, the poutine and the quesadilla special and it was all fantastic.  However, Im sad to say that the service was 1 star. Right after our food was delivered she did come ask how it was and then we didnt see her again. About 10 minutes into our food my husband was ready for another beer and i was out of water. We saw her going back and forth to other tables but she was not close enough for us to get her attention.  It was awkward because we spent the rest of our meal debating: do we go ask the bartender, do we keep trying to make eye contact? We didnt want to come across as rude but we probably should have just gone to the bar.   Eventually, she and i made eye contact and her expression let me know that she had forgotten us and she rushed right over. Unfortunately, we had been done for a while so we ordered some poptarts to go and left.   We are definitely going to go back. Hopefully the service experience was just a fluke. Everything else was really great.

Now that I've had time to reflect on my recent visit I've decided overall I did enjoy my experience here.  At first I was a little put off by the crowd but I now realize it was a based off a preconceived notion I had based completely off the location and building.    The food was very good, the service was great and I love how close it is.  I will give this place another try in the near future.
Great selection of craft taps, 31 that rotate frequently. Friendly staff, clean easy atmosphere. Ample parking. Home-made pop tarts for dessert! What's not to love!

Shit man, I would totes give a better review, but with over 400 reviews you don't really need to know this place is pretty awesome. I came in thinking I was going to have a couple beers and some good food. I had exactly that... Okay I had few more beers and some food. I left with three growlers of the strawberry blonde microbrew, excellent! The waiter suggested the fish tacos which my friend got, they were okay. I got the brisket tacos which were amazing. This is my new favorite place in Phoenix!

Cool vibe the antithesis of Scottsdale. An amazing,eclectic selection of beers. Nice outdoor patio. If you're downtown, don't miss this beer lovers  hangout. Have not eaten here but food looks and smells delicious

Nice place to meet up with friends and have a few good beers. The chalk boards list over 20 different taps, and they have a nice selection of local craft beers on tap. The food is good here but the last two times I went I got the Cashew Butter and Jelly sandwich, and its the best-est!  Angels Trumpet Ale House fills growlers

First time we went, it was five star experience. Great food, great service, awesome beer list, strawberry pop tart... We went back this weekend and it was pretty much the opposite experience. Service was terrible - she never offered me a beer after our flight and I couldn't ever catch her, we didn't care for any of the beers and the "special" burrito I tried was gross and missing half of the ingredients - too bad nobody came back to check or I would have sent it back... This place is always packed, you're gonna wait - check out tap hunter first and make sure you like what beers are on the menu. Its a cool place, we just won't be back anytime soon. Oh and if you can't see from a distance, bring your glasses/binoculars, the beer list is only on the wall.

Come thirsty y'all.  Tons of draft beer to choose from and if beer ain't your thing they have a handful of wine on tap as well.  But flights of beer is their signature order.   Unfortunately the 10" pizza we had was bland but you're coming here for beer which will not disappoint.

I have hit this place a few times for lunch, and have been impressed every time. The food is top notch and they have a great selection of beer on tap. The patio is always a great spot to hang out on. I have to say, this is turning into my go to spot for lunch.

As strange as this review might be, I am completely a fan!    We stopped here near the end of our First Friday night out with friends.  It was insanely packed and so we grabbed a couple chairs in the back corner.  Our waitress was still very accommodating and served us quickly with beer and drinks.  Don't ask me which of the many beers we ordered because I can't remember...  ...Because all I can remember is how insanely divine and delicious our dessert was!  We ordered the salted caramel flatbread that came highly recommended to us by a friend (see my picture I posted, #147).  It is completely homemade on a nice thin crispy flatbread.  Peanut Butter.  Caramel.  Marshmallow fluff.  Chocolate Chips.  Honey.  Pretzels.  If you aren't drooling yet, I feign to say there might be something wrong with your salivary glands or taste-buds.    I want to head back sometime to soon to try their beer, TV dinner night, and enjoy a table with some good friends.  I'm a fan Angels!!

Amazing pre-movie dinner for party of two. Started with a flight off their large selection of brews and proceeded to share a steak sandwich and a hot mess. Both great choices and large portions perfect for sharing. Always a ++ with the pet friendly patios!
This place is awesome for every reason. Music, Food and the ever growing beer menu. Only thing is hipsters gravitate to places like these.

Simply the Best and perhaps most daring and creative Pub style food on planet earth!  Well, maybe just Phoenix but I promise, you will NOT be disappointed!  The vibe and beer selection is simply out of sight!

Great chic bar atmosphere.  There are 30+ beers on tap that change when the keg runs out. The food is also really good. From the appetizers (we got the chicken wings, hummus and pretzel bites) and then there are flat breads and sandwiches (the basic grilled cheese can have the spam or bacon added on, and the nutter (pb&j with banana slices)). There is a whole back outside area (they have corn hole set up in the back and outdoor seating). Better food recently than what has been in the past. I would definitely come here, again!

Awesome food! And good beer! We are already planning our trip back.    We tried "the mess" appetizer, fries with gravy and cheese curds, and it was great! Big portion so the three of us couldnt even finish it!   My girlfriend got the flight of beers and said its a great option to try some of all the different kinds they had.   We also had the fish tacos, the tractor flatbread, and the chet burrito. We were raving about everything!    We also got thw rum mango poptarts and holy crap it was heaven in a pastry. 10/10 would recommend   Service was a little slow, but it was a busy dinner time so its understandable, I think its a great place to take friends or grab dinner
One of the most diverse beer selections in AZ.  Friendly service.  Very good food as well, I had the "810" sandwich that was very tasty.  Nice local people doing a great thing.

We came in on a Sunday afternoon after a spring training game. We were impressed on their space and beer selection.  I had a beer flight, $10 for 6- 3oz. pours, a great price as they don't have restrictions or upcharges for pricier beers.  Location-close to downtown.  Parking- metered only, $1.50/hr. Inside- nice size bar, open main area inside with large patio.  Ambience- decent/chill, not loud or rowdy A big Con was the limited and pricey food menu. We really wanted to snack on something but nothing looked appetizing or worth the price. Overall, still would definately return for the great beer selection.

Went on a Sunday after a game.Big beer selection and nice looking menu. I was surprised  and disappointed that our sever didn't seem to know anything about the beers. I was seated in a place where I really couldn't read the chalkboard beer list. The food was pretty good, but maybe have a printed beer menu with some descriptions.

I have enjoyed Angels Trumpet for years, until last night. I always come in with my pets. We sit in the patio. Last night I invited two of my friends as well with their own dogs. We waited 45 minutes to even talk to a server after being seated. We asked multiple times about our server and told that your server will be right with you. Never received water, asked for a order, nothing. We watched while 3 other tables that came in after us were seated and served. Made an attempt to speak to multiple servers around us at other tables and mostly ignored. Finally I decided I did not want to give my money to anyone there that night so we got up and left. Very sad since I enjoy the food and beer selection very much. I guess I will be finding somewhere else to fill my growler.

Absolutely love this place! HUGE selection of local and out-of-town draft beers, awesome food menu with things like burgers & flatbreads, great outdoor patio area, near downtown. Parking can be a challenge and you'll probably wait for a bit, but grab a beer & wait outside. Great atmosphere

That Chix sandwhich looked beautiful and was slammin'! The homemade ketchup with the fries I didnt really care for. Would have liked more ranch on the sandwhich, but it was still good. The cider of the day was kickin! Not a fan of that cookie dough pinwheel dessert, the "high roller". It tasted raw. 4 stars for that cider!
This new restaurant is great for downtown! The service and food were exceptional. My husband loved the "flight". We'll be back for sure!

My first time here, tried a variety of craft beers, my random selections looked like every color to the beer rainbow; there's one named after one of David Bowie's classic hits. The Jefferson quesadilla was really tasty-- should have ordered two . The patio ambiance was beautiful at night looking at the top of the skyline, waitstaff and bartender folk were very sweet and genuine.  I didn't know that the Film Bar's directly across the street from it. Ya vohl, I'll be back!
Service has improved immensely. Food always amazing and beer selection is what brings me here most days. Thank you!
It was fine, but it isn't the kind of place I normally go for lunch.  The food was a little out there for my taste.

The outlaw burger may have changed my life. Awesome food and even better beer. XXV from North Coast, CA is excellent. Great little joint. We were in and out quickly and everyone enjoyed the experience. I highly recommend.

I love this place. This is always the place I come to whenever I meet up with friends that are from out of town. Their wide selection of beer is great, and the food never disappoints! I always get really good service when I go there too which is awesome!
Love this place! Great beer options--especially when you're able to get the flight. The cookies are amazing, as well as the pizzas!

I thought this restaurant was overhyped for what it was. The poutine was very underwhelming and the spam slider were not very impressing. The service was good though, maybe the kitchen crew just had a bad day.

I love Angels Trumpet . That's why I'm giving a 4 star review. I go there fairly regularly and always have enjoyed good service, great food and a pleasant experience. However, yesterday I visited there with a friend who has been a long time,very regular customer of theirs and this time the service was not up to par. We had a dog with us and so we were on the patio sitting in the chairs at the edge of the patio and no one came to take our order or even say hello! There were three other tables on the patio when we came in and as we sat there one left,  it was a very slow time of day . The two servers on the patio  kept looking at us but they never came over finally my friend got their attention and the young man said oh sorry, I'll get your order but just so you know we don't normally wait on people when they're sitting here normally you would go to the bar and I asked him how I would do that since I had a dog and the bar is inside. He didn't answer. My friend went inside and just ordered from the bartender and bypassed the waiter. If they have a rule that certain seating on the patio is only for patrons who order at the bar there should be some kind of sign there because we had no idea that was how we were supposed to order. It's a dog-friendly patio so this doesn't seem to mesh. By the way the bartender gave us excellent service!
I was able to get six Saison and/or Belgian biers in my flight. I think they had like 37 beers on tap that night plus 8 wines. Friendly clientele. Very good sausage platter

This is by far the best place in phnx!!! I come here as often as possible and I live in the far East valley... they have this chef named Ben,  who, from every time I've been there has shown the food nothing but love, delicious we had this madator, brisket sandwich... I can't even begin to explain how amazing it was, smoke for e 12+ hour it was great, I've been lucky every time I come in the same guy " Ben " ironically same name as the chef" had been behind the bar and takes us on a tour of the country and craft beers, dudes an ace when it comes to good beer, today he recommended the " Thai speedway " from alesmith, ca.... such a delicious craft, if you're in the area this place NEVER DISSAPOINTS!!! The owners obviously are doing something right.... can we get a location in the east valley!!!???? Please!!!!!!!

BEST BEER SELECTION, house-made everything and a fun atmosphere, especially if you want to bring your dogs.   Get the wings (order them extra crispy) with the Moose Drool sauce and the wild game sausage platter.  Their rootbeer beef tacos are delicious, and the fish taco portion for the price is crazy!  This is our go-to spot to bring visiting friends and family.

Loved the atmosphere here, and the beer list isn't too shabby, either. Boasting around 30 taps, and most are not just your local beers like SanTan and Four Peaks like a lot of bars around the area. This place has a great selection, especially if you are a beer snob like me. For the food, we only tried dessert, but the homemade pop-tarts are amazing! Don't leave without trying some. The rest of the menu looked good as well, and we'll definitely be back to try more.
Just gotta love this place!  Love the beer sampler.  You can try so many different types of beers I've never even heard of.  Now I have about a dozen new favorites.  Great time, every time!

I want to say I love it because the atmosphere is incredible and theres a huge beer selection but...I've never found a beer that was truly great and I'm a beer guy.  Also, the food is pretty mehhh.  However, it's a great spot in a good area and a great spot to start a friday night.  Definitely don't write it off.

This place is my favorite place in Downtown PHX.  They are always rotating kegs out so there are always so many new beers to choose from.  Their wings tossed in hot sauce are definitely the best you can get downtown.  They also have TV Dinner Tuesday, where they serve a special meal in a TV dinner style plate.  Can be very busy, especially when it's nice out so plan on possibly waiting to sit.

Went there for the first time today. Now I see what all the love is about. Great service, amazing selection to drink, loved the wings. The Cherry Bomb cider was soooo good. Will be a regular spot from now on.
Awesome beer selection.  Food was pretty good too. Something like 32 beers on tap.  Will go again.
Stopped in for a beer.  Just awesome selection and superb service.  Would definitely recommend for foodies, beer snobs, and folks looking for a cool place downtown.  Check it out!!!

Just loved this place.  They know their beer and were able to make some great suggestions for me....because I don't know my beer.  My husband and I drank a beer or two and then turned to the menu.  It's fairly simple fare, but boy do they put a spin on it.  The sandwiches each of us ordered were unique and very very tasty.  The home made potato chips are divine, and my husband was really pleased that his coleslaw was delicious and the portion was large (unlike so many places that give you a tiny amount of  your side dish).  My only suggestion would be that the beers be offered in a larger size.  It was explained to us that, due to the alcohol content, the beer is served in a smaller glass - but it was a little frustrating to hubby to not get a larger amount ---the beer is THAT good.  Keep up the good work, Angels Trumpet Ale House.  We'll be back.
Super good food! Flat bread pizza, awesome! Got to get the Mess too! Oh and Really great beer selection!

Walked up on this place during a weekend pub crawl. Didn't regret it. The food is spot on and their beer options are insane lol. Friends got me to try the spam sliders here (first time spam eater) and they did not disappoint. Their pizzas are on point as well. Good ambience. I'll be back.
Great beer and good food had gaucho tacos liked them but not loved, pretzels were ok and nuttie flatbread was a very good dessert!

We stopped here before going to FilmBar, which is a cool experience (think Bar + Movie Theatre, but of an independent style).  Angels has an extensive beer list and fairly solid menu.  The demographics are artsy/hipster in this "North Phoenix" enclave, near downtown.   The spam sliders were incredible; also, I highly recommend the "Elvis-Type" sandwich.

LOCALLY owned & operated. (seriously, I touched the Owner!)  We like the Staff here, they are cool and friendly but not overly obsequious  like some pretentious downtown joints where they must have an a** kissing contest for TIPS going on.  PRETZELS are da bomb.  I had to alternate between the cheese dip and the spicy mustard with every other bite. Super Tasty! WINGS really nicely seasoned, NOT greasy. Meaty. Takes a little tooth action to strip them from the bone in a really good way, I think at one point I growled!  Spousal Unit reported his BURGER was high quality beef, well seasoned, cooked to order (still mooing) and the bun held up under the meaty pressure. My FISH TACOS were presented with just the right amount of black beans, some awesome spicy coleslaw and fresh avocado mash.  Fresh tortillas and nice flaky fried (deal with it) fish in just the right proportions.  The Beer?  But of course. Interesting. Worth doing a FLIGHT but ask for help, don't load up on all one style and miss the fun-fest in your mouth that comes from variety!
Good food and drinks. Huge variety of beers. Could use more healthy options on menu. A fun and progressive atmosphere; a great casual place to meet up with friends.

Great beer selection. Food is really good. Nice open atmosphere.  TERRIBLE SERVICE. That's the biggest turn off at a restaurant that is border line great. Their horrible service is the only factor that stops me from becoming a true regular here. And I don't mean regular by Yelp's standards. I've checked in twice so now I'm a Yelp regular.    I will be back because the good food and big beer selection, I just really hope they step up their service game.

Just a solid place for food and beer. Great beer selection. Some are definitely offbeat, so I love the sampler option (six decent sized pours). We went on Tuesday to enjoy TV Dinner night. It was an interesting mix of food - chipotle mac and cheese, salad, rice and beans, biscuit and a margarita dessert bar. Definitely carb heavy, but a great deal for $9. Had to try to the homemade Pop Tart - blueberry with a balsamic rosemary reduction drizzle. So delicious. I was stuffed but could not stop eating it. Comfortable, laid back setting, nice patio, friendly service. A great stop before a downtown event.

Definitely one of my favorite spots downtown! They have a great beer selection -- 31 taps that are always new and changing (they list them online too, which is nice). I love the atmosphere and both the indoor and outdoor seating. We've been lucky a couple of times and have sat at the half in/half out tables, and those are great :) the service is always amazing too, we've never had a long wait for anything.   Their Outlaw burger is one of the best BBQ burgers that I've had, and I've had a lot. The only thing I haven't liked that much so far is their salad, but I definitely want to try more things on the menu! My boyfriend likes the wings a lot and my sister has told me that the Bug Guppy fish tacos and margarita pizza (might only be on the happy hour menu) are amazing.   The parking lot is super small so it's hard to get a space at night, but there are tons of metered spots nearby! It's definitely worth the walk over. If you come here for dinner or drinks, definitely go across the street and check out Cobra Arcade! :)

Stopped in for a pint and a bite.  Great bartenders!  Told them what beer I liked and they gave suggestions for my next (with tastes first to be sure before I ordered a full pint).  The matador brisket sandwich on pretzel roll was amazing.  Two thumbs way up from me!!

man do i love this place.  excellent and always diverse selection of beer available.  the crowd is a mellow bunch and it's downtown location is really ideal.   the food selection is minimal but the flat breads and pretzels are really tasty.  perfect place to go if you're looking for some really unique beers and a great relaxing atmosphere.

Love this new place in downtown Phoenix!  The atmosphere is really cool; however, the acoustics are not good (only negative about this place).  The service was extremely friendly and helpful with recommendations.  The food was quite good and reasonably priced too...check out the grilled cheese and the chet - both delicious!
Great place and great food! I tried it during a First Friday event. Very good choice.

I really enjoy this place. Great view of the city. Really enjoy the beer and food selection. My only complaint was that the last time they were there it just wasn't properly staffed. It was a beautiful day (and perhaps it's having lived in Chicago for 9 years and suffering through cold where when it got nice EVERYONE was outside), but if I had a restaurant I would assume everyone would be out and on my patio. The servers were working extremely hard, but there just weren't enough of them.

Well yes once again great food and of course great beer selection had the wings with the 3 dipping sauces... Sat at the bar the bar tender dude was a complete dud ..... Ya that's dud not dude 0 personality when I asked for a recommendation on a beer he muttered a few thoughts not that I could hear him or understand him  ........ Not a people person I guess...zzzzzz usually we've always had great fun service

What a fun place!!   I don't drink beer, but I got the chocolate beer. wow!  I loved it! Four of us shared  5 appetizers.  They were so good!  We got 2 different types of the riblets, the pretzels, a trio of taquitos, wings. Our server was so nice!  He was full of information. You are missing out if you don't try it!

I agree with the other reviewers the service is subpar, and I sat at the bar. The beers are good, but the board(of beers on the wall) is lacking in details I want to know when doing a tasting. The restaurant also feels kind of empty. I know their going with a minimalist theme, but it's a little over the top.

Husband ordered: brulee beef burger w/medium over easy egg w/ fries which came with a special dipping sauce.  Me: 810 Sammy w/fries Toddler: cheese pizza Beer: AZ red ale My husband Loved his burger! It was huge so definitely filling. He said it was very flavorful the bacon was crispy, the green leaf lettuce was just a great combination for this juicy burger. I liked my Sammy - it was different, not bad simply good. The adobo sauce was good but I don't know maybe it was too smoky for my taste buds. My toddler had the cheese pizza. I have to say none of us liked the dipping sauce - tasted more like marinara sauce. we would have preferred ketchup, but regardless it didn't take away from this place or food.  We like the decor and it keeps a cool temp inside which is nice because of the az heat!

Great atmosphere, beer and service on those things alone it is 5 stars but was not impressed with the food and the table had 4 different dishes.  That being said the fries were awesome.  This place was packed and people love it but the burrito and the Matador sandwich were very average.

Always fun to explore the beer selection at this place. They change it often. the place has a trendy vibe. being close to downtown, on most evening finding parking can be a challenge. Food is creative and presentation is fun. I am big fan of the grilled cheese sandwich.

I love Angels Trumpet! I've tried a bunch of different items in my few visits, and they've all been fantastic. Couple the great food with their superb beer selection, and you've got a winning combo.  I can vouch for their burgers, fries, house-made pop tarts, and the "Nutter" sandwich (get it with marshmallow fluff too!). Those are all sure-bet items, and some of the tastiest things that exist in the Valley. *These may in fact be my favorite french fries around now too. Top notch.  The only thing wrong with ATAH is that it needs a bug lamp or two. There are way too many flies buzzing around.

Had the most AMAZING grilled cheese with bacon jam!! Don't miss out on this treat! Great beer selection, friendly service, and the food was beyond excellent. Appetizer wings exceeded expectations and my boyfriend had the burrito with homemade pork rinds, which were both super tasty. Will be back again for sure!

Came here for a friend's birthday this past Friday for the first time, as this is a regular hangout for her; I see why! Sizable back area, with heaters to keep the temperature just right. They also have an area for your dog, if you bring them along. Beer selection is rather extensive, food is great! Sampled a friend's pizza which, albeit was on the greasy side, was still delectable. The pouting was tasty, although the gravy could have used a bit less salt. Overall, would love to head back here again, maybe during the Summer..

Not only does this place have a fantastic beer selection but their lunch and food is super solid.  Had the 810 turkey sandwich it was fantastic great flavor fries were fried perfectly and love the house make ketchup, definitely recommend.

Just finished up with their smoked pork and chicken enchiladas, green chile corn bread topped with white bean chorizo, Arizona rice with smoked onion and charred tomato (best rice I've had in a LONG time) and finished it all off with a scoop of fried ice cream w/ sugar puffs and ganache that they kindly kept in the cooler until we were finished with our meal since we were on their patio.   One of the best TV dinners I've had here.  Chef Travis is a great new addition!   Washed it all down with a couple tasty Joseph James NV Collaboration Imperial IPA's and an Avery Samael Barleywine.  Service was awesome with Cyndy and support of Josh, Nicole & Amy all lending a helping hand.

Actual rating would be 3 stars. Here's the deal. Great beer, not so great service. I have been here lots and have had maybe one server who knew something about the great stuff they have on tap. Do not trust them for a recommendation. This can easily be fixed with training. It hasn't.  The bigger issue is this business's role in killing the Roosevelt BID. Furthermore, arguing that they MADE the area worth coming to when the arts community has worked for decades to bring people to downtown Phoenix. Owners are pompous and show a disregard for other local businesses. If you want to support local (which I hope you do), please look elsewhere. Will not be going back.
Once again this place has made me happy.  I wish they were closer.  The tractor pizza is so amazing.

Our first time was an overall good experience. The beers were tasty...the selection is awesome! The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. The atmosphere was pretty cool...loved our seats at the bar! The food was Meh (I've experienced better!!). Not what I was expecting when the food came out as everything else at this place rocked!! I got the fries/brown gravy/cheese curds plate. There were like 4 cheese curds on the plate and the fries were soggy and not that good. They did not have an condiment options other than their "homemade ketchup" that wasn't even close to ketchup. My husband had an Italian wrap and he didn't care for it either. If we go back...I'll be just drinking...not eating.

I went there for the first time yesterday. I had the bison dog with fries. I thought the food was really good. The one downfall, I got the homemade ketchup with the fries, It was o.k. it tasted more like thick marinara sauce than ketchup.   The service was pretty good, and I was happy with the large selection of beers they had to try. Some of the descriptions could have been a little better on the board so you had a better idea of what you were getting.

Being from the Northwest, finding a good ale house with a wide assortment of excellent beers is hard to find. Most ale houses in Phoenix offer many local choices. It's great to support local brewers, but it's also great to see what the rest of the world has to offer. This place offers a great environment and beer menu to go with it. Give it a try!

My husband and I love this place. It has an amazing beer selection and it is new every time. They currently have 31 beers on tap! They also have 6 wines on tap. All the food we have had has been really good. Their pizza is great! The only reason I give it a 4 star is because they don't have a happy hour and it is pretty pricey.

We visited here in the afternoon before heading to a friend's wedding later that day.  It was exactly what we were looking for, and it gives me hope for the Phoenix area.  The downtown area is a huge contrast to the urban sprawl of the rest of the Phoenix metro area.  We didn't have any food on this visit, but it looked really good.  The beer list was impressive, a good variation in type of beer and brewery location.  I tried the Dragoon 3 Goons Belgian Tripel, The Petrus Aged Red sour ale, and the Founders Porter. They had good music and a lot of seating, including a great outdoor patio.

I just want Angels to know how happy they made me by sitting my party down 10 minutes before kitchen closing and making my poptart demand happen! Excellent customer service. I've heard great things about this place and they were definitely up to par. Desserts are my life and their simple gesture of willingly taking me in at last call to get me what I wanted on a busy Friday night meant a great deal to me. All the staff I encountered were warm, friendly and attentive. I love the vibe and homey feeling of the whole restaurant. I will update next time I come in and try the food. But these stars are well deserved already.

Been here a few times the last year and just leaving as I write this review! This place is great as I usually go here in tandem with Cobra Arcade.This place has a vast beer selection and there is usually something new, so if you are the adventures type this is definitely a spot to check out. The food I would say is okay as it is the typical American dishes with a hipster twist, but with the pretty awesome atmosphere and the selection of drinks it is definitely a must spot to go to if you're around the Roosevelt area. Check it!

We usually stop at Angels Trumpet when we go to First Fridays. Impressive beers on tap - around 30 rotating beers. Food is pretty good. I really like their fries. I'm intrigued by their tv dinner tray specials - will eventually have to make it there to try it one day.   Discovered a little fun fact on my visit this past Saturday (first visit not on First Friday), they close at 12am. I really assumed they would've been open til 2am on weekends, nope.  Also, we made it in just 20 minutes before closing this past visit and got poor service from one of the bartenders. She seemed very annoyed by our presence and was very rude in her response to our questions. Also had a resting bitch face on the entire time. So, I'd suggest not to bother them anytime before closing.

Huge beer selection of rare beers, knolwedgebell and freindly staff, a great patio all add up to a good place.  Beers range $5-8 a glass so it is on the pricier end, however most of the beers are higher end micro brews. Our server was well versed in the brews and brewries which is nice when you are spening as much as a lunch on a single beer.   The patio has many tables as does the inside, making it acceptable for larger groups (6-10 people). There is also plenty of spance to stand around and drink.    They do have a full menu of intresting food items but I was just here to enjoy the beer this trip.
Do you like a large selection of non-traditional beers? Then I say YES! That is all - check this place out.

I think Angels Trumpet House may be my first love.   Everything about this place is just a YES! The food is soooo delicious and they aren't afraid to switch things up. I've had their burgers, chicken sandwiches, wings, and taquitos. Those huge taquitos are something amazing, try them! They also have this grilled cheese sandwich that you can add Spam to. Sign me up for three of them!  HUGE beer selection that is always changing. They also have wine, too!  The place is open late and serves until about 11pm on the weekdays, not sure about the weekends?   GO HERE. EAT ALL THE FOOD. DRINK ALL THE BEER.
