Every time I come here this place blows my mind! The beer and ale selection is fantastic and challenging. I feel like a better, more educated beer drinker when I leave. The food is F'n amazing. Pardon my French. The flatbread pizza, pretzels, spam sliders and burgers are amazing and the menu is constantly evolving. I live out of state but whenever I'm in Phoenix, I'm here. Cheers mate!
Great food and beer selection with a cool relaxed atmosphere. The avocado salad with smoked turkey was superb as was the 810. It's a must try!

Definitely a solid selection of beer, loved the rotating board of choices! Everything we tried was delicious.   Brewlee and Outlaw burgers delivered with sweet and savory flavors but both were rarer than they should have been. Would want to come back and try TV dinner night with some friends.

Angels Trumpet is a really cool place to grab a microbrew, and the food is good too!  They have a great selection of beers on tap and they always have new stuff to try.   The staff is very knowledgeable makes good recommendations on the fly.  Grab some friends, sit on the back patio, enjoy the view, and try a new brew.

We decided to stop at this hidden little brew pub to see what they had on tap.  We were downtown Phoenix checking out what they call the art district. There are old house converted into cool new repurposwd builings.  There is cool painted murals all over this area.  When we were done looking we decided to stop here for a beer or two.  We got seated right away and sat at a table.  We each orderd flights so we could try several new beers.  Each flight was 6 beers.  They had like 40-50 different craft beers on tap to choose from.  We had already eaten so we didnt order any food.  I will say though everything coming out of the kitchen looked and smelled amazing.  Before leaving my brother orderd an apple pop tart or strudle as a dessert.  This was homemade and very good.   We recommend everyone to try one of these before leaving....

Really came here for the beer in all honesty, but the food was good and the service was great. Our server came by and checked on us "just enough" so as not to be annoying, I.e. our glasses were always full and we never had to look for refills etc. if you weren't specifically searching this place out you might drive right past it. Great hidden gem in downtown Phoenix. I plan to be back as the menu is inviting and my friends' food looked delicious. I had the spam sliders and they were delicious.

In from Dallas and our party sampled several items on the menu, not one wasn't excellent. This place is amazing and will be an automatic every time we're back in Phoenix. Our server was very helpful and made our visit here that much better. If we could have given 10 stars we would have !

Love this place. They have a great selection of beer and on top of that they have my favorite beer! A Belgium while ale! So delicious! We were too hungry so we decided to ask the waitress which appetizer to get and she recommended the chips and salsa. It was so good, they make everything in house. Can't wait to come back and try other things in the menu.

Great craft beer restaurant. They have a chalk board with hundreds of beers on tap. I usually get a flight and let the waiter pick for me. All of the staff seems very knowledgeable. Love the food too!

Beer and spam. Let's goo!  I wanted to go here for a while and happened to walk in with some friends, not knowing the name. I looked at all of the different beers, the cool patio and interesting menu. Finally someone told me where we were and it all came together! This is a very cool spot, fairly unassuming from the outside. Once you're in, they have TONS of craft brews from across the country. Take your out-of-town friends here. Each have a decent alcohol percentage, so watch yourself.  There is a good assortment of interesting items on the menu, including spam! Other dishes are pretty creative and add to the mystique of the place.  I wasn't able to spend much time here but can't wait to go back.
Business did not consider party within "ale house" standards. Did not and will not compensate them for disrespect.

The only time I've been let down was when I stopped by for lunch during the week (they open at 3 M-Th).  I've had the burger with bacon and onion strings twice (can't remember the name), once with beef, and once with smoked, ground pork (smoked on the premises).  Delicious both times, but I'll stick with medium/medium rare beef for my burgers from now on.    The flat bread pizzas are pretty good, had the Alligator Pear pizza off of the "specials" menu.  The Avocado Salad was good too, and they smoke vegetables as well.  Who knew smoked beats could be so good?  The beer selection is constantly changing and has a couple of somethings for everyone.  Go and try something new to you.

Very few places capture the essence of eating in the middle of Phoenix quite like this one. With 30 revolving micro brewed beers, a menu that is simply delish, you simply can not go wrong here. My wife and I started with the "Hot Mess Fries", it was served hot with gravy, wonderful. I got the "Animal" burger, blue cheese and onions along with a custom sauce, best burger I have had in a long time. My wife got the "Trucker" pizza, loaded with bacon. Combined with a couple of micro brewed beers, and we simply could not finish everything! Our server was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. Eating on the patio offered a wonderful view of Phoenix, and there was more than enough room. Don't delay in trying this place out, you won't regret it!
Love the restaurant, beer and staff. You will normally find us Thursday evenings to enjoy a good brew.
Went late night with friends and my chihuahua. Nice patio area. Outstanding beer selection. Very good food selection for late night. Attentive service.
Drinks were good.  Did not eat, but it looked ok.

This place has some of the best and unique food anywhere in AZ.  Everything I have had is just hands down amazing.  Their beer selection is always great, except sometimes they are a little heavy on the IPAs.  This brings me to one of the best parts of this place, the people watching.  The "normal" crowed for this place will put the word Hipster to shame.  Plaid, Plaid, and more Plaid with some great thick frame glasses and Toms or Sperrys and everyone will love you.  If that is not your style go there to have some great laughs.   The wait staff knows the beer and always has great recommendations and will take care of all your needs. Even if people watching is not your thing go there for the amazing food and wait staff!!!

It's one of the most casual beer places with pretty decent food. Their wings are on point, and the flatbreads are usually my go to. Burgers won't disappoint you either. The only drawback is the long line on weekends but you can just grab a pint while you're queuing.
Everything that I've eaten at this joint is top notch. They have plenty of beers and wines on tap, constantly changing the drink menu daily. Just go! You won't be disappointed.

My review is only on the food from just one visit and not on the abundant selection of over thirty craft brews they offer on tap. I also noticed a selection of wines on tap and a very nice large dog friendly patio.  I ordered what I think was called the avocado salad and it really was among one of the best salads I ever had anywhere. It was unique and interesting and something better than what I would have at home because I wouldn't take the time to smoke my own beets. The combination of creamy avocado, mild goat cheese and smoked beets with those tasty little just the right amount of toasted almonds was quite a sensation in my mouth. I will have to steal that one as it really was that good. The greens were very fresh and above average and the dark meat chicken option was tasty and cooked just right. I also enjoyed the supreme segments of grapefruit as they added so much brightness and freshness and really cut the richness in the salad. The salad had everything going on it was really good.  My husband had the matador sandwich, it was pink beef with onions, peppers, mushrooms, horseradish Havarti cheese and a pretzel roll with two dipping sauces and fries. I didn't taste it but I thought it looked good. My husband said it was good but would have liked the peppers cooked more and more of them.  I would like to try the beer sampling option next time.  I thought the meals were reasonably priced. If I remember correctly the total including tax was around $23.00.
Great food , even better beer! Very nice atmosphere with friendly service! They,have a great selection(31) of beers and 6 wines on tap!
This place was descent in price and good environment. Try the grilled cheese is soooo good!

Oh man they have an AMAZING selection of STRONG beers!  As a craft beer nerd from San Diego, the CAPITAL of craft beer south of Portland, I was impressed.  And their pork burger with fried egg was AMAZING!  I am glad i found this spot before leaving AZ.  If you like craft beer and fatty foods to go with it, this is the place.  If you like budlight and carrots....for the love of God, change your lifestyle. The 6 drink sampler is perfect for a taste, but i really wanted to try more, since their beer is of a great variety (not just a bunch of IPAs and Wheats and Belgians, but they seriously ran the gamut) .  Will return if I make my way back to Phoenix!

We decided to stop for happy hour and glad we did! Although I'm not a beer drinker, wine for me, we thought the reviews looked good.  I had the Fun Guy flatbread and it was delicious and plentiful! Hubby had the grilled cheese and brisket sandwich. He eats for real and couldn't finish the whole thing.   He enjoyed a lager and I tried a couple of really good wines.  The service was exceptional and friendly.

Angel's Trumpet is one of my favorites. When living in Phoenix I would always come in for food, especially for TV dinner night.   I'm really glad that I got to come back as a beer snob after living in San Diego for a while. Because breweries are scarce in the Phoenix area, Angel's Trumpet is the perfect place to try local beers. There were even some from other states that I had wanted to try. We were able to try 2 flights and then ordered pints of the ones we loved. My favorite of this visit was the Bread Pudding beer from Huss. It was delicious.   We were more than satisfied with our visit and the servers were helpful during our beer selections. If you're in Phoenix and you love beer... Go to Angel's Trumpet!

I was surprised how packed the place was for a Wednesday night; I snagged the only open seat at the end of the bar. The bartender was very friendly and greeted me right away. I needed a sec to look at the taplist. It was tough to read them all so I checked Taphunter. They had poured the last of a dunkel I wanted to order, but the bartender suggested a witbier substitute, and it was good.  They had some tasty-sounding specials, but I ordered the Brewlee burger with fries, and it was solid. The meat was cooked well, and the carmelized sugar on the burger added something unique. Fries were well-seasoned and crispy. The dipping sauce that came with it was odd. It tasted like a strange attempt at ketchup, like a salty and sweet bloody mary mix.  Maybe slightly more than brewpub prices: I paid $25 or so after tax and tip for a burger and one beer. The atmosphere here wasn't what I expected; it was definitely more happening and a lot of people were there to drink. I guess I anticipated something a bit more chill, but no matter. They clearly do a booming business.
We we're attending a Suns game and yelped a place to eat.  Family friendly, nice staff, well priced for the amount of food, and fun ambiance.  Good place to stop at before a game.

This place is incredible, i'm not one to often go out for burgers. But when I go to Angels Trumpet it is always the Brewlee Burger that comes with a fried egg. Be sure to get the fries that comes with their home made ketchup (you;d be surprised how likable this side sauce is). I think that's all you need to know... wait the Beer!   They always have new beers to try, order the flat which will give you six samples of the beers of your choice. Outside sitting area with space to play bags.

I love this place! Talk about great beers! There is something for everyone, the taps are always rotating and they're always well-poured and perfectly cold.  The food is also solid. We ordered the pretzels, which were SO GOOD. I probably could have eaten the whole plate but I like to keep my friends.  I also ordered the hot wings, which were crispy and delicious. Everyone was pleased with their food.  Angels get s busy on the weekends, so be prepared to wait. We went across the street to the Cobra Arcade Bar to have a beer and play a few games while we waited to be seated.  Cheers!

2 1/2 stars for their flabreads. 4 stars for everything else.   They have a great selection of beers. They even have draft wines if you are into that. The atmosphere is also great. It has a bright, sunny, open feel in the daytime and becomes more intimate at nighttime, Either way, it feels like Im at someone's 1960's home but with a modern twist (seems weird to say but thats how I interpret it.)  I tried some of my friends avocado salad and thought it was pretty good for being basic, The flatbreads on the other hand could have been better. The bread that had toppings got soggy real quick. The cheese felt like food truck quality grade, nothing real stood out flavor wise except the grease from the meats and cheese, and the brussel sprouts were undercooked. I was still able to eat it but I dont have the fondest memories of eating it.  Even though the flatbreads arent that good, the beers and atmosphere win me over that much. Although hesistant to eat anything big from here, the beer should be the focus.

Perfect place to go if you are downtown for an event or any reason.  Not only do they have a great selection of BEER, the menu is fantastic.  There were too many choices to narrow down my meal.  Kudos to Ashley for great service and meal advice.

Here are my 2 biggest gripes about this place. It is loud. Like really loud, so loud you have to really come close to yelling to be heard.  Also the service is mediocre at best. I really don't think this is anyone elses fault but managements for running the place, what seems to be, threadbare  at best. The staff were hustling on a Friday night and even so they were clearly overwhelmed. Maybe on weeknights, this can be a quiet little place to go to but don't bother on the weekend. Every single time I have been here, it has been packed.   The beer selection is excellent, they do offer samples if you cannot decided what to get before you get a full pour. I wish they had more Belgian beers on tap but there's so much variety to pick and choose from that it is impossible to get everything up there anyway.   The food selection is good and I mostly stick to the appetizers or snacks when I'm here, I mean lets be honest I'm here for the beer and so far it has not disappointed. The waits were not too long for the food regardless of how busy they were , so kudos to the kitchen staff for hustling like no tomorrow.   Great place for large groups, the outdoor seating area has some games and is nice when the weather outside isn't oppressive. The patio is dog friendly so bring your puppers cuz they need some love too :)   Fun fact: Enjoy the mural outside by the empty plot of land before someone throws up apartments all over it. Angle's Trumpet Ale House and the Goldwater institute sued the city to prevent a taxbreak to Amstar/McKinley LLC over a proposed 6 million taxbreak to build micro apartments on that empty plot of land. Not sure how I feel politically about this, but hey, beer.. amirite ?
Corn hole! Yes...not many down town places have games but they do..the food is excellent!  And the beer..always a treasure to seek out! Dessert? oh yeah..the pop-tart....yum!

Went there Sunday for lunch. Very nice beer selection. Menu for lunch is very small.  Not sure why for a Sunday with games on TV, why isn't there some finger food? Simple platter with some chips,peanuts,olives,wings...??? Definite minus.   Waitress were very nice but seemed a bit confused and/or slow. The cook screwed up  the order which took even longer to rectify.  Why do you call everything with a funny name? Just call it a burrito since this is how the waitress is going to explain it to the customer anyway....  Last, it was about have way full and the noise level was high. Can't imagine how high it gets when they are full. Must look into putting some form of noise abatement.

I've been coming here sporadically for several years...I love the food, the beer is good (though despite a constant rotation of beer, they manage to not have a lot of diversity in type) but the service is pretty horrendous. Speaking as a long time server/bartender, the wait staff seems terribly disorganized. Good luck trying to get another beer, have a server check on you after you get your food, or close out your tab. Either they're terribly understaffed, or their employees do not understand table service techniques.   Will I return? Probably if friends want to, but I won't ever suggest it again.

Great food and 30 beers on tap. I had the BBQ brisket grilled cheese which was outstanding. The french fries are nicely seasoned and they make their own ketchup which was awesome. Top it all off with good service and reasonable prices and you have the recipe for a winner.

If you want craft beer this is absolutely the place. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but this place has an amazing menu. Their home made pop tarts are a must try. I love everything I've tried on the menu. I live out of town but every time we're in AZ we come back. 5 stars all around for sure.
This place was really good.  The peanut butter and chipotle raspberry jam sandwich was amazing!  You have to try it.

Honestly, we were trying to go to Phoenix Market cafe but they were closed for a private event. We found out about this place and it was the greatest blessing. This place was quite quaint and even though we got appetizers, it was so filling. So filling to the point that we weren't able to eat the dinner we had planned with other coworkers. Churro Raspberry pop tart was everything! The cauliflower pizza was delish. Who would have thought that the taquito sweet potato's would have tasted so amazing with those two sauces on the side. I should have taken pictures!!

Angels has an impressive collection of beers on tap originating from local Arizona to California- lagers, ales, stouts, you name it, they've got it. If you're feeling overwhelmed by the choices (there are 31 after all, not even counting the wine), ask for a sampler platter! My boyfriend and I got lucky and got a free drink from Fat Bikes who was doing a promotion. If you're looking for a hip location just to hang out with friends and throw a couple back, this is the place for you. The only down sides are that 1. Bar space is very limited and the overall venue extremely packed- there's restaurant seating as well. 2. The bar tenders were efficient but were very low on energy and enthusiasm. It was mildly making me depressed just watching them.

I've been here more times than I am able to count on my fingers and toes... I think that about sums it up  OH... I am a HUGE chicken wing fan and the harshest critic of their preparation and flavor... This place is one of the top 3 places I will actually go specifically for the wings...   Kuddos to the chef!!!!!!!!!

Great little spot! Great food and good service. Came in for the beer - stayed for the food. We sat out on the patio and enjoyed the ambiance. Have not been back, yet, but next chance we get will hit them up.

So, I have now been here twice and have had a great experience both times.    Also, both times I brought my seven year old son with me.   (Yes, I am one of those people who think it's totally appropriate to drink a beer in public in front of my child......)   So...plusses:   - huge selection of beer and the flight option is nice - you get to taste so many!  And who doesn't love it when beer comes in an adorable muffin tin? - Food was very tasty!   My son had the buffalo dog and said it was the best hot dog he had ever had.   I'm vegetarian and didn't have trouble finding anything on the menu.   -Fun atmosphere, great decor, large patio   Minus - The brunch menu today was limited.  My son REALLY wanted a buffalo dog today - in fact, he chose the location because of it - and he was very sad that it wasn't on the menu.     Extra plus:  - Excellent service!  They made my son a buffalo dog today at brunch, even though it wasn't supposed to be available today.  We will be returning on a regular basis!

We stopped at Angels Trumpet Ale House on Kerry M.'s birthday. I love the look of this bar! Very open and modern looking, also very hipster-ish. They have an large outdoor patio and don't even get me started on how tasty their pretzels are! What I loved about this place is that they have ~40 beers on tap and when one is empty, they add something completely new and then update the 2 chalkboards. It leaves you wanting to know what's gonna be tapped next. Love it!

Where should I start . Cool environment .cool staff . Had some wine . Cool . Ordered some tacos on the appetizer part . So cool. Have no idea what was in it . But delicious . Had some fries . The bomb . Ketchup home made sauce . Idk about that . Pop tarts for desert . Lord . I will be back . Period
Great rotating beer selection !   Strong local showing, just don't see Santan today.  Only so many handles I suppose.  Check this place out.
We stopped by after a movie at the Film bar for a few drinks.  Sat on the patio with the misters going.  Good service and the wings were great.

Second time in and I'm still going back.  The atmosphere is beer centric with great food compliments to set off a solid meal. There's a back patio with cornhole and plenty of seating so you can enjoy killer Phoenician weather this time of year. The selection of beers will keep you going for quite some time, my friend had a flight and although there wasn't much guidance of the random beers we knew nothing about its will fun to try and learn and ask questions from their lively bar crew.  It's places like these that are really helping develop the Phoenix food and drink scene.
The burgers here are to die for.  I love the way they are constantly adding new beer taps to their menu.  The atmosphere is great!

I really like this place. I really really like it.  31 draft craft beers... all written out on some sort of chalk board... you are bound to find one that your little heart desires.  I really enjoy oatmeal stouts so my waitress was able to recommend one that I fell in love with.  They are ever-changing.  A little on the pricier end but worth it.  The decor is great... & I love the patio.    Their flights are served on muffin pans.  I thought that was super clever.  Food looks great... I stole some sort of meaty concoction of a pizza slice for the people I was with & it was cheesy perfection.  Can't wait to try the other stuff on the menu as well.

Large selection of beer and very laid back ambience. Perfect for a relaxing saturday night with good friends. Would give it 5 stars if I didn't have to setup my own corn hole boards. How hard is it for them to already have it setup so I don't have to do the hard work?
Great patio, great selection, but the service needs to be better.

Met a buddy of mine here before a concert down the road - was spectacular!  Great craft beer selection with plenty of IPAs on tap.  Server was very knowledgeable about brewers, locations, etc.  The burger I had could have been the best burger ever!  Also, loved the slaw it came with.  Definitely a place I would visit again!  Could be the best kept secret in all of Phoenix.

The food here was really good! I'm not a beer drinker (not by choice...unfortunate allergy to brewer's yeast) but I enjoyed watching my bf enjoy his flight, which was reasonably priced. The fish tacos were amazing! My bf ordered a burger and the fries had a delicious homemade ketchup-like sauce. He rated the burger as "really good", which strayed from they typical "it was okay" that I usually get. Great service. Not too crowded for Sunday lunch. We will definitely be back.
Great beer selection. We went for the Tuesday TV dinner. It was yummy, filing, and you can't beat the price!
Disappointed in our meals recently: server recommended green chili burrito, the famous fish tacos, and cheese flatbread.  We'll stick to sandwiches and salads.

First of all, I drove past it because the place is so nondescript.  I thought I had the wrong address for a minute.  It stands right next to an empty-open-dirt lot right across from the Film Bar. Once I got in, I immediately like the open-flow of the place because it carries from inside to outside effortlessly. The layout is quite laid back and they even have lounge chairs outside for some real relaxation. I also thought that the blackboard listing all their drinks had a nice eccentric effect to it.    We went on a Friday late afternoon and the place was semi-full but completely full two hours later.  I enjoyed the Farm flat bread pizza topped with delicious veggies.  I loved every bite even though I'm not a vegetarian.  My two friends each enjoyed the Flight which is a muffin tray that holds six small glasses of different beers of your choice.  I was too hungry so I didn't go for that.  But if you go there on a full stomach, it's a great choice if you want to try almost all the drinks.

Great treat after a 25 mile bike ride, our group of 75+ ascended upon Angels Trumpet and they did an awesome job with the food and booze, wings are great along with the beer selection. Outside patio is wonderful

With open and loud seating, this beer bar offers a great selection of tasty brews from all over the world all micro in nature. The big flavors of lagers, IPAs and porters, among many others, are available to customers as pints or in flights for tasting. Though the menu could be a little more creative, it leaves you with several yummy choices to accompany your beer.   If you're a beer lover and like loud, hip places, this is one you should definitely check out!
One of the best burgers I've ever had. We were a group of 6 all varying in ages & everyone loved their meal. Great staff & nice environment. They even have a space out one the patio for dogs :)

My husband and I were extremely impressed with the food we had last night. We shared the Big Guppy fish tacos, the Brewlee burger, and for dessert we took an order of salted caramel chocolate chip cookies to go. Everything was delicious. Our server was very friendly and took the time to give us info on the food and some of their beers. They said our wait would be 45 minutes but it ended up only being 20. It was definitely worth the wait.   For two entrees(which had plenty of food), 2 beers, and dessert our check was $39.00.   The only negatives... it is very loud inside, not a big waiting area, which could be an issue if it is cold or hot outside, and not a very big place, which means you're more than likely going to wait during peak hours.   We will definitely return soon!
Never fails! There is always an amazing selection of craft beers and pub/semi-gastro eats. Have a burger, pick a beer (or try a flight) and must of all: ENJOY!

Terrible service. I'm usually one to not care about service if the food is good, but this place is just too rude. Even tried to give them the benefit of the doubt. We had at least 4 people help serve us and 3 out of 4, were just completely rude.

One of my favorite places to go in downtown Phoenix!!!  I take everyone who visits here!  Highly recommended!  Service is amazing!  The owners are awesome, and so friendly!    Try the spam sliders you won't regret it!!!!!

This place can get a little boring, but you know- if I'm in the mood to sit in a lit up beer house and eat man food- all delicious, but everything heavy and meaty. I suppose this place will do.   The beers are great. It's much better to do beer flights though, as the slection is so broad, you always feel like you are missing out... at least I do.  Vegetarian food options suck. Pizza is okay. The burger looks fantastic, if only I ate burgers. I always end up getting a pretzel, I like the beer cheese sauce stuff.   I wish they had some lighter small plate options. The pretzel seems to be the lightest warm option they have.
I'm sure the food is good, unfortunately the chicken I ordered was as is dry as the dessert and the waitress had a ops mentality. That's to bad
Great beer selection and has an awesome patio!  Dog friendly for all the animal lovers. Good food and friendly service. Definitely going to become a regular.

My roomie chose Angels as her jumping off point on her birthday weekend. They have a pretty awesome beer selection! I had a couple Belgian beers, which were both very good. Too bad I can't remember their names... Blame the cocktails I had at subsequent bar stops. ;)  I digress.... They write the beer selection on a GIANT chalkboard behind the bar and it is ever-changing as the beers run out and new ones are tapped. Most of our group ordered food and everything looked really tasty.  I tried a friend's sweet potato tacos; sounds unique and they are! Deep fried tacos full of sweet potato and mild spices; tasty!  Bf ordered a meat flatbread... This thing was larger than expected and a great deal for $10. He picked the meat off a piece for me to try and it was quite yummy. The sauce is a roasted tomato and gave the flatbread a great layer of flavor.  They also have a great big back patio... It was a little too warm for our group to sit out there, but over the next month I imagine it will be a really great place to chill with friends and enjoy some brew.  =)  Hope to return soon!

Great crowd, excellent beer selection, Tuesday night is TV dinner night, was a nice meal and had all the major food families! Will definitely come back here in the future! Sat at the bar, nice people behind the bar, guys next to me from Minneapolis and Portland OR, both beer aficionados, learned a few new things about the beer I'm drinking.

If you're a beer lover, you'll probably love Angels Trumpet Ale House, which has more than 30 beers on tap in downtown Phoenix. The spot also serves up lunch and dinner, with a menu full of sammies, pizzas and hamburgers to be enjoyed in the large communal dining room, at the beer bar or out on the patio.  I love that the bar and eatery is right across the street from FilmBar, which makes it an ideal place to grab a bite and drink before a show. When I last went there, I got a Churchill Grilled Cheese Sammy ($8.50), which I got with fries. It wasn't my favorite grilled cheese (I would leave off the pesto next time), but the portion was so huge I could barely finish half my meal. It was a great value.  My companion got the Tractor pizza ($11), which was one of the most unique pizzas I've ever seen -- it came with Brussel sprouts, bacon, caramelized onion, and even an egg on top.  As for beers, there are giant chalkboards describing each one, and the servers are really knowledgeable and can help guide you toward a good choice.

Tonight was my third or fourth time dining at Angels Trumpet and I still have zero complaints. The beer flight and the grilled cheese sandwich with bacon jam are definite must haves. The service is great, the servers and front of house staff seem to really jive well and anticipate guests needs. I highly recommend Angels Trumpet!

Walk into Angels Trumpet House and it feels like you've left Phoenix and entered a city like SF's establishment. At least that's what I think. The vibe here is very cool, urban, indie, and just simply brewtastic. It's brewtastic because they serve just about every cool beer you can think of.   It's a very open environment with long tables and a spacious patio. Music plays over the loud pseaker, beer flavors line the walls and a large bar top welcomes guests to take a seat. Between the atmosphere and beer selection, if you like beer this is your place. It's also right across the street from Filmbar so a great stop before or after your indie film!

Exceptionally fast service from start to finish, and the food was good (had spam sliders). Would love to see them up their game on the beer list - lots of tools out there to allow for more details regarding what is on tap.

Atmosphere was fun. Asu game was on. Amazing beer selections. The food-... had the fish tacos 'the big guppy'. They tasted like nothing, with a side of vinegar cabbage slaw and avocado mash that had waaay to much cumin, and sort of made it inedible. :/ the ratio of fish to tortilla was good if we're speaking dollar value but not to enjoy without taking a piece out. Their 'housemade' ketchup is super fresh and amazing for spaghetti- not fries. Thank god my friend ordered the 'fun-guy' pizza flatbread..it saved the meal! All and all more of a beer drinking spot with over priced-hipster bar food.
Best pork rinds ever!! Love the cool local vibe. Great food, took me to a happy place!!

Went here last night for some dinner with friends. Let's me start off by saying I didn't drink here so I can't comment on their beers, which I know is huge. I did have their grilled cheese and it was good but not great. The cheese was like it had been melted but then sat out for a bit so by the time I got it it somewhat rehardened. My friend was extremely impressed by the wings, so maybe I just didn't get the right thing. I will definitely give this place another try to experience their beers and try something else off the menu. Dog friendly patio is a huge plus too. All in all not blown away but not discouraged from going back.

Wonderful place to grab a brew.   Pretty neat place. Nice patio which I hear is dog friendly And lots of brews to choose from which is always a big plus in my book.   We grabbed a few pitchers of beer here; one pitcher equals 2 glasses and at 6 bucks a pitcher it was a good deal.  I saw that they had SPAM sliders, and I do love spam, so I badgered my other half into ordering them.  I really enjoyed my Spam sliders, they were cooked crispy and came to the table nice and warm.  They went perfectly with my pitcher of Mother Roads black IPA.  Our service was a little on the slow side, unless you are sitting at the bar.  It has always been moderately busy when we were here, but not too busy that it is too loud (I hear that is a major complaint).  Since I don't like overly loud places where conversing is a problem, I think I will continue to come here during off peak times.
Awesome flatbread pizza and an even better selection of beer.  Word of advice, don't try the wild ale. The color is deceiving.

Went here while visiting friends who suggested coming here. We had a party of 5 and arrived on a Saturday around 6pm. There was a wait, but it was not too long, probably 15-20 minutes. We sat outside after a table was ready.  I decided to go with the beer sampler special, which is any 6 beers on tap, I think it was around $11. I tried a range of different beers, from an IPA to a brown ale to a saison. I really liked the selection -- it was hard for me to decide because there were so many delicious-sounding beers to choose from! I would order 4/6 of them again, and the other 2 were just not my taste. For dinner, I ordered a pulled pork sandwich with avocado (I forget the name of it). Fries came on the side. The bread and overall taste of the sandwich was good, but unfortunately the pork was dry. My boyfriend had brisket in his sandwich, and he said his meat was also dry. At one point a piece of pork fell out of the sandwich, and I thought I was picking up a fry, but it was actually a long strand of dry meat! The fries were very good though - perfectly crispy. Our service was great...our server checked up on us the perfect amount and was quick bringing everything out.  I also really liked the vibe here. There were all kinds of people dining the night we went. Older people, young people with beautiful tattoos, a group of people wearing onesies and halloween costumes, couples, singles, etc. It was a great night for people-watching. The place was pretty packed but I never felt like it was too loud.   I would definitely come here again, and either order a different sandwich, or hope the dry meat was a fluke. I loved the vibe and the beer selection. Overall, a great place in Phoenix!

Great beer selection! Food is top-notch; friendly knowledgeable staff. Definitely a do-again! We came for lunch; I had the Matador and my husband had the 810.  Highly recommend, even if you have to drive a bit to get here (we drove from Chandler).

sometimes i wished we lived in dowtown phx. there are just blocks and blocks and blocks of cool eateries and bars and people. such was last night on our night out to visit some friends for drinks at Angels trumpet.   the interior space is beautiful...a mix of exposed construction with clean wall tiles and accessories. there as an enormous patio but don't know if they allow dogs. parking tonight was tricky because it was also first friday and we were told not to park in the dirt lot behind the bar or we'd get a ticket, so we found a close street spot.   our service was excellently friendly and prompt and kept the water glasses filled. but of course the draw here is beer. OMG the beer! and great beer.....a wall of taps of the nectar of the gods. the pints are reasonably priced and you can do a flight of 6 of any of their beers, even the expensive ones! from 9% to 3% alcohol content, heavy stouts to light lagers and everything in between, you are bound to find an option of beer that suits you here...only problem is, you may get wasted in your efforts to find your favorite!  the food was pretty good...a small selection since the focus is beer but my fish tacos were excellent and my wife raved about her arugula salad.   what a great find!

5 stars for the beer.  3 stars for the food.   One of the best beers I've had in the valley. Food on the other hand is just okay in my opinion. Won't be begging to go back for dinner but would like to come by for a happy hour to get some good brews.

Fantastic Spot..in town for a conference and tried the Angel. The atmosphere was very garage, gastro with great beer selection and a simple yet delicious menu. I would recommend to anyone. As a bonus there is a indie film house across the street which is beside a vintage arcade bar..score!!

Quiet on the outside, but full of energy on the inside. Seems to be a great place for friends or couples. Music seemed too long for dates, but you can get away from that on the patio if you want. The honeycomb/chicken wire plays well to the classy-hipster theme.  Well staffed. Our server was attentive when he needed to be, and not overly but didn't miss filling waters, beer, food, either. Nice work on that hire!  Beer: Beer selection is great, and staff knows what to recommend based on what you're in the mood to drink. Or, get a flight, and you'll get a range. The flights are served in a muffin tin so you can easily carry and go play bags in the patio, or sit until your table is ready. I saw wine, but my group stuck with beer.   Good ole fashioned:  great, medium cook for me and was cooked correctly. Fries come with natural tomato ketchup sauce (awesome!!). The Cole slaw is a healthy portion as well.  Farm flat bread:  recommended by the server and he was right, it was delicious and a more veggie friendly option.  Riblets: Healthy serving, great bbq sauce. (Bones included in the but size pieces.) I couldn't find on the menu so not sure the menu name of what my friend ordered.  Chipotle hummus:  healthy serving, big pieces and easy to share. Quantity and quality trumps the presentation.  Hot pretzel: Cooked perfectly, soft middle with crispy outside. Cheese sauce is delicious. Literally everyone orders these so look around if you're hesitant. I think 4 on a platter. We are them too fast before I could take a photo.  Pop tart: I heard and read about this, but we were to full and I'll have to come back to try.

Angels Trumpet has just about the best beer selection downtown, and they stock their taps with very many of the finest local brews. They also have an option to fill growlers to take home which is fantastic. Highly recommended.

Great food, but I'm giving one star for the bad customer service. Had the same exact experience that Robert F. had. Ordered the peach beer and it was horrible - sent it back and waiter said he would ask manager to take it off - and the manager said no. Seriously? It was not drinkable - and probably cost them nothing - now they lost me and any future income from me and my work friends (I just vetoed a big work party to go there). I actually went on the same day as the other reviewer - so maybe it was just the beer was bad - sad that we had to pay for it.

If you're looking for a place to grab some good food and beers with great casual atmosphere you've found it. Walk in grab a menu and seat yourself in their large indoor or outdoor seating area. Pick your beers or draft wine from a large blackboard that rotates new beverages in often. The food is down to earth and full of flavor, with employees knowing their favorites and making personal recommendations rather than a blanket statement of what's good or not. Service is quick and attentive without being bothersome nor sloppy. The sandwiches are something unique yet familiar - and excited to try the rest of the menu and rotating specials menu. Great spot for a date or get together with friends, kids would be fine but doesn't seemed to be geared toward them
Awesome service- Jake was very personable and knowledgeable. Terrific beer selection. Dynamite Brewlee burger and fries! I highly recommend this cool joint.

This place continues to wow with an awesome rotating tap selection, unique craft beers and bustling atmosphere.  I cannot get over waiting at your table for greater than 15 minutes for service, so usually have to saunter up the bar, order a beer, pay and peramble back to the table before the server even acknowledges our existence.  I wouldn't usually complain about this, but it has happened on more than one occasion.   Will always come here for the great beer selection, and you should too.  Best in downtown Phoenix, bar none.

I'm a HUGE fan of the Tuesday night TV dinners. $7 gets you a generous portion of a creatively presented, inspired meal. I've experienced the Salisbury steak and the carne asada tacos and found both to be exceptionally enjoyable!   I truly think the whole place is clever! I really like what they're doing and I plan to keep returning.
Fun spot and especially good for the beer lovers!  Lots of options from smaller breweries and local Arizona breweries!  Fun for an evening with friends and great for groups!!

This place kicks ass. Found it almost by mistake but now it's on my "must return" list. Over 30 brews to choose from and a menu of great eclectic items. I had a flat bread pizza and my colleague had a turkey sandwich. Fantastic outdoor patio option with an interior decor that is funky, functional, and just the right amount of urban industrial. I would strongly recommend this spot. Knocked it off the wall....
This is one of our go to places when we have friends or family in town. The food, beer, ambiance, and service are always excellent!

The pros., clean restaurant with it's own parking lot which is rare for downtown.  Also, the pricing seems reasonable and the food isn't bad.   The cons., this place is just like every other hipster ale house in town, so it's unforgettable.  It also smelled like spilled beer as soon as you walk in.  Once we seated ourselves, I ordered one of their claims to fame; the homemade pop-tart.  It tasted pretty good, for not tasting anything like a pop-tart and as long as you don't look at the grey mush inside.  Bottom line, don't expect anything special from this place.  The food is fine and the atmosphere is fine.  If you're in the area, not the worst choice, but not the best.
It's a nice place, some of the wait staff had some strong body odor. The food was yummy and the beers were cold and tasty.

My newfound hang-out!! Went here yesterday with my friend who is a beer connoisseur. The bartenders, Tommy and Thomas, were such awesome, friendly, helpful and accommodating guys. They made us feel totally welcome and we had a great time.   We ordered a flight in addition to a few more beers. Zero complaints. I recommend the saison from Funkwerks Brewery. The Holiday Cider and Decadence Stout were other favorites, but like I said, all of it was excellent. Fantastic beer selection---best in the Valley that I've seen.   The food is also noteworthy: the alligator pear flatbread = out of this world. We also ordered the salad with spinach and grapefruit (can't remember the name) that was equally amazing. What a great experience!! I can't wait for my next visit.
Great food,  with delicious house made sauces. And.  . . A huge selection of great craft beers also draft wine!

Really like this place, they have a great selection of you guessed it, ales, I suggest getting the six beer tasting thingy (I forget what it's called), that way you can get a sample of many and find out what you really like. Corey is awesome, great service, people and food too. Only been there a couple times so once I get acclimated I might raise it to 5 stars.

One of the best places to get beer downtown. The food is fantastic, great sized portions, and great for hungry American eats. The atmosphere is fun and the outdoor area is really wonderful as well. Not a place to go if you want a mixed drink, but then again, why go to a beer house?

This place is loud. Sit outside if you prefer not to yell at your companions. But omg, what a great and ever changing selection of beers on tap! The staff are pros. The kitchen is pretty fast, even when there's a large crowd. And the food is excellent. The 810 is probably the best turkey, ahem, *smoked* turkey sandwich I've ever had. Flat bread pizzas are excellent. You can't really go wrong here. Don't think too hard about it. Order what sounds good the day that you're there and prepare to enjoy yourself.

I was at the film bar across the street and ran into this ale house.  What a great find, I was visiting from Tampa and I am happy I gave it a try.  This ale house had a TON of different beers and even some wine.  Service was top notch and so was the beer.  I had a porter and my wife had a peach cider.   Both beers had great taste to them and had perfect pours.  We were actually late to the airport cause we wanted to stay.  We also ordered a pizza to hold us through our flight.  What a great idea, pizza was the Casper and it was amazing.  It had goat cheese, honey drizzle, salami, leeks, rosemary, garlic.  Salami was cooked to perfection and so was the pizza.  Atmosphere was great, a lot of people having a good time.  Outside area is nice and spacious.  They even have some corn hole sets that you can play with.  Gave it 4 stars cause after we decided to eat and sat at a table.  It took them a while to notice that we needed some service.  Parking is pretty small so bring some quarters to pay for parking.

I have been to Angel's Trumpet a number of times, and while the building looks great and they have a wide beer selection, the service is slow and waiters don't know anything about the menu. If you're going to have a wide range of beers, your staff need to be able to speak about them, let alone pronounce the names (they always had to search around for the number.) The food is bland and very expensive for what it is.   Not to mention the owner is actively undermining the local arts and creative scene. He works to railroad the Roosevelt BID, complaining that he'd have to pay more taxes while all the "parasitic" artists in the area get things for free (his words...). He moved into this neighborhood and has cashed in on downtown's renaissance (driven by the very people he undermined by tanking the BID.) Shameful behavior from someone who must not value their neighbors or the unique neighborhood. Anyone who cuddles up with Ducey isn't someone who gets my money.

Love the location and spot.  The patio area will be a huge draw now that the weather is finally good.  The food is meh.  The beer selection is great with a large chalkboard you can order from.  The main room is noisy (which a good ale house should be really) but I was really hoping the food would be tastier.  It's an eclectic menu, pizzas and spam sliders.  Things seemed to have been put on their randomly which is fine if puzzling.  The spam sliders are tasty and worth the fat and sodium bomb that they are.  The pizzas are a bit lacking but the salads are well done.  All in all, great place to see friends, just don't come super hungry :)

My first experience here was less than stellar but my love for beer is so deep that I'd sell my grandma to a sex trafficking ring for a growler of high gravity beer.  Denying myself some beer from the nitro taps at Angels has been agony so I came back in against my best judgement.  I sat at the bar for a while before the bartender acknowledged me, no biggie, I was narrowing down my selection anyway.  I started to become annoyed though when he kept pouring tasters to the people next to me without even acknowledging me.  Finally, I get my taste of the beer I want to try and it's this little tiny pour that couldn't fill a thimble much less my mouth.  I thought to myself "is this really happening, why is this guy being such a d!ck to me."  I looked over at my neighbors taste glasses and he was pouring them half way. I tell myself to let it go, it's only a taste, just get your beer and move on.  But I couldn't get my beer, no. I had to sit there and listen to the customer next to me tell the bartender about all the beers in Germany she has tried. When that long winded b!tch took a breath I stole my chance to order a beer. He looked at me very annoyed and nodded his head and continued his conversation.  Then he continues to pour more tasters for the people he is having a conversation with.  Did you get that?  A paying customer tried to order a beer and instead he poured his friends more freebies.  I walked out.  When I was leaving I saw a gentleman that looked like he was important, I asked him if he was in charge and he said he was. I informed him his bartender was a d!ck to me and he apologized for him.    Thank you for that apology, good sir.  You have a really great establishment and I want your product but their are barriers keeping me from getting it. Please get rid of your staff, hire people who know about customer service and let me tweak the decor to make it more comfortable.  Do that and you'll have a loyal customer for life.

Don't let the blase exterior (with the exception of the amazing mural) fool you at this joint... it's MUCH bigger than it looks from the outside.  The only food I tried was their margherita pizza, which was fresh and tasty - but far from my favorite.  I will reserve judgment on the rest of the menu items until I try, but their beer selection is just impeccable.  Rotating taps with every kind imaginable, a great happy hour, and friendly service = must try if you love beer.  I really loved the open design, the back patio (especially between October and May) are perfect for this part of Phoenix.  It's like, for a moment, you forget where you are.  Very zen like, and peaceful place to enjoy a drink - at least until they get busy, and then it's still great, just not as quiet.  MUST TRY if you're needing a drink downtown, I will surely be back.

Stopped by this place on a Sunday evening looking for a decent meal and a good drink selection and we were not disappointed.    -Excellent service = The server was genuinely interested in helping me find a drink I would enjoy -Great atmosphere = Laid back but not too casual like a dive bar -Delicious food = Recommend their pizzas and/or fish tacos
Great beer, love the happy hour menus and specials!

The draft wine & beers are really good and there is a huge amount of beer to choose from. We started with the flight and then each had our own favorite choice. Chenin Blanc also really good and just the perfect cool temperature (I can admit I'm a wine snob when it's not chilled properly and in 108 degrees outside a cool glass of wine is so delish!). We had the big guppy fish tacos, tractor flatbread, and a special of the day cauliflower flat bread and everything was great. Portions are large. Not enough room to try a pop tart because they give you a nice size beer too. Happy hour! I will always come back when I'm in town, love the laid back crowd here, it's got a hip vibe and the wait staff are so nice and friendly. Actually I just changed my 4 stars to 5 because I couldn't think of anything I didn't like about this place.
Love the craft beers and delicious food.  Great week night place to unwind and enjoy good time with friends
Worst customer service EVER! They don't care about takin care of their customers. First and last time I will ever come to this place.

I think Angels Trumpet Ale House (besides having an awesome name) is a really neat place to hang out with friends, sample interesting beers, and take a breather after a busy week. Service can be a tad slow because of how busy it can get, but the servers are friendly and really helpful. The ambiance inside is a cross between casual hipster bar and comfortable after-work hangout bar. I like the wooden tables and stools, not to mention the outside seating in the backyard when the weather is nice.  Angels Trumpet's claim to fame -- and rightly so -- is their beer flights. The system is to grab a piece of paper with six circles drawn on them, write down the beers you'd like to sample using the numbering system updated on a blackboard, and prepare to be excited. The beer selection is unique and ranges from deep and smooth to tangy and fruity. I tend to lean towards lighter, fruitier beers, and out of the ones I've tried, the blood orange cider is hands down my favorite. I'm not a frequent drinker, but taste comes first in my book, and the blood orange cider was a great balance of acidic, fruity, and refreshing.   While the drink portion of the menu is impressive, I found the food portion rather lackluster, which was disappointing because I find drinks are always better when paired with good finger food.   Hot pretzels: These pretzels were advertised as using beer batter, if I remember correctly, and I was excited for the soft, airy pillows to pair with my beer flight. Unfortunately the pretzels themselves were rather dense and hard on the outside, and they were virtually inedible once they had cooled down a little. The cheese sauce was pretty good, the mustard was unremarkable, and overall I didn't think this was worth the ~$10 asking price.   Hummus platter: This platter was pretty generous in size, and the hummus was pretty flavorful taste-wise. It wasn't as smooth as I would've liked, with some chunks of garbanzo that hadn't been blended in. I liked the cucumber pairing, but the pita bread was dry and floury without much of that freshly-made fragrance I was looking for.   Poutine: The size of this dish was again generous, and we couldn't finish it even between three people, but the positives stopped there. The fries were limp and soggy, even the ones that hadn't been covered with gravy. The gravy was definitely not freshly made, and when paired with the fries, there was an overall flavor of "having sat around for too long" (if anyone knows the proper vocabulary word for that, please tell me!). I wouldn't recommend ordering this on the off chance that it is freshly made that day.  I'd certainly come back for hanging out and sampling some unique beers, but not for the food.

Huge selection of local and international beers on tap. I like the changing of the beer menu throughout the night! Awesome college type crowd with plenty groups of women! We didn't try any food, next time. Place can get pretty packed. We got there around 10 pm and was standing room only. A spot definitely worth coming back to.

Love this place. Great selection of beers. Delicious appetizers. Good music , service and crowd. Reasonable prices. Went here for happy hour last week. Had sliders and some beers  which were YUMMY (and I'm not even a fan of sliders at all) Will be going back soon.

ATAH! Just like their menu says. It says you are responsible for drinks that you ordered. But what if the waitress brings you the wrong drink? Which happened in our case. Yet we were held responsible. We tried to hold a dialogue, and were threatened no matter our yelp review it wouldn't matter, and the owner wouldn't care, because of what it said on the menu. I get it. Saw the menu. We are responsible for drinks that we ORDERED. But again, the waitress brought us the wrong drinks. That is why the one star. We should not be responsible for the wrong order. Period. So that is exactly what we tipped, what it says on the menu. Atah! Never be back. You may not care now, but you will when everyone catches on.

My boyfriend and I have eaten here about 4-5 times in the last few months. Every single time the food is great. And, very affordable.   The only downside is that the food does take a while to come out, which sucks if you're hungry when you show up. On the other hand, I guess it's worth it for good food.   The atmosphere is loud, boisterous and fun. It seems to always be extremely crowded. But I've never seen anything outrageously awful happen so it's a pretty good place to be.   I am sure we will eat here many more times this year!

I have to give the 5 plus stars for the utterly amazing selection of craft brews on tap. I stared at the chalk board menu completely dumbfounded and paralyzed by indecision and it took me a few minutes to settle on the Full Sail Amber which was delicious (though you can'r really go wrong with Full Sail, can you?)  The minimal-artsy decor makes it right at home in the downtown arts district and the bar and layout make for a loud, lively atmosphere. I don't think I'll be coming here for meetings because the place is very loud and the beer is just too damned distracting.  It reminds me of the lovechild of Postino and Lux, with Bliss and Lost Leaf as the step-parents. The crowd seems to be a mix of the downtown artsy folks, some of the ASU crowd and the post-work working crowd such as yours truly.  They have a LOVELY patio with beautiful grass and meticulously groomed plants that I would have LOVED to trample on and destroy when I was a kid. This is PERFECT now that the weather is hopefully cooling down....at least at night.  It is a shame that smoking is not allowed on the patio, it is sizeable enough and it makes me sad that I cannot enjoy my beer while indulging my filthy habit. Other than that, the staff are friendly and enthusiastic and the wings look amazing so I think this is going to be a great addition to downtown.

We stopped in for lunch after visiting the Phoenix Open Air market and it was delicious!!! I had the fish tacos and oh my goodness the coleslaw was so good and the fish was so crispy! They came with an amazing pico and gauc - give them a try!!! My friends both had grilled cheese with fries and they devoured them. Of course they have 31 different beers on tap as well as a few wines on tap, you'll find something you love!!! Eat here and drink here you won't be disappointed.

I went to this place for dinner last night with my boyfriend and had a great experience. We sat at the bar in hopes to get the lunch tray meals that they have every Tuesday. Unfortunately we were too late and missed out. However, this was not a downside because the menu was fantastic. My boyfriend and I almost wanted to order two entrees because we could not decide on what to get. The bartenders were super nice and attentive. The vibe is great and seems like all ages could be there. We will definitely go back and try to make it earlier for the lunch tray meals.
Get the pop tart! Every single one has been mouth watering. The beer selection is great and the ambience is nice. I'm not a huge fan of tap wines but you take what you can get.

They have thirty beers on tap and it's always an interesting selection of top quality choices from around the world.  This last time I had a Tool Snowball Saison from Denmark.  The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.  On a nice day the patio is a great place to hangout.

I've been to Angels Trumpet House a couple of times and I'm a big fan.  I am already a brewery junkie so this review could be biased.  Angels Trumpet is located in the heart of downtown Phoenix and it's a great alternative eating and drinking option for the area.    I love the ambiance and decor.  It's very hipster, natural in a really good way.  The outdoor patio is amazing and just laid back wooden tables which are perfect for enjoying a delicious brew.  The beer selection is extensive.  They have 20+ unique offerings on tap at any given time.  They are unusual but high quality beers that you won't see at your typical brewery or bar.  I'm an avid craft beer drinker and all of the beer choices are always new to me.  They are written on a chalk board which makes it a little difficult to see from your table.  I suppose that's my biggest complaint.  Having something at your table would help better chose your beer of choice.  The beer is also a little more pricey than other places.  Probably about $1 more than your typical brewery but the alcohol content is higher, so I like to think it evens out.  Now let's talk about the food...  YUM!  there are definitely hits and misses on the menu so just listen and plan accordingly -  Grilled Cheese - if you're a fan, don't think, just get it!!  It's so good and one of the best in the city.  Get it with the bacon jam and you won't be sorry.  A delicious blend of tomato, pesto, cheese and bacon jam on crusty bread.   Flatbread - good choice and good for sharing!  If they have a daily special one, go for that.    Fish Tacos - was a daily special one night and really good!  One of my favorites in town so far  Service is great too!  Everyone is friendly and very helpful with the beer selection!    Tip - visit during Happy Hour time if your life allows it - much better deals on the beer

This establishment has been providing sub par service with a side of reheated food for years, but it has been a well rounded watering hole for those who want to try a number of craft beers in the neighborhood. Recently ownership has been vocal to the community that this is the only successful restaurant in the area. This is not only offensive to the patrons of the area but is a flat out lie. If you have a hankering for good food or drinks, try some of the long lasting and consistently good establishments. Matts big breakfast  The Rum Bar Moira sushi  Milk bar Phoenix Public Market  Carley's bistro Short leash  Lost Leaf Bar Pizza People Pub  The film bar  Cobra arcade bar
Love the selection of beer a flight was the best way to go, it was fun trying several different varieties!  Good food and atmosphere

Nice location, would really like to see more places like this downtown.  We liked this place overall. We went on a Saturday night, and it was busy but we didn't have to wait for a patio table. Service was good, always nearby when we needed something. Had the wings to start, but were a bit dry and over cooked. Comes with 3 different sauces, but small bowls and can't dip.  I'd skip them... Had the Chet for dinner, lots of ingredients, focused on beans and chorizo.  Wasn't a huge fan, it was spicy and no contrast, beans and French fries.   The beer is where its at though. They have about 30 taps, all craft brew many of which rare to see. They had "Enjoy By" - Stone Brewery, handful of Dogfish, Firestone etc...  Easy to pick your flight, just write the numbers on the sheet.  Overall enjoyed this new place, just going to try some different food options.

Came here after a recommendation from a server at a restaurant close by.    Ordered a few beers, and while I wasn't too sure which one's I had, they tasted great.  And they packed a serious punch.  Great recommendation by the guy behind the counter.  So at least on the beer side of things, they seem to have a good selection.  Do a little bit of asking, and I am sure there will be a beer just right for you.  Got the feeling it was a total hipster bar, which isn't really my style, but that didn't mean it was a bad place.  There is lots of tables and plenty of space in the bar area. Beers were inexpensive for a tall glass.  A short walk from downtown if you are in the area.

Been here twice. Loved it twice!  Place is seat yourself. First time I had the Matador Sammy which was great. I was worried about the horseradish but it wasn't overwhelming at all.  Second time we came with a larger party (9 people) and they were still able to accommodate us by combining tables outside.  This time I had the Big Guppy fish tacos. Each taco came with two good sized pieces of fish. I loved this entree even more than the Matador!  Also love that they have a wide selection of beers and change it up all the time.

I went to Angle's Trumpet (love the name) with the sweetheart. When entering we waited for the hostess to seat us I asked what's the deal with having to wait to be seated at an Ale House? We were told it was a restaurant but we could have a seat at the bar without waiting if we saw available seating. We were cool with that. We chose to sit at the small lounge area. It was cozy. There is an outside patio area. Love the 31 flavors of beer concept. We were told all the beers were micro brewed beers. Sweet! We were informed we could have a six beer sampler tray for $9.00 plus tax. I passed on that. Our server Brandi was very nice and informative. She recommended a Pale ale beer for me and a pumpkin cider beer for my sweets. I had a couple of beers, when I received the second beer I was informed the keg had ran out of beer leaving my glass three quarters of the way full. I was discounted two dollars for that beer because of this, that was nice. I thought the beers were a little warm. I like cold beer. I really liked this place and plan on returning soon.

This place is 3 stars and no more. Reason why..I've been here 3 times now and I will say the environment and people who are customers seem cool but the staff needs a complete overhaul.   It just doesn't click. This place could very much be a great place but the waiters just don't rub me the right way and haven't since the first time I have visited here. At times they aren't attentive and at times aren't kind.   Try this place, and see for yourself.

Went here with a large group (planned event - 200+ people). Food was mediocre, no food specials for a large group, beers were pricey, slow service, long lines for bathrooms. Those are not ideal things. However, having a manager that was rude when a simple question was asked (to open a window) is unacceptable. A simple explanation could have been provided, but instead, a rude response was given, and the manager walked away without further clarification. Turning your back on a paying customer? We have asked the group to change spots for next year as I am sure there are plenty of places that would gladly welcome 200+ people, and their business, for a scheduled event.
High quality beer for every palate!  Health choices for food!  I'm a fan.

Great restaurant/bar! Right across the streets from Cobra Arcade. The bartender recommended it and I am glad we have it a try, my brother had fish tacos and I got a BBQ grilled cheese sandwich, both were delicious! They had a lot of different unusual beers in tap with a cool glowing wall describing each one! Got in and seated pretty quick and the best part was the food came out very quick. Our sever Lauren was very nice

We had a fabulous meal at Angel's Trumpet Ale House tonight.  There were four of us, one had the fish tacos, one the fried chicken sandwich, one had a flat bread pizza and I had the fried chicken salad.  Really good food and prepared just right!!  I like to let people know when I find a great restaurant!!  Try this place, you won't be disappointed!!  Great server too!!

A group of us came to angel's trumpet yesterday afternoon for an early dinner before a concert.  They don't take reservations but we had no trouble getting a table for 6. Our server was really nice and attentive and was happy to give my sisters a few samples so that they didn't end up with something they didn't like.  All six of us ordered different entrees and they were all fantastic! Overall we had a great experience. 4 stars because I would have liked more ipa's on draft and the parking was a bit of a pain.

angel's trumpet is consistently great - beautiful environment, amazing beer list, and wonderful food. i always like to have the grilled cheese with spam, but everything is always great. the homemade pop tarts are wonderful. i really like their approach to their tap list... when a keg kicks, they don't replace it with the same beer, they replace it with whatever is next in line. this means much more variety, and a little sense of wonder.

This place is such a wonderful little hangout. It's hard to get people to argue against an evening at Angel's, and for great reason. The beer selection will have something for everyone, and the food is pretty darn good. You can drop in for a beer as part of a stroll in the neighborhood, or you can snag a table and post up for several hours. The place can get crowded, but it's not they're fault they're doing the things right.   The staff are great with recommending beers on the 31-draft rotating menu based on what you like, and the prices and ABV are right on the menu as well, so it's hard to be unpleasantly surprised, even if you're not the adventuresome type.  My only critique of this place is that if you prefer spirits or an alcohol-free evening, Angel's has very little to offer. Without the fun of exploring the beer selection, the food goes from "pretty darn tasty" to "I'd rather have gone somewhere else."
Food is good. Real good. Burgers, brisket, pulled pork, spam sliders, The Mess!!!! If you can't find a beer, well then...
Such yummy food. Tractor pizza and avocado, beet, grapefruit salad were so good. Hot wings were amazing, deep fried first. And the pop tarts, omg, yum!

The beer selection here is fantastic, which is why I keep coming back. They have a huge patio which is great for hanging out with some friends. The food on the other hand, has not impressed me at all, so I wouldn't necessarily recommend coming if you're really hungry.  If you're downtown with a group, and looking for a place to grab a beer, I would highly recommend coming by Angels.

Avoid the ketchup at all costs. It tastes like ground up tomatoes and that's about it, please stick to what you know or try more spices. Hamburger was ok, but the fries, well I will stick to the frozen kind at home. This bar seems to push their beer selection more than anything else, but I wouldn't get your hopes up in regards to the food.  I'll give two stars for effort, but that's it. It's nice that they are trying new things, but move on from what doesn't work. I'm looking at you homemade pop tarts.

I've been to Angel's Trumpet a few times now and it is a must try. If you love beer and food this is the place for you. They have a bunch of different craft beers on tap which may be overwhelming to some but their staff is very knowledgable and willing to help you find a beer you may like. My favorite thing to do is get a flight of beer. You can choose up to 6 different beers in your flight which are about 3oz servings.   The food has never disappointed me. I went recently for happy hour with some friends and a couple of us were able to split one of their flatbreads for only $7. Their food is bar food turned up a notch.  Some favorites: pretzels, poutine, and their "Nutter" sandwich add peppered bacon!  Tip: grab a beer and go outside on the patio to play some cornhole (bean bag toss for those who may not know what cornhole is). Definitely a great place to go with some friends!

I like this place! No, I haven't tried any of the food, but the beer was pretty damn good. And I know it gets a lot of complaints about being overly loud, but give me a freaking break people...it's a BAR! To me, there's nothing worse than going to a quiet, empty bar. My typical reaction is to turn around and walk out. So when I saw that this place is almost always busy, I was down to try it out. I also liked the crowd of people inside...nobody overly snobby or snooty. I think it's the perfect place to stop by for a drink or two with friends. If you're looking for a cozy, date night out, then this is not the place to go. But I will definitely be back to experience a lively night on the town. And I can't wait to try out their patio during the cooler months!

So I really, really like this place and have recommended it to PHX visitors and suggested it to friends when we are downtown.  My friends seemed to really, really like it too..lol.  They have a large chalkboard with a never ending list of craft beers to choose from..and wine..on tap!  I've had the spud taco, veggie flatbread pizza and avocado salad.  I would stick to the pizza and salad.  The spud taco was a little greasy for my taste.  Nice, sized portions.  I would suggest getting here early to beat the crowds to a table.

I was here with a group for Smunch on Sunday.  Nice thing about a group is you get to try more than one dish.  All of them were OK.  It seemed liked the biggest hit was a scramble with wild game, that week it was boar.  I had a fish cake Benedict, that week the fish was cod.  It was good. Of interest to note: the fish cake was both the protein and the base.  With a group of 8 you would think the food would come out in a 5-10 minute window.  Actually it was more than a 20 minute window.  The waitress was pretty attentive most of the time but a couple of times we had to flag her down.  Two of us drinking coffee had to ask for a refill.  The beer wall gets it own paragraph.  For good reason.   There are something like 30+ beers on tap plus a few wines on tap.  All of them are listed on the wall with a bit of description and their alcohol content.  Some of them are pretty potent.  You can get a flight of 6 sample glasses for $9, you pick which 6 you want to try by filling out a card, which comes back with the flight so you remember what is in each glass.  I wasn't really impressed with the space.  I liked the look but as many have noted it gets pretty noisy as it fills up.

I would give three stars for service and consistency; but bumped it to four because the beer and food are so darn good. If you come, bring your patience and a good attitude. You never know if you'll have to battle a crowd competing for wait staff - or if you'll be blown away by a super knowledgeable, attentive server. Either way, get over it because the atmosphere is awesome - a relaxing, indoor/outdoor, beer lovers haven. As to food, leave judgment at the door and give the spam sliders a chance. I know: Those who grew up on spam are no more anxious to relive childhood trauma. And those who've managed to avoid this long would wonder why start now. Just do it. At least once. It's a novelty done well and a fun food adventure. We also love the flatbreads and TV Tray Tuesday dinners. A great character place to hang out with friends.

Good food, great beer selection, decent atmosphere, and poor customer service.  I was compelled to try this place because of all the awesome things I have heard about this place and I feel a little compelled to give them a great review . . . maybe I missed something but this place is a hair better than mediocre.  Meal:  I had one of the hamburgers and their version of poutine.  I also had a few of the craft beers.  Taste:  The hamburger was almost tremendous.  I asked for medium rare and came out a hair under well done, but other than that, it was spectacular.  The poutine was very good too . . . maybe not Canadian great but very good. 7 out of 10.  Value:  I thought the highlight of the meal was the portions.  I couldn't finish my burger and poutine.  I came hungry and the prices were more than reasonable. 4 out of 5.  Service/Cleanliness:  Service was extremely slow and the waitress had little to no fucks to give regarding doing her job well.  She botched our order twice.  Rarely came over to check up on drinks where on two or three different occasions I had to flag down another waitress.  She had no clue what was on the menu.  But her beer knowledge was about the same as a 18 year old walking into his first fraternity party and asking for a natty ice.  I would imagine if you work at a place with "ale house" in the name, you would know a little about the beers.  There are a 25+ beers on tap so I know its a little hard but for Christ sakes, at least know 4 or 5 really well.  4 out of 10.  Atmosphere:  Decent.  Nothing so special that it left a lasting impression.  3 out of 5.   Overall:  Will I go back?  Probably but only if every other option has been exhausted.  Hopefully the service improves by then . . . 18 out of 30 points, 2 out of 5 stars.

Was headed to a concert on a Tuesday night in Phoenix and my friends and I wanted to grab some dinner before the show and I have been wanting to try Angels Trumpet for the Tuesday night tv dinner, so this was a win win for me!  The Tuesday night tv dinner for that night was beer battered chicken strips with creamy siracha sauce with zucchini fries, green salad, potato salad and smores for a bangin price of 9 bucks! You really cant beat that!  We were sitting out in the patio area and I was checking out the beer board and decided to go with the #25 (?) the peach tree shaker, this was a solid good choice! It was a great tasting beer!  I've been here before and knew I couldn't leave without getting one of their homemade poptarts! The poptart for the night was a tart cherry with dark chocolate drizzle, it was the perfect end to a delish meal!   If you are in the area, you really should give Angels Trumpet Ale House a try, they have a great selection of beers and selection of food!

Living so close to this ale house is awesome... gives us a new option in the downtown Phoenix area.  We peddled on over to Angels Trumpet Ale House and noticed a BOATLOAD of bicycles chained together at Angels Trumpet Ale House and across the street at FilmBar's bike rack.  I think they need a larger bike rack... like a large parking lot sized bike rack.  I was worried when I first walked in because there were many people standing at the entrance... but we got right in and were seated (this was a little before 9 on a Friday).    I liked the energy of the place... and how excited the imbibers seemed, however I'm torn... I want to rate it a full four, but then I thought of the loudness and also the "ok" food.  I wasn't looking for an intimate evening with my man, but yes, I realized I was shouting after a while.  I saw the overwhelmingly large selection of craft brews on the large chalk board... and really neat looking taps.  I went up to the board and figured out which ones I wanted and got a flight.  I don't drink tons of beer... but I enjoy craft brews.  I did take a peek at their wine selection and was disappointed to see no local wines.
