With this much variety, your best option is to go for the sampler If you like bier--very cost effective with 6 samples for $9. This is one of those pubs that you need to plan ahead and bring a DD with you, because with the ample array of high alcohol biers, you can find yourself "over the limit" quickly. The food is good, and the servers were enthusiastic and knowledgeable about both the drink and food options. Of the bier absorbing fare, my choice is the spud tacos, filled with sweet potato, corn and Chihuahua cheese.

I've been here several times and I can now safely say that this place is just not my jam.   It's super loud. The food is just so-so. They don't take reservations. They don't seem to have a way to shield the sun from blinding us inside the restaurant during the early evening. Every time I've selected beers for a flight, I only end up kind of liking one. I swear, I like beer. I do! So finding a new brew shouldn't be this rough.   I do like their fish tacos. Quite a bit actually. Same for the giant angel mural by Breeze and Lalo. So there's that.

I love this place!  There is always something great on tap and the food has been amazing on many visits! Tuesday night TV Dinner is fresh but retro! I wish this restaurant was on the west side  so good!
Date night with my handsome son. Enjoying a nice evening out on the the patio having dinner with downtown Phoenix as the backdrop.  Weather is great, conversation superb.   It's s wonderful life!

I kind of have a huge crush on Angel Trumpet Ale House! If you don't like noise. Try it on a Sunday afternoon. If you do like noise... Come any other time!   The food here is meh... I don't think the burgers are anything to rave about. The Mess fries are yum! But let me tell you... You should try the PB&J with marshmallow fluff. My son ordered one off the kids menu and it was enormous! He didn't finish which meant Don and I got to try some of it. Amazing! Maybe beyond amazing... Life changing maybe. They make the peanut butter in house and the jelly has some spice to it which I love. And the marshmallow fluff just sends it over the top. I tried to replicate this PB&J at home unsuccessfully. My son will not let me attempt it again.   On to the real good stuff. The BEERS! They have an amazing selection of craft beers from all over. They always have some amazing IPAs and double/imperial IPAs on the beer wall. Always with the different styles of lots of high gravity beers. Totally worth it if you like trying different beers without getting drunk. You can get flights of six different beers for about seven bucks. Don't forget to check out the seasonal menu with specials like on Sundays you can get a pitcher of a local brew for six dollars. Pretty smoking deal if you ask me.   Definitely a place I enjoy and will be returning very very soon!

Great beer selection! Sure, the menu is "bar food", but give it a try - the burgers and the peanut butter flat bread dessert are delish! We've had issues with service but I enjoy the beer and atmosphere too much to care. :) Oh - and the outside area is dog friendly!

Last night was the THIRD time I have tried to make it in since last year. This last time we showed up at 6pm and the wait was an HOUR because they just decided that evening NOT to serve food on the patio - PLUS there were open tables. The staff has never been very pleasant so I guess it was a sign to head on down the road!

I love this place!  The beers, staff and the atmosphere make this place as amazing as it is. The patio is dog friendly (idk about at night), has misters, corn hole and comfortable seating.  Inside it is very laid back seating great fro groups.  The bar has 6 wines and about 35 beers on tap.  The bartenders and waitress are very knowledgeable and will help you choose a beer that you love.  We prefer to have them help us create a sampler (6 beers) and go from there.  The food is even great!  We have had the pretzels which are amazing the beer cheese makes it.  The pretzel itself is much softer and not as salty as you are probably used to but sooo good.  I have also tried the spam sliders which was AMAZING! haha I know what you are thinking spam gross but it is good and you have to try it!  Only bad thing that I have to say is the parking SUCKS! Carpooling or public transportation are a must!--- Or bring lots of quarters.

If you like beer and good, above-average, pub food, you'll like Angels Trumpet. 35 Rotating taps of beer you don't find at other pubs. Would have earned 5 stars if the hostess, some young girl, wasn't rude. Other servers were great. Knowledgeable about beer and friendly. The space can get chilly as the whole back wall opens to an awesome patio. If you get cold, bring a sweater.

My previous review about the food still applies - absolutely amazing! I got the Brewlee Burger again. I want to try out those homemade poptarts sometime!  A friend and I went here for lunch yesterday. They were fairly busy, but that didn't stop this place from having great service last time I came. We waited (after our drink order was taken) at least fifteen minutes before our food order was taken. It wasn't too much of a problem though (except we were hungry) since we didn't need to be anywhere else afterwards. Once the order was taken we got our food within another fifteen minutes. The service was decent but has been better.  The atmosphere is amazing, like always. I'll definitely be back and continue to recommend this place to friends.

Atmosphere is very fun and they have many unique beers. I thought the food was ok. They plated it nice,  but it was not good enough for me to recommend it to a friend.  Spam sliders really needed a sauce.

This is probably one of my favorite places for craft beer and food. I'm here almost once a week. The staff is always cheerful and friendly and the vibe is laid back and unpretentious. I've had several things on the menu, but I'd say by far my favorites are the meat treat pizza, hummus appetizer, and sausage platter. They do a pretty good burger as well. As far as beer selection, it's great. I'm not big on IPA's. I tend to lean more towards the stouts, porters, or sours and they always have a good variety of what I like. Bottom line: I love this place.
Good food, great indoor/outdoor atmosphere and 31 craft beers on tap. Recommend starting with a flight or two to sample.
Great beer, great wait staff and excellent chicken wings and pizza.

It's not a bad place to come and get a drink.  It's not a brewery, they just have a lot of beers on tap. Area is cool as filmbar and cobra are across the street. Had some food and nothing really stood out to me, I don't remember it being bad.

Our second time at Angels and we will be back for a 3rd! Came here after a Dbacks game on a Sunday afternoon. They have $6 pitchers for local beers!!! Awesome! We had a pitcher of Mother Roads black IPA (best black IPA I've ever had) and a pitcher of 4 Peaks Raj IPA. Can't beat that deal. Each pitcher is about 2 glasses so made it $3 a glass. We will make this place a usual stop after Sunday games.

A buddy brought me here last night after going to an escape room event. It was my first time, and I was impressed with the overall vibe. While very busy, it still felt open so you really don't notice it being crowded.  The bar area is tiled in white, which gives it a clean, modern feel. And with 25+ taps most anyone could find a draft they would enjoy. The board also listed wines they have available and the selection appeared to be broad.  The special of the night was a Hawaiian TV dinner which came on a partitioned black tray similar to old style TV dinners. It was a pulled pork sandwich with grilled pineapple and an island inspired BBQ sauce. Sides include a salad with citrus vinaigrette, island style macaroni salad, coconut rice, and a banana cake with cream cheese frosting. All items were excellent.  There was a nice siEd outdoor patio area with abundant misters, but given it was over 110, we opted for inside.  It is worth noting parking is tight, so you might need to park elsewhere and walk in the evening, so an accordingly. Still, this place seems worth the extra effort.  I'll definitely be going back!

Every single time I'm here is more entertaining than the last.  Right now there's a guy who can help you with your beer floats,  he's friendly  and good looking.  The chefs know what they are doing and the beers are always changing. It's got a parking lot and a happy hour.  Woo.

Since moving to Phoenix a bit over a year ago, Angel's Trumpet has become my favorite place to grab a craft beer and a bite to eat.   It's a great spot to meet with a group of friends or to just belly up to the bar and try a new beer. Be prepared for a possible wait if you want a spot at the bar though. I've rarely come here when it's not hoppin' (no beer pun intended... actually that's a great beer pun).  Since they regularly change taps, you'll never get bored of the beer selection. That's truly what keeps me coming back again and again. The atmosphere is laid back and the service has always been friendly as well, so that doesn't hurt the return factor either.   Aaaaaand that's my no non-sense review update, Cheers!

Great food! Good prices. Nice backyard. Lots of beer. I've been both with friends and with my mom and toddler, and the experience is always positive. The backyard (during the mid-week mid-day) was a great place for my mom and I to lunch while my toddler played. On weekends and evenings the bar is a great place to meet friends for a delicious bite!
Good bar food with a great selection of beers to choose from.  Nice large patio and great for large party's.

Great atmosphere and even better patio! Great part of town with nearby metered parking. I was told to order the burger and I did, they were nice enough to sub tots and the whole thing was great! The wait staff was awesome at walking us through the craft beer selection and helped us to pick out beers to sample. I was pleased to find at least three beers that I loved on the menu. After the food was dropped off the place started picking up and we didn't see our waitress for quite a while. We were able to flag someone else down to cash us out but still a very good experience overall.

The food is great but the service is horrible. It doesn't matter what time you go or if you order for pickup the customer service is just terrible. I'm usually pretty forgiving and I will never be coming here again.
Just visited for the 1st time. Naked wings are the bomb ! Best in town ! Service was good. A few times the server walked by without looking, but acceptable. I will return.  A++++++

Maybe I am spoiled, but I'm a little turned off by Angel's Trumpet. I've been there around 5 times, and each time was..."ehh."   Beer selection is good. A little hard to read, but that's my eyes fault. Kinda weird that the waitresses refer to them by numbers.   I don't think I need to flag down a server to either order or pay my bill-that seems counterintuitive to their existence as a restaurant with wait staff. I don't think that I've ever had a greatly outgoing server there. I always feel like I am bothering them.   The food is good. Poutine is good.   There's plenty of other places to go around there. But if you feel the need to try, do it. If not, you're not missing much.
Amazing! Great atmosphere.  Great beer selection.  great food.  Great beer! Wish I lived closer!

I have been on a bit of a mission to find the perfect blend of beer and food, the Gastropub. I think I may have found my favorite. Walking in you are greeted by an enormous chalkboard with the current 31 beers on tap as well as the cask fresh wine. An amazing selection of Arizona and other beers. The red ipa was particularly good. Foods is excellent also, I had the avocado salad and fish tacos which were awesome. Nice people and understated service was good, I could see why people may think service a little rude but the are guys that know their beer and are not in your face over friendly which I kind of like. Go check it out.

I checked out Angels Trumpet Ale house at the tail end of First Friday, on Feb. 6. The space is airy and trendy. I loved the patio with all the lights strung up in the air; it made for very a nice ambiance. I tried their Tripel and it was excellent. It had a sweet finish and a beautiful gold color. It was served with just the right amount of head and it was less bitter than most Tripels I have tasted. I will definitely be back to try one of the flights I saw everyone ordering.

Love new concept restaurants but I'm going to keep an eye on this one. I LOVE beer but I love food more. I'm a lil concerned about this spot because of the limited menu. The Spam sliders are surprisingly good but I do believe eventually they're going to need a full service bar not just beer and wine. The owner and GM are great and I wish them both nothing but great success!!

My sis recommended this place on our recent visit to Phoenix, and my husband and I were both impressed! Not only with their long list of beer choices (with locations listed, as well as price), but with their menu options as well. I can't remember everything I ordered, but I know we ordered the poutine. So yummy. Canadians got one thing right, I suppose.  We ended up staying most of the night here after eating dinner. The staff were nice and accommodating. The crowd got younger and louder as the night wore on, but it was still a fun place to be.   I wish we were closer, because I want to try one of their tv dinners! We would definitely return.

Decent spot, good place for drinks. Food is creative but seems to describe an experience larger than what's actually served up. Everything seemed "salty"...from the Caesar salad to the wings and spam sliders.   Selection of beer is definitely better than the food. If you're a gastropub person, definitely top by but don't plan on a memorable eating experience.

Wow! What a great place! Went on Sunday , Labor Day weekend, and it was busy, lively , and full of character. if someone told me there is a better place for enjoying a great selection of beer,  I would be very skeptical.  The micro brewery selection is incredible! After a long night of enjoying many of our favorite places along the light rail, we stopped in to try some beers. Jeannie isn't a beer drinker, but thoroughly enjoyed her on tap wine! Our beers were tasty and the spam sliders were the perfect late night snack . Count us in as fans!

Really good food for the price.  I got the casper pizza and hot wings, both were delicious. They have a really beer and wine options. Atmosphere is nice, kinda loud on a busy night. Service was not great,  our server took our order then we never saw him again. We sat at our table for at least 20 min waiting for our check. Still worth going to

I have been here a couple of times; one time mid-day when it was not too busy and this time during evening. It was very busy and parking was a little challenging. Fortunately someone was leaving so I took their space. The beer selection is large with more than 25 taps, and all a good variety of styles. They also have wine available if beer isn't your thing. I ordered a stout that I have had before and enjoy. My friend had a cider. This time I also ordered food. Looking over the menu they have a lot of variety, but I happened to see an odd tray someone left on our table. It was a cardboard compartmentalized tray with words written in each box. What the heck? Then I noticed on board by the wall there was a listing of specials. One said TV dinner, and that is what this tray was advertising. The special tonight was a Hawaiian pulled pork sandwich with a grilled pineapple & island sauce, Hawaiian macaroni salad, citrus vinaigrette salad, coconut rice, and banana cake w/ cream cheese frosting. I asked how much and it was $10 and change - cheaper than a burger. I was also intrigued by the special "Homemade pop tart", but I didn't order that. I went with the TV dinner and it was a lot of food. The pulled pork was excellent, but the cake stole the show. Man, what I nice meal that was - like no other TV dinner I have had, that's for certain. The décor and ambiance of the bar is relaxing - very open, nice subway tiles, and an excellent staff. I highlight recommend this place.

Our date night... 1. Sausage platter w/ kangaroo as the wild game of the night....my 17 yr old son was upset when he found out we were eating kangaroo jack. I got over it, he was delicious.  2.  Six random beers to sample picked by our waitress. She did good. I recommend  Orange wheat and the rasberry one, forgot what it was called.  3. BBQ brisket grilled cheese & Outlaw burger with fries. I NEVER dip my fries in ketchup but I read they make their own. I finished mine, it was so good.   We were extremely happy with everything that we ordered. It was dark so my pics weren't the best. Gets a bit loud inside. Next time I am sitting outside, and getting a dessert. I must try a pop tart, and chicken plate, and pretzel, and tv dinner, and......   Just go!!

Visited with a girl friend a few weeks ago for the first time and cannot wait to go back. Great selection of beers on tap, wanted to try something different so the waiter brought over a sample, loved it and ordered. So nice to be able to taste it first.  Fish tacos were AMAZING, as is the grilled cheese.   Will be back for sure.  Only complaint is parking, and that's really a location issue in Downtown, park and walk, it's worth it.

Home run with service, food flavor, price and ambiance. This is my second visit and both times I have had a fantastic experience! I had a peanut butter and jelly sandwich that was great! Everyone else at my table enjoy their food immensely.

the interior is not what i was expecting at all. its super bright and almost clinical. wasnt very comfy-feeling. tons of beer and found a great pumpkin ale.  the food was a huge MEH. neither dishes were very good at all. i might come back for a beer if in the neighborhood, but i would go somewhere else to eat first.

The rotating beer selection, location and buffalo (?) bacon dog are great (whatever, I always get the same food). The patio is pretty nice on cooler days. The noise level inside makes me go a little cross-eyed, though the interior decorating is my style. Average all that subjective ish together and it calculates to 3.5 stars. Oh wait, I can't pick 3.5? Fine, I'll round up to 4 because that's the rule in maths.

So happy about the service improvements.  I love this place and always bring people here when they're visiting the Valley. The beer selection is top notch and the food is always great.  I had a few bad experiences here, but they must have gotten rid of some bad seeds, as the service has been exceptional my past few visits.

I only went here once. Not because of anything in particular, just haven't had a reason to go back. The food was good, but a bit expensive in my opinion. When you sit outside on the patio you get an awesome view of the downtown skyline. We walked here but parking seemed to be a bit limited.  Overall, I'd go back and it's a decent place to grab some food or a couple of drinks.

I would really have to nitpick to find much to kvetch about at Angel's Trumpet.  In full disclosure, I know and like Matt, the owner.  My biggest complaint is that the place is not open for lunch.  I was stunned when I suggested the place for lunch, only to find they open late.  The other night, I had three beer snobs out for drinks and dinner.  As always, the beer was fantastic, and the quality of the food has become consistently excellent.  The real star was our server, Chelsea.  Pretty, funny, and prompt without being obtrusive.  She had a ton of tables, and literally ran herself glistening making sure that everyone was taken care of on a hot summer night.

Came here with two teenagers thinking it was a brew pub.   Felt very out of place.  Planned on us drinking a few beers and kids having a few cokes.  Then we would eat a burger etc.   no fountain drinks for kids.  Very limited menu.  Really  a bar with a bunch of microbrews.  No local beers???? We left and went to four peaks brewery

This was my first time I had been here and I had heard nothing but great things. In my own opinion, the food was just OK, nothing special and the beers were plentiful, but only a good option if you already know a lot about beers. If you don't it can be over whelming. Our server was not helpful in selecting.   Overall, fun place to go with your beer savvy friends!
Awesome and plentiful beer choices, Spam sliders, homemade pop tarts, Tue TV dinner night, and super friendly bartenders. I'm not sure how it could be better.

I would give it 1 star, but thought that was a bit harsh, and I wasn't there very long.  The whole set up made me very anxious.  The music is deafening and the acoustics and patrons talking make it a difficult place to relax.  They give you a piece of paper and a golf pencil and make you go stand in front of a board and choose your beer, many with which I was not familiar.  There were so many people jostling for position in front of this board and the one over the bar, that it was very off putting to me. There was no clipboard to place the piece of paper on so the golf pencil poked right through immediately.  I asked the waitress why they couldn't print up a menu of beers everyday so people don't have to stand around crowding some board.  She told me because they run out of some beers nightly.  I said back, then the waiters could just tell you what is 86'd as they run out..  They could kinda do like at sushi restaurants, where you check the item you want at your table.  Wanted to love this place, it was utter chaos in there and I couldn't have a conversation with anyone.  I don't think I'll be back.

In town on business and stopped here.  I am not a beer drinker but the Coppola Pinot Grigio was great. We ordered the hot pretzels, wings, flatbread with pesto-chicken-onions and the fried Cantonese rib let's and the cherry pot tarts.  Everything was great.   31 beers were featured.  Something for everyone.  You won't be disappointed.

Probably my favourite place to go downtown for a drink and some good, different bar food. The main room is large with plenty of seating and the outside patio is almost twice as big. It can occasionally be busy but most of the time I've found somewhere to sit quickly.  The burgers are all good, the pizzas are great and the poptarts are a good enough reason to go.  They have a lot of great beer on tap and it's not all your standard fare. Any beer snob would be able to find something worth drinking. They also have a small selection of wine on tap, however the red wine on tap is chilled which I'm not personally fan of, though I know that's popular atm.  All in all I would recommend it!
Love the food and the beers. Just love it all!!!! Always be there and drink a craft beer! The pretzels and mustard are good

Beer selection was 5/5 100%.  Food was really meh and heavy. Even for a "gastropub" it wasn't what I expected. Service was fine, not bad but not super good. We would come here again, for beer only though.

Really good selection of beers, and very reasonably priced beer specials. Didn't eat anything, but the menu was very original and interesting. Met and talked to some cool folks, good looking crowd. Really liked this place.

Brilliant selection of beers that are always revolving and interesting.  Cool menu choices as well and always has a good vibe.  Can get very busy but we always seem to get served in a reasonable time. If you are into craft beers, then ATAH should be on your list to try.
Love the selection of craft beers on tap. I haven't branched out much with food, but what I have had is amazingly delicious!

I come home once a year for the Christmas and I all make certain I stop in and have a nice cold Beer and I order the mess with an egg along with their great chicken wings!!  I wish that I could find a place in Wisconsin where I currently live.

Really cool atmosphere for a downtown spot.  Another yelper and I went on a first Friday and the place was packed.  Hardly any parking and the area behind the ale house is someone else's private lot however many people were parking there and then asked to move it.   The waitress was nice but usually invisible when we needed her. So service wasn't the greatest that night and it was hard to tell who was the staff versus guests.    The food was really good.  We had the flatbread with leeks, bacon and egg, really really good.  Plus fries with gravy and cheese curds, this was a huge serving and will feed a table of four!  Only thing, it took forever to get the food, bur we waited patiently however could not hear each other since it was so loud.  If you go , try to get a table outside. Inside, you will have a conversation with yourself since no one else will be able to hear you.  The beer choices were good and as big as some other places. The glasses weren't that cold either and by the time the food came the beer was warm.I will go back just not on a busy night and will ask to sit outside!.Cheers!

I love Angels and pay a visit at least once a month but yesterday turned out to be a bad experience. We arrived and we're seated immediately but it took about 10 mins to have a waitress approach us to ask for what drinks we wanted. 25 mins went by and the waitress never came back to take our orders. Idk if they were short staffed or why the service was bad that day but we just ended up leaving.

Decent place with plenty beers on tap. Not a brewery so don't mistake that. Close to ASU downtown so the vibe is college kids on their cell phones talking to everyone else except the person in front of them. I wouldn't go out of my way to go back but wouldn't pass it by if I was thirsty. Salud!

Great food! The wings are amazing. Pb and j bacon sandwich was different but had so much flavor thanks to the bacon. The burger was perfectly cooked, juicy, a little kick of spicy with an egg over easy.

Beer bar - a lot of places getting titled or tagged as such but few really deserve the moniker.  Angels most certainly does.  If you're looking for high quality beer (and a voracious selection of it), stop here.  The beer selection is exemplary here - around 30-35 taps.  Nice mix of local AZ selections with other world class options.  For examples, there when I was there they options from AleSmith, DogFish, FullSail and other dope breweries.  Ample selection of styles were represented too - not just IPAs - sours, sessions, bourbon-barrel aged stouts - no matter your tastes beer-wise you should be able to find something that suits you here.  They are also on point in terms of glassware for beer - i.e. you aren't going to get served an imperial IPA in a pint glass.   I found the bartenders to be really knowledgable style-wise so definitely ask if you have any questions on style preferences when you are there.  The food menu was also great here - I went here a few times and the option that stood out to me was the big guppy (fish tacos).  You get two tacos with the big guppy but don't let that deceive you - these are BIG tacos.  They come with Angel's "secret sauce".  What is - I have no idea - but it is tangy/spicy and fits the dish well. On top of that, the tacos are buried in avocado mash and slaw which adds up to a recipe for success.   Besides the tacos, food options include sandwiches, flatbread pizza and a number of other appetizer-like selections.  As stated before, this is a top notch beer bar and the food delivers too.  Definitely worth a visit if you are in the downtown Phoenix area.

If I could give it 4.9 stars I would... the only gripe I have is the Beer Board... they need to rethink the way they display their beer selection or provide beer menus. I get that the beer menu changes constantly so even more of a reason to make the beer selections clear and easy to read.  Other than that it was a slam dunk, home run, and touch down! In the culinary sense of course. I regret not taking any pictures of our food or beer selections so I'll do my best to describe my experience.  My company was great, the food was inventive, fresh, exciting, and passionately prepared. I had the Fun-Guy flat bread pizza... very rich and fit for two. I chose this because of the mushrooms and goat cheese... it could have used a lot more Fun-Guys and some spice! My company had the fish tacos which I definitely will get the next time I go! Possibly on my top 5 list of fish tacos and I'm originally from California! And I'm Mexican! The fish was fried to perfect crispiness perfection, the cabbage was dressed right and had that little spice you need for a fish taco of this caliber, and the beans! OOOOOH THE BEANS! All I can say is BOOM! Not your typical mexican refried beans but something from another dimension... hats off to the bean chef!   As far as the beer goes... I always fall back on my frustration about beer... Too many beers, not enough brain cells... There was like 30+ different beers on the board so I decided to get a flight as did my company. We shared, we said YUMM, and we said YUCK... All depends on what you like... if you like a diverse selection of great beers you will Love this place!  The prices were VERY reasonable, the atmosphere was comfortably loud, the people pretty, and the music... I don't remember the music... maybe they didnt have any playing... if not they should have...

The beer menu at the Angel's Trumpet exerts the sort of fascination over me that the Dairy Queen's 20-30 possible milkshake flavors did when I was a wee urchin and DQ still had goodies like pineapple milkshakes. There are about 30 flavors on the big board at any time, and it includes "weird" varieties like chicory stout (which was splendid), along with all sorts of microbrews. I cannot possibly actually drink enough to fully appreciate what this place has to offer.  If you're there for food, the ideal is to hit the happy medium of "a bit of buzz, a bit of clatter" but stop short of showing up when it's jammed and the servers are starting to look panicky. My first trip hit that medium perfectly (little did I know!) with the result that my Outlaw Burger was Revelatory!Burger, OMG!Burger, SeraphimSingPraises!Burger. It was every juicy, flavorful thing a medium pub burger should be. And in that context, the space is really cool -- it's like a coffeehouse in that there's a sense of community gathering regardless of which specific party you're with.  My second trip was on a swamped day, and my medium burger was well-done. The kitchen's still working with quality ingredients -- the buns are very fine buns -- so even a meh burger is still a pretty good burger and worth the $9. But flights of angels did not actually sing over this burger.  On the up side, the kitchen positively coated the ribbon chips with red and black pepper, and since I love spicy food, that was so far beyond amazing that I considered asking for more, then decided not to push my luck.  Rumor has it that one can ask for take-out and trot the food across the street to FilmBar.
Angel's ketchup is so amazing. I literally go here just to buy Angel's French fries and ketchup!!!! Amazing on top his sells the best burger in Phoenix!

Was out and about this last Saturday with some pals of mine on a bike ride and decided to stop in.  Would have to say I have truly enjoyed ever visit I have had there (always sat at the bar).  Never had a complaint about service. This last time though we took a table outside since the weather was too nice not to take advantage of of the one table that happened to open up outside. Felt lucky considering it seemed to be pretty busy at the time.  We were greeted by our server promptly and provided with water just as quick.  we requested some sample tastings of a few brews and per usual I always appreciate their diligence in offering for us to taste our beer selections before we had them.  Than onto our food orders.  Having a full lunch just before our ride I had decided to stick to my 1 beer for the time we were there. My friends needed food and ordered the wild BLT (Alligator) and some pretzels. I am an avid fan of this place so I made a point to try their plates.  The alligator brat was amazing. would only suggest that it be in a bun rather than a wrap??? wraps seem to better accommodate meats that area cut or sliced. Just my opinion.   The pretzels were great! I am always astounded when I go out to eat and a restaurant cannot gets pretzels and cheese right?? I know I am not the only one thinking this. The portion size was generous so no complaints there either. the ketchup is made in house = Awesome. Can get some real flavors out of it rather than vinegar and sugar.  I only have to knock this review down a star since this time being sat outside I did see a bit of a lag in service times between our food order and drink refills. Nothing we felt we needed to complain about since we were in no rush that evening but I did notice a few tables scanning the floor for their server more than a few times.  side note: last time I had visited the bar was with my roommate and having showed up to an empty restaurant mid day we expected prompt service but were quickly derailed by a bar crawl that came in filling the floor from shoulder to shoulder and taking priority over our service. Was a bit annoyed but again was in no huge rush. but still, Priorities!!  Love the place and the brew selections! ill be visiting again no doubt!
Great knowledgeable staff taste bud explosion must do when in Phoenix go on weeknight if possible!

This was our second visit there and I'm glad we went back.  The first time we went there they were serving brunch and I believe they no longer do that.  Which I am glad to see - they brunch dishes weren't that great.  This time we were there about the same time - between 12 noon and 12:30 - on a Sunday and not busy at all.  We had a great server who was easily able to recommend one of the 20+ ales on tap.  I had the Nitro Milk Stout and I cannot remember what he had, but it was similar to a Newcastle Ale which is what he wanted.  We both had one of the flatbread pizzas (Garden and Meat) - very good and enough for a second meal.  We also shared the "pop tart" dessert - very good and highly recommend.    This place had a lot of locals because of all the bicycles coming in and a very interesting menu - we are definitely planning to return when we go to the symphony.  This past visit was ate there prior to going to FilmBar - i.e., this brew pub has a pretty good location.....  3/3/13

My wife and I first visited Angels Trumpet in September 2015 after being told we needed to check it out by some friends from the burbs (apparently this is better than Applebee's). It was kind of "good enough" but had some decent beers to give it a notch above mediocre at first take. That said, the server couldn't tell us much about the beers..... I'm pretty sure we got the "light beer" vs "dark beer" comment, or something of the sort - very disappointing for a server at an ale house (she later admitted, "I'm not really a beer drinker"). Overall a kind of "meh" experience.  About a month later, a client recommended meeting here and I thought it was worth giving it a second try. This was a better experience than the previous one, but still just not hitting it on the head for me. This place is seriously missing something in the way of ambiance or otherwise. It feels so bland and mediocre, and yet I feel it has so much potential.   I've been back a few times since last fall, reluctantly - to meet up with friends/colleagues - each time getting yet another "Well, it's not Applebee's, I guess" kind of experience. As of March, I've decided to put an end to the repeated disappointment. I made my last visit there just before learning that the owner sabotaged an effort to build up the area's appeal to residents like me, which was supported by an awesome group of nearby bars/restaurants and others. Wow, seriously?! Way to ensure that your ambiance never improves! Angel's Trumpet: not Applebee's and not feeling good in the neighborhood. Go somewhere else if you want quality, service, and genuineness from a pub.

Angels never really disappoints! I used to live in the Roosevelt Arts district before moving to NYC and this was a regular spot for me. Since I was back in town it was a must (also because my girlfriend loves beer). Coming back to it reminds me that this form of beer spot is preferred, as I love the idea of a rotating draft list.   I went with a cucumber ale that was very refreshing and an order of wings that were surprisingly delicious. I say this both having taking a short break from being vegan, and also I didn't have high expectations as this was the first time I've ever eaten here.   Overall, great place and will also be a favorite in downtown PHX!

Great space design and quality beer selection.    I really want to love this place as it's in my neighborhood and I enjoy findingobscure craft and micro brews, but the service is a little slow, they're not knowledgeable about the beers they offer, and the inside space is VERY loud.    The design of the space/building is great.  Great view of the downtown skyline.  But I really wish they didn't build that shade structure that looks so temporary and which draws your attention away from all the other great design elements.  I haven't tried more than 3-4 items on the food menu, so I'm not going to review the food.  What I had seem to be a bit experimental, and was good, but nothing memorable.  With a few adjustments, I think this place will be a great downtown spot.

Our friends have been telling us about this place for a long time. My husband and I finally got to try it out on Friday night. There was a very small wait but we were super lucky to score a spot at the bar while we waited. We were very impressed with the 30+ beers that they had available on tap. We appreciated that each beer had an explanation of the type it was as well. The bartenders were very gracious and even offered samples of beer too. Both beers that I had were completely delicious and the amount I got exceeded my expectations. I believe they were 16 ounces a piece. Our friends also kept telling us about how delicious the food was. My husband and I each got one of the Sammy's (sandwiches). They did not disappoint! I highly recommend the Matador!! For dessert we tried their homemade pop tart which that night was a bananas foster type. So incredibly delicious, it reminded me of a toaster strudel but gourmet. It was quite a busy night and we did have to sit outside, and it was quite warm that night. Hoping to sit inside next time. Will definitely be back to this place!
Love the varieties of beers and the way they run it with rotations each night as they run out of things, new things replace it. Food is always good but a little pricey.

Two stars for the beer selection: 30+ on tap.  They also have this thing where you can order a flight of 6 beers of your choosing (about 6 oz. each) for $9 if you're undecided on which beer to get.  It comes in a muffin pan.  I ordered the animal burger in beef (you can get it in chicken and pork too), medium-rare.  It was a little overcooked, but still juicy and damn tasty.  The pickled grilled onions went fantastically with the bacon.  The fries were a disappointment because some were soggy and the 'ketchup' sauce on the side tasted like spaghetti sauce.  Our server (Ashley was her name if my beer-impaired memory is not mistaken - she has tats on her calves) was attentive, fast and nice.  Easily found a table here pre-Spring break on a weekday.  Best part of the meal: drunken public cornhole (not what you're thinking - get your mind out of the gutter people).  Otherwise, known as bean bag tossing (ok, seriously, you need to see a psychiatrist if you're still looking for a sexual innuendo).  Loser for each round drinks a shot of beer, making the game everso difficult as time passed by.
Great place for an "urban" experience but let's tone down the hipster attitude...you're not that cool.....it's Phoenix.

The beer is always rotating out so there's always something new to sample. I love getting their beer flights. The food is amaze balls. Try the BBQ Brisket grilled cheese! Huge portions packed with tons of flavor.
Fantastic beer selection for those seeking something different! Can be a bit loud. People mix is diverse but may lean hipster.

From a foodie perspective this place wins.  Great bites to eat here.  I would recommend the spam sliders.  They are spot on delicious.  From a craft beer perspective this place has a lot of good choices on tap and a cool canning machine for take home.  It appears no discount for going with a growler price.  Questionable pours for a flight.  Service is middle of the line.  This place could really use a beer expert behind the bar to push it to a 5* establishment.

4 stars for beer variety and flights, 4 stars for service considering how busy it was, 3 stars for atmosphere and no stars for food equals 3 more than fair stars. (Mathlete I was not)  Tons of people crowded this place and with a 15min wait and high stars on yelp I thought this would be solid. I'm learning just because there's a crowd doesn't guarantee good eats. My hummus plate appetizer featured vegetables that looked like they were cut by a 5yr old and the hummus was definitely store- bought or needs some serious recipe editing. Pita bread was most def. store-bought. My husband's burgers were unseasoned and bland. When that man doesn't finish sliders something is very wrong..  Beers were crisp and cold and fun to order on a flight sheet with tons of flavors and brands I never heard of. Lighting was way too bright, I felt like I was an ant in the sun under a magnifying glass, not very complimentary on people's faces. All in all even with the beer choices I won't be coming back, I can get a beer variety for cheaper at Bevmo and make my delicious homemade hummus to top it off.
I love this place, The energy for dinner is electric and the food is absolutely delicious. Plus they have tons of beer to choose from. Definitely will come back!

Wow!!! Being from Seattle I love the hipster environment!! Although I am not a beer drinker they did have cider and wine on tap, but if you are a beer drinker you will be in heaven! So many to choose from and such a wide variety!! My gf and I came over for the packers vs cardinals game tomorrow and we chose this place for dinner! The brisket and grilled cheese was the best I have had (besides my papas) and that is saying a lot! I am bbq and brisket picky!!! Go here it won't disappoint

Came here for my second time bringing a hopeful vision to replenish my so-so reflection of prior memory. Beers are always a plus, and I suppose it's an Ale House so the emphasis isn't weighted foodie. With that said I would value it just so, the food is your regular bar food with a new American spin with a focus on fresh. I ordered the Matador which was basically a steak sandwich with a side of fries. Decent it was, amazing it was not. I would come back for a couple brews and a hot pretzel but not again to saturate false hope with a average to good sitting.

idk i really use to like this place. that fun-guy pizza was one of my favorite meals. but the last couple of times when i have gone at night for just a beer or 3, i find myself stranded with no waiter for long stretches of time. additionally, the food just doesnt seem to have that snap, crackle, pop anymore. i have tried the chet burrito, the wings, and the brisket sandwich and they havent been as good as i remember. idk it saddens me. i havent written these guys off but i remember them being better than this
Amazing food. The pop tarts are pretty much the most delicious thing in existence. It's a weird week if I haven't come here at least once, and it's always consistently wonderful.

Love love love this place, best pub food downtown bar none. Pizza, burgers, and sandwiches...oh and the beer, could go on and on about this place. Meat treat is my fave pizza, 810 is my fave sandwich, big guppy gives you enough fish to feed two people, and burgers I can't decide!! Love this place and it's my go to spot...

We had been wanting to go here for months after a few suggestions from friends, but mostly just after many times ofdriving or walking past the establishment and seeing it filled with people. After finally deciding to give it a shot, it wasn't long before we wondered why. The service was awful. The bartenders were inattentive and not at all communicative between one another in order to provide adequate service. I didn't think it was possible but the service was even worse once seated at a table outside. The waitress was not at all friendly or even accommodating. She acted as if she could not care less about us or any of our questions. To top it off, I ordered a beer that was then brought to me by some random guy who set it down, said something about it being "a shorty", and walking away. Come to find out, this 4.5 ounce beer cost $4.00 because the keg went out. When asked about the price, the manager came over to explain that they don't know when the keg will run out so it was the best they could do, and I was given and charged the price appropriate based on what was left. At this point, I was SHOCKED To find out that all this time, the Angel's Trumpet, did not, in fact, hire psychics to run their establishment for the sole purpose of sensing when each keg will tap throughout he night. Mind blown. Turns out though, despite the lack of psychics and service industry "professionals" on staff, the beer, regardless of how full or how great the quality is,still comes at quite the cost. The manager was nice enough to knock about 50 cents off the price of my sub par and anything but full glass, and apparently that was even asking too much by the look on her face and the snobby motions of her hands. I could go on and on, but frankly, I've already arrived at somewhere MUCH cooler that actually has beer that I can drink and I've already given this place more recognition than it deserves.

Tuesday's are Tv Dinner Nights @angels_trumpet_ale_house  Just 8 dollars and you get a redesign of what you thought was a TV dinner in a box, but a TV dinner on a plate!! They put on a different plate every week of the month every Tuesday after 6pm get it fast before it runs out of the night! This right here is a Catfish Po'boy , sweet potato waffle fries w/ Cajun spices. Dirty red beans & rice, fresh shucked corn & basil salad, and the best I thought was the lemon goey bar for dessert! Definitely will come back with the cool downtown Phoenix atmosphere, chill ambience.  #downtownphx #phxeats #azfoodie #foodie #instafood

Stopped in after work on a weeknight, great vibe...very relaxed.  Service was quick and pleasant.  I wasn't there very long, one beer only but will be back to try their food and a flight.  Parking lot was full at 5 so was able to park on the street nearby.

WOW!  Huge portions, super delicious, funky, just a lot of fun, and a lot of food fo little money!  We all had salads, and they were HUGE!  Delicious, fresh, and packed with goodness to the brim.  I hate beets and I chowed like a goat!  I was the only anti-ale drinker, but I stuck with a refreshing cider.    GREAT service, fantastic food, great value and ambiance!
The beer selection was amazing. The food was fantastic. I had the beef brisket tacos. Delish. I would like to go back and have the chicken wings they looked mouth watering.

This place was something friends suggested and we went because of their rave reviews. They were totally right. The beer selection is great, the food is unique and delicious, and the atmosphere of the restaurant is modern but also surprisingly cozy. I have made this one of my top places in Phoenix to frequent whenever I'm in town!

(Lyrics - Robbie Williams - Angel)  I sit and wait At Angel Trumpet Ale House And do they know The places where we go When we want a drink...... 'Cause I have been told That their craft beer sets the bars up high So when I'm thirsty for a drink Thoughts running through my head And I feel the love is dead I'm loving Angels Trumpet Ale House instead  And through it all Angel's offers me 31 taps of selection A lot of food and confection Whether I'm right or wrong And down the waterfall  Wherever it may take me I know that life won't break me When I come to call, Angel's won't forsake me I'm loving angels Angels Trumpet Ale House instead.  Angel Trumpet Ale House is located in the heart of the cool and hip part of Phoenix.  What I mean is its where all the hipsters hangout.  It's all good!  I actually enjoy the atmosphere here.  It's not over the top nor do I have to dress my ass off - though I do anyways!  Like most hipster bars, I feel like I should ride my bike with a banana seat except I don't have bike nor would I get one with a banana seat.    Anyways, I ordered a special tonight, which was called the Garfield.  Not sure why really I guess the Chef's name was Mr. Garfield maybe.  It was pretty much a low carb tortilla wrapped with turkey and the fixins' along with some fries.  I didn't think much of it.  My friend ordered the Smokin Legs, which was roasted chicken legs, but she got 3.  It was obviously a lot for her since I think she only ate one and nibbled on her sides.  Needless to say, I'm not a fan of their food!  Then again this is an Ale house!  I really do like this place because their selection of crafted beers.  Daily changes one what is brewing so that's awesome.  Instead of your usual Stella, Bud, or Peroni, Ale house offers some funky ass names and taste I can't describe.  Over 31 selections so it can be overwhelming, but take your time Angel Trumpet isn't going away anytime soon.  I say start with what you usually drink flavor wise and then work your way into the adventure side! - Enjoy!

Great beer and great people. This a new favorite area for me. Huge, and unique, selection of beers. Love the one keg and move on philosophy. Highly recommend this place for all locals and travelers passing through.
Awesome food, awesome atmosphere, awesome beer. A little cramped, but who cares? Has a really nice patio area.

As a microbrew enthusiast, nothing quenches my thirst like a beer I've never heard of. Angel's Trumpet has tons of those, and one would be wise to follow their Facebook and keep watch for elusive elixirs like Dogfish Head 120 Minute IPA.   Initially, I wasn't impressed with seeing Crispin, Rogue, and Deschutes, but my bartender was able to find the right pint for me. It was categorized as a "Sahti", and it is was freaking delicious.   The food here looks like common grub anyone can enjoy (pizza, burgers, etc.) but with an emphasis on finer ingredients. My friend ordered the pop tart, and it looked tons more fancy than your average breakfast snack!  The atmosphere is calm, everything is super clean, and there's a great patio. This is a place to have a nice sit-down dinner, or socialize in a quiet, almost classy environment. I'll be back to try some dinner, and I'll keep my eyes out on the taps!

Excellent selection of beer.  Come here for the beer.  The food is average.  My brisket tacos were adequate, but the brisket was kind of dry. Close your eyes and pick a random beer if you dare...  The ambiance is also excellent - a lot of space, nice wood tables.  A lovely place to enjoy a beverage or become...ahem...a little more inebriated.

The pup-friendly patio, neighborhood location and rotating beer taps are what keep me coming back.  The menu- I like the concept, but the execution could be better (with the exception of the grilled cheese...honey & pesto! Yum!) I have heard good things about the TV Dinners on Tuesday, so maybe I'll have to try that out. I don't think there's much of a happy hour either, maybe a dollar or two off a beer?  The service- Almost always painful, and painful to watch around me, especially at an outside table. Pretty slow, negligent, and they don't seem to care. The strangest thing is nearly every time I have been here, I have been asked to close out so the server can "get their drink on, too." Multiple occasions, all different servers. Were they trained to say this? I get it, but it's also a bit lame.   If you're really lucky, the bar service can be a little better. But then I can't bring my dog which is half of the reason I like this place... & now I just confused myself.  I do keep returning. Guilty.  But not nearly as often, and each time with hopes of improvement.

I want that mural in my house.   Everyone mentions the Spam Sliders, and for good reason too: they're awesome. If you have any hesitancy about Spam, just knock it off! They were so good. Spam sorta tastes like a hotdog, with a different sort of consistency. Topped with feta slaw on a toasted mini bun, they're damn tasty.   You've also got an excellent beer selection. It's chalked up on a huge board by number, with a description and ABV and Price. As the tap runs dry, they erase it and put in a new one. The rotation is ever changing. The servers are also really knowledgable about all of the beers and can give you a taste if you're unsure about a selection. You can also do a flight of six if you're looking for a varied selection of beers. No liquor, but they do have some wines.  The atmosphere is lively and loud and the clientelle is all over the board. If you're a smoker, you've got an outdoor patio with heaters.   This is also a great place for a date. The loud atmosphere makes it a fun place to talk and not feel like you have to whisper or feel awkward if there is a pause in the conversation.   I would absolutely come back!

Great selection of about 30 mostly European beers along with maybe five wines on tap. A pretty basic food menu. An $11 order of tacos gives you two tasty tacos, probably not enough for a full dinner. Nice, pretty spacious outdoor patio. Definitely go for the beer.
Tried the pizza - with brussels sprouts - amazing! The egg on top is fab!

I love Angels Trumpet.   Really great space, cool vibe.   Awesome beer selection, and amazing food. The only complaint would be how loud it gets inside, sound just bounces around in that place, but what can you do?  Everything else is so great and I always have such a great time when I am here that after diving in to my beer flight I hardly even notice.

Well I'm a chile relleno eatin' motherf***r, motherf***r!   And let me tell you, I've eaten a LOT of 'em at a LOT of different places and have had some that were a bit lack luster  (i.e. Chino Bandido's Cheez-Its crusted awkward chile relleno) and a lot that were as delicious as I thought (at the time) they could come.   Tonight I had Chef Brian's chile relleno "TV Dinner" at Angels Trumpet that officially takes the cake as the BEST chile relleno I've ever had.  No joke.  So good, in fact, that once I'm finished, I should pay my cheque, walk straight into the kitchen and shoot the cook.  Why?  Because this chile relleno was so good that I fear it is upsetting the balance of the universe and that's what I do; I restore balance to this universe.  Although it was Mexican to eat, I was in the mood for a Belgian and after a long process of consideration, ended up taking my server, Brendan's, suggestion and ordered the Affligem Brouwerij, a Belgian Tripel.  This ended up being a PERFECT suggestion for both my beer mood and pairing with the delicious food.    I have never been disappointed with Angels Trumpet and will continue to go there until my level of satisfaction is severly compromised.  I assume that will be approximately never.
Always a great time when I visit here. The variety of beer for the beer snobs, like me, is a welcomed sight. The outdoor seating is comfortable and plentiful.

Well, I just found my favorite brewery. Get the imperial red. That's all I have to say. The appetizers go very well with the beer and I love that there are so many other has that are close by in downtown Phoenix so you can just bar hop! We got the poutine fries. Bro a huge fan of gravy but these were delicious and compliments the beer well.  They have a wide variety of selection to choose from. I have to come back for the homemade pop tarts everyone raves about.

The place is cool, very hipster. Outdoor and indoor seating with a larger and more descriptive beer menu indoors. Four of us sat down ecstatic about their 6 , 6 oz samplers. Unfortunately of the 18 different flavors we chose, collectively we only enjoyed 2. Really wanted to like this place...It was extremely disappointing.

OK I gave this place the benefit of the doubt by visiting a second time but when we visited for lunch they still continue to have major issues with the place. Our food order was once again messed up as it was the previous time we visited. The server also knew little to nothing about the beers they had on tap.  I think it is bizarre that when four people order food at the same time that the kitchen cannot expedite everything so that everyone gets served at the same time.

Loved this place! Walked in and felt an immediate energy from all the patrons. Friendly staff/server.  Ordered the beer flight - so cool to make your own choices - 6 of them to be exact. Spam sliders were divine. Ordered the burger & fries (wife) and the flatbread pizza. It was ALL fantastic! Best thing was the prices. Our tab was $31. Don't know how they stay in business, but I sure appreciated the low bill. In Scottsdale we would have easily paid double for the same exact food. Don't overlook this hidden jem folks, and let's keep them around. They are a real Phoenix treasure.

Wonderful experience all around. Everything on the menu sounded good so the bartender steered me in the right direction with the Va-va-verde tacos. The beer list caters to anyone. I will be going back next time I'm in town.

Great atmosphere, good music, great vibe and wonderful wait staff. The wait staff was always ready and willing to help. Always had quick service with drinks and food. Had a wonderful peanut butter, banana and raspberry Chipotle sandwich. The other was a burger with fried onions, fried egg, cheddar cheese and bacon. The side salad that came with the sandwiches were excellent and had a salad dressing that had a horseradish flavor.   Will definitely be returning and trying some Ale next time.

It's a little bit of a walk from the office for lunch, but worth it.    We started with the hummus.  I liked it.  It was more textured than smooth and had a nice flavor.  Liked that it came with cucumbers.  We also had the chips/salsa/bean dip.  The chips were ok.  I generally like thick chips, but many of the chips were soft, which I'm not a fan of.  The salsa was spicy and the bean dip was savory.  I liked it.  For my main, I had the BBQ salad with brisket.  Great flavor and textures.  Just the right amount of lettuce, with lots of vegetables.  The brisket was fine, but the BBQ sauce combined with the dressing provided a nice punch.  Service was a little slow, but I don't think they staff up for lunch.  Seems like more of a pre-entertainment place to go during the evenings.  I liked the space.  Roomy with a hipster vibe.
A few of us stopped in late fit a few beers. The bartender was great. If I lived here I wood be here a lot.

Presentation should never take longer than fermentation. But there I was, still thirsty after 15 minutes of waiting for my pint of Norse Legend. When I ordered it, the waiter didn't know what I was talking about. I told him "You know, the sahti (I didn't confuse him by pronouncing it Finnish style) from Sam Adams." Finally, I just gave him the number on the board. Then he scurried off. We never saw him again.   In the meantime, I checked out the food menu. It looked excellent. But we rolled in just as the kitchen closed at 10 p.m. on a Friday. No appetizers, no desserts, no nothin'.   My wife and I tried talking. But the exposed beams and concrete floors and walls that look so nice turn the volume up to where we had to yell at each other. After a few more minutes of waiting and not seeing a familiar waiter, we did something we've never done at a brewery/alehouse/taproom before: We walked out, still thirsty for a quality beer. We went to Sun Up, where we had a cask-conditioned IPA made with Simcoe hops that pretty well destroyed anything on-tap at Angels Trumpet.  We'll give Angels Trumpet another shot in the future - once we hear it has its act together.

Loved this place! Went with a group and stayed longer than I should have because it was so fab. I loved the open feel and casual set up.   My BF was sooooo excited they had a local brew (Vermonster) from near his hometown. Score for the day!   The service staff was great and helpful with suggestions and tastes. Visit this spot- you won't be disappointed.
Killer beers and freaking fantastic food everything just rocked except it was very hot in the Resturant, I know it's Phoenix and its 104 outside but air conditioning is a good thing

We're visiting Phoenix, trying out the Angels Trumpet Ale House on a recommendation overheard from others. This place is incredible! There were 31 craft beers on tap and they served 6 different wines on tap as well. We split the Matador with slaw and the Churchill Grilled Cheese with fries. Both were incredible! We'll be back to Phoenix, to eat here again!!

Excellent choice of microbrews and food is pretty damn good...love The Mess (poutine) and Burley Burger. Unfortunately, every single time I have been there...the service straight up sucks, so we stopped going. Great vibe of a locals haunt, but you get this pretentious hipster vibe from the waitstaff who take 15 minutes before you see them for the first time, then it's like pulling teeth to get them to come back.there is a fine line of bugging the shit out of people and giving them their space to enjoy them self, but they go to the extreme end of practically ignoring you.  I'm very empathetic to the service industry because I grew up in it, but if you expect people to give you a good tip, much less even return, you need to be attentive and engaging. I'd been 5-6 times bc I love the atmosphere, microbrew and great food, but after the continued attempt at giving them another chance and the same result from the waitstaff...I'm no longer going to waste my time or money.

This place was great!! Walking in you see a large chalkboard with about 30 beers. They are rotating kegs so when one is finished they replace it with another beer from a different brewery. I had an epicenter which was so great tasting. There are letters that are next to the beers which tell you what glasswear the beer is served in. We also had the farm flatbread. Which was also pretty tasty! It was kind of messy though because it wasn't cut all the way and the utensil they give you is a fork and a really dull butter knife. In the end you just give up and grab what you can and just eat. Lol. I think our waitress name was Chelsea. Very friendly and attentive and quick to serve. Will be back here soon!

Angel's Trumpet Ale House is the perfect addition to the growing Phoenix beer scene. In fact, I've been waiting (with beer-baited breath) for some time now for this place to open, even following the building process on their Facebook page, because it is a great downtown destination for a quality beer after work. With FilmBar right across the street, this block is possibly morphing into one of the coolest parts of town.  Let's talk about the beer. I like the rotating 31 flavors (or is it 32?). Either way, it's more fun than being a kid at Baskin-Robbins, eyeballing the beer selection as one barrel is emptied and another unusual selection takes its place. Sometimes I think it would be better if they had a standard line-up of six beers or so, as it takes some effort to pick a beer that suits your mood. There's a lot of information to absorb from the giant list including brewery, region, beer name, beer style, etc. and many of the beer styles are fairly exotic. However, it is a great beer adventure...  The food at Angel's Trumpet is some good stuff too. I had to try The Nutter after reading a review of this place in a local paper. Get this: peanut butter, bananas, raspberry-chipotle jam PLUS housemade marshmellow fluff and peppered bacon! This was a fabulous grilled sandwich experience you're not likely to encounter elsewhere. The pizzas and Asian-style wings were also pretty damn tasty, so I think they've got all the right elements any respectable alehouse should have.  My only gripe (yet not enough to give them less than five stars) was that it was not made clear that a 20% gratuity would be added to my bill automatically. We started as a group of four that grew to about eight, and the staff was incredibly accommodating. I ended up tipping 20% (on top of the already-included 20%) for my meal, which made things a little pricier than I had anticipated. I want this place to succeed, so I don't feel too bad about over-tipping, I just think they need to mention the automatic gratuity for parties over a certain size.

Great variety of beers on tap, good food and such a chill atmosphere. What more could you ask for?  I'm used to beer gardens like Yard House and was thrilled to find a place that has beers on tap from local breweries to beers from states like Utah, Colorado, California and Hawaii here.  I started off my Sunday with beers with Khoa N. and an order of "The Mess" aka poutine. The server was really helpful in helping me pick out a beer, I was feeling like having a Belgian and I concluded with a Belgian Rye Ale from Borderlands, Arizona. Crisp, light, with a bit of bitterness at the end it was refreshing and oh-so-delicious with my mammoth plate of poutine. The poutine was hands down the best I've had (though I've never been to Canada to rightly judge). The fries were seasoned well, great texture, turkey gravy was rich and homey and the cheese curds oozed with the heat of the gravy. Not that's a mess I can deal with! The portion was huge, enough to feed 4 as an appetizer!  The server who helped us was great, gave awesome recommendations and checked back on us frequently. The atmosphere is casual, effortless and reminiscent of many of the restaurants in Seattle- think wood grain, black and open ceiling.  The brews, the food and the service is awesome. Two thumbs up for carrying local brews! I'm all for supporting local businesses. Khoa N. and I inhaled as much food as we could and downed our beer leaving our bellies full and left happily!
Fun place to hang out on a Saturday afternoon! The spam sliders are crazy good. Awesome service! Beer and wine on tap. Casual atmosphere.

A great place to go and spend a lazy Saturday. The patio is amazing. A robust list of local beers adore a chalkboard above the bar and outside. The food is great asswell, I would recommend the pretzel appetizer and the Chet burrito as a main.
Cute little place! Didn't try the food but great for happy hour on the patio when the weather is nice. Will be back!
Fun beer flights, good food, casual relaxed atmosphere and pleasant service. I'm always happy to end up here.

This is one of my favorite places in Phoenix. It's a must-try for beer enthusiasts; it has a large selection of beer on tap, one of the largest I've seen, and an incredibly lively and unique environment. Angels gives off a very hip vibe and is usually full of younger people looking for a chill night out. The bartenders are fun, personable, and know how to crack a joke. On the food front, while the pizza I ordered was nothing amazing, it was good enough to keep from detracting from the experience, and their pop-tart albeit rich is life-changing. I will definitely be going back to try some of their other beers and hope to try some of their more highly recommended food items (i.e. their fish tacos, spam sliders) when I do.

I discovered Angels Trumpet House after a friend shared with me this place was named one of Phoenix's 50 best places to try. I came here specifically for the grill cheese that was featured on this Top 50 list. Cheese, cheese, cheese all day long I could eat this product...in so many forms. My arteries would not like it but my palette can't get enough. But it did get just enough of the grill cheese on sourdough with several cheeses--not the standard cheddar either. It was tasty but nothing I'm over the moon about. A TON O' BEER on tap, so much local brew adds to the hipness of this place. The ambience reminds me of the food court at IKEA. This restaurant has potential to be something...better.

The house was packed last night. There was a wait list so I told Mat put me down for two.   I gave him my first name and last initial, because this tells Mat we are yelpers and that is a good thing. We head on over to the bar which was packed and in a moment i was acknowledged and ordered two beers off the black board live alerts. I also asked if there was a cask tonight, "next week" the sweet gal replied.  Beer number one: König Ludwig Weiss draft poured into a clean shaker glass, this beer is an easy-drinking, satisfying wheat beer with emphasis on predominantly hefeweiss yeast. The flavors are heavy and saturating on the palate, but clean and refreshing. An 84 point beer $6.  Beer number two: Green Flash Trippel poured into a large brandy snifter, hazy orange gold with a tall white head. The beer smells of apples, pears, spices, and malt backbone. The taste is that of a classic trippel. The hops do add some nice balance throughout the beer and the alcohol is well-hidden in the flavor. 83 Points $7.  We walk on to the patio and have a seat while we are waiting for a table to dine. Outside is very comfortable with views the Downtown sky scrapers. There is a quarter moon in conjunction with The Westward Ho tower. It's pretty nice.  Mat comes and finds us happy and chatting away. We walk in and are seated on a two top. I begin asking my neighbors what are you eating. They were super friendly guys and began to show me their food. Drum sticks called Smokin Legs $9 that looked great and a near finished burger$9. Most interesting looking item on the menu was the Bison BLT in a blanket. $8.5. a bison hotdog topped with bacon, seasonal greens, tomato and house made mayo. My gal got herself a Churchhill grilled cheese $8.5 smoked mozzarella and fontina cheese, honey drizzle, seasonal greens and pesto. Side of fries. I ordered more beer.  The house is in need of acoustics. The party was loud but super fun.

After seeing a review on PBS's "Check Please, Arizona" months ago, we finally made it down to Phoenix to try the Angels Trumpet Ale House. We chose Tuesday to take advantage of TV Dinner Night and it was uniquely presented and tasty. A great deal for the price. We also would recommend the Fish Tacos.  The inside was loud and vibrant. Everyone appeared to be having fun, but we will sit outside next time if the weather permits.  4 out of 6 glasses of the Beer Flight were really good, but they need to describe their sour beers as sour on their big chalk board. Instead of beers with a hint of fruit, it tasted like a liquid Sour Warhead Candy.   The parking lot is small so bring quarters or plastic for the parking meters on the street.  If you find yourself thereby one afternoon, it is definitely worth the stop.

Was there a year ago in the heat and for some reason they had left the doors/walls open! Ugh! But they redeemed themselves on my last visit!  Love that they have wine and beer on draft, their flatbreads are great as are their wing and fries!  A great place to meet friends after work!

Can sum this place up in a few sentences:  1. Great rotating beer selection (albeit the menu is a challenge to read from several tables.) 2. Amazing large patio (which is great because this place gets overly crowded.) 3. Meh food (but hey it lets you try more beers without falling down.) 4. Loud (you didn't really come here to talk to your friends, did you? Good. Drink more.)

Great little place in downtown Phoenix. Love the beers on tap, and the menu is delicious! My mom and I came in and had the 810 sandwich and the pizza special, and everything was fantastic. Will absolutely be coming back and recommending to others.

Our server Sean was very nice and very attentive, and the beer selection was unique and satisfying. This place is only missing one thing.. Vegan food options.. Just add like one or two and I wouldn't have to eat before coming in. Other than that I really like this place and plan on coming back soon!

Unbe-Freakin-lievable. I just had a pizza with Brussels Sprouts and a sunny side up egg. (Not to mention bacon, Caramelized Onion, and pecorino Romano.)  great food, friendly service, dog friendly and all ages blend together perfectly. Wow.

Came here upon my friends recommendation. I was a little disappointed that they didn't have any in house brews but they do carry lots of beers. My brother and I got the flight which are any 6 3oz samples that you want. We also shared a the Tractor Pizza - two farm eggs*, bacon, brussels sprouts, caramelized onions, pecorino romano, smoked mozzarella, roasted tomato sauce. The beers were pretty good. The waitress choose all the IPAs for me as I love IPAs. The pizza was fantastic. Egg was runny and tied the pizza together pretty well.  They have an outdoor area with cornhole and plenty of seating as well. Pretty chill spot to hang when the weather permits. Overall, cool spot. Has TVs with games on. Solid beer and food.

If you're visiting from out of town, I think you'd appreciate this. It's not too Phoenix, but it's in Phoenix which makes it cool. Tons of beers on tap, that change out all the time. So if you're a beer drinker then this is your place. The outside patio is really nice and the vibe inside is great as well. The menu is unique, they make their own catsup and that's interesting. good meat plates and good veggie plates. I'm positive you'll leave here with a smile. The only reason I didn't give it a full 5 stars is that most of the waiters/waitresses I've had were just not up to par in speed and friendliness that you would expect from a place like this. There was just some excitement missing from them.

Hip gastropub with a cool vibe. Most of the ipa's were super hoppy so I didn't care for those, but the food and crow made up for it. Mixed crowd from tattoos to polo shirts. I recommend their pizza with egg on it!
I love this place! This is not your typical bar, stays pretty well lit during the day and there are no billiards, arcades or other bar games. Nope, in this place the beer is the star!
This is a must try if you love beer. 30+ beer taps and 6 wines on tap. I used to live in Portland, and this bar has a PDX "feel" to it. Great service. Great beer. Great patio. What's not to like?

Everything about this place screams 'awesome downtown scene'. With their HUGE selection of great beers, delicious food (we had the soft pretzel app) and their big back patio, it's hard not to love this dr hangout. The staff at Angels Trumpet is fun, nice, and down to earth, which matches its atmosphere. This may have been my first time here but it will most definitely not be my last.  Overall, if you want to have a good beer in a chill environment, head to Angels Trumpet Ale House.

This was my second time coming here and it was excellent both times. The best thing about it is the beer! There are many different, distinct choices to meet anyone tastes. The outside seating area is nice, you can find shade or bask in the sun. The food is solid. We've experienced the flat bread and wings and would recommend both.  We come to the Phoenix area once a year and could definitely see this place as a yearly tradition to visit. The only weird thing about it is the entrance to the restaurant - it doesn't look like one. Our first visit we did a lap around the building before trying the nondescript door. Can't wait to visit again!

We've been here twice and both times had good service and delicious food. The fish tacos are amazing, particularly the Big Guppy. They have both indoor and outdoor seating with umbrella heaters outside. There is both table and lounge seating outdoors as well. The parking lot is small and this place is popular so plan for metered parking on side streets - most take debit cards. Due to its location & the arts festivals, this place is VERY busy on the 1st Friday of each month.
What a great place! Brought the dog on the patio and she even got great service! Had the grilled cheese and pumpkin pop tart! Delicious!
Great place to have a beer. Especially after having a long hike in the Phoenix summer heat
Very cool place with good conversation, great beer and food.  Will definitely go back next time in Phoenix.  Try the spam sliders.

I love this place! I tried it last June while my sense of taste was gone.. such a bummer. I have been back since but now that I have a wheat allergy (diagnosed) it isn't as fun beer and food wise. I still take out of towners just for the show of the tap wall. I can drink the wines and they have gladly destructed a wrap or burger for me before. I love the atmosphere and it is a great mellow place for Sunday Funday, though you could make it crazy with a few invited friends!!

I'm usually not one to write a review but I feel I must in order to to maybe help improve the quality of service at this establishment. We came in and waited a 5-100th minutes while the waiter, who looked right at us when we sat, talked to another patron about different kinds of beers. The service was incredibly slow and there were only 4 other tables with 1-3 people there besides us. The bar area was fuller but the bartender was helping them. We ordered the Brewlee and the Outlaw burger which were really tasty. However the fries were burnt and more than half were inedible. We just left them there....didn't complain cause we thought maybe that's how they were. We looked on the yelp site after and the fries looked totally different and not burnt to a crisp at all. Just a couple of ideas to maybe just be better on service and watch the quality of the food since the burgers are $10 plus.

I've been here multiple times over the past couple years withe different groups of friends or dates or solo...  And always with the same result.  I want to like them. It's great beer usually and I appreciate the look/construction.  But parking is atrocious. The service has been horrid on every occasion.  Whether sitting at the bar or at a table, it takes forever to get served or have orders followed up upon to put it mildly.    The food is ok. Not great. Not bad. Just ok for the price.    I keep hoping the service improves, but it just hasn't. It has gotten to the point where I only stop in for rare beer events now. And even then I question if it's worth giving them the money given the lack of service/hospitality.   Recommended.  But only if you're not in a hurry...
Great place for beer lovers! And their flat-bread pizza is a must have. I like the Tractor.

Made a quick trip to Phx this weekend and while there we decided to check this place out.  Wow! What a great decision on our part.  We wanted something located in the downtown area that offered a good selection of food and brews.  This place was perfect.  We had great service, great food and plenty of good beers.  This will be our "go to" spot every time we come to Phx now.

Tuesday Night is TV DINNER NIGHT! woot woot.
