Angels Trumpet is a great place for dinner (avocado salad is on point, just like the fish tacos, their hummus and pretzels)  Keep in midn hte portions are BIG, so if you want to save a couple $$s sharing is caring and split some plates!  Oh and did I mention it is cheap? You get your bang for your buck in my opinion. Great flavors, great house wine and beers.  And its dog friendly in the patio!

My husband is the craft beer lover of the two of us, however, we both loved this place. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful. Drinks were great, good was yummy (and very unique), the atmosphere was very modern-seemed like the place to be if you frequent the area.

Looking forward to trying this place before it opened. Got to go and I had a good time yet the staff came off as a bit too cool for school. Other than that, great, great beer selection. If your a newbie, try to beer flight for a great introduction.  Good thing to share with friends. The food had variety such as Spam burgers, which are fantastic.  Price about average meaning a little steep ranging from 5-10 for a beer. About usual for these places though. Overall, will probably go back hoping the staff's aloofness was a one time thing.

If you like beers, this is place to go. They have tons of selection. We usually do the flight where we pick 6 types to taste before committing to a pint. Their menu pair well with the beers. They have limited parking, one TV and an open flow to the patio. It's a great place to meet up with a group of friends but it can be very loud and echoie.
Decent service, love the house made ketchup and seasoned fries. Stay away from the 810 the artificial smoke flavoring on the turkey is overwhelmingly chemical and gross. Get the matador instead

Visited here on a Sunday for lunch.  I had the veggie burger and my husband had the jalapeño burger along with a Pilsner & Amber Ale.  Both burgers were large portions and delicious.  The habanero slaw was ok - hard to keep this dish fresh unless you cook/prepare with each order. Ambiance/patio is great when the weather is nice.  They advertised a tv-dinner menu worth checking out for a future Tuesday evening.  Gave three stars because they did not have all the beers available on the chalkboard menu nor do they serve any domestic beers, which can and would be an option when the selection is sparse (and IMHO it was slim pickings for our palette)!

Didn't think I could find craft beer in AZ but lo and behold I found this place on yelp nearby and it is awesome with an excellent selection on tap. Place looks hard to find upon arrival but once in it is bustling with folks of all ages. Food is also awesome! Highly recommended for the eloquent drinker in town looking for craft beer.

I've been here quite a few times now I've had the Casbah Pizza which is absolutely delicious. The mass is also very very good. Tonight I tried a different pizza with lots of wild mushrooms and veggies very very good. My husband tried the barbecue chicken pizza which was also very very good. I haven't had anything yet that is not absolutely wonderful and delicious

Wow! First and foremost, I was pleasantly surprised by Angels Trumpet! Traditionally, my expectations for food at alcohol establishments is quite low, but this Ale House really brings it with their menu and food!    Our table started with the Pretzel Bites as an appetizer, yum! These come in sets of 4 bread buns with two dipping sauces on the side. The buns are pipping hot and topped with course sea salt and are nice and buttery. After a strong recommendation from my friends who were returners at the establishment, I ordered the BBQ Brisket Grilled Cheese with fries. YUM! This was a heavy, large meal, but it sure was delicious.   To round off our indulgent meal, we decided to order two desserts to share. We got the special, which was a cookie dough and ice cream roll dipped in dark chocolate and the homemade pop tart. Both were amazing. The cookie roll was very unique and the pop tart was hot and flakey and tasted like a pie. I was surprised to find that the food and dessert were both amazing.   The only downfall to this place is how popular it is! We waited about an hour for our table and the place continued to be packed through the night. It is a popular place for large groups and drinks, so you can expect evenings to be packed.

The flights are really fun since they have such an awesome selection of beers!  The decor fits the place great.  Knowledgeable bartenders can give you advice on beer selections and the food was delicious too.

One of the best burgers I've had. I ordered the good ole fashion with a fried egg and my friends ordered the brewlee. We both thought the burgers were delicious. The ketchup they served with the fries was different than normal ketchup it almost tasted like pasta sauce but I was into it. Service was also amazing nice and attentive but also gave us enough space. I liked the atmosphere of the place. The only qualms I had about this place was that the parking lot was small especially for the size of the place.

If I can sum up Angels Trumpet in two words: hipster beer.   It's located in the RoRow district [location along makes anything hipster-ish], and they have a crazy selection of rotating local, seasonal, and craft beers. Both times I've been, the chalkboard has been updated a few times. It's a positive and a negative if you find a really good beer to drink and they run out. Happened to me recently when I came to hang out with friends, and to my surprise the beer I ordered was not the one I drank.   If you have to wait for a table and want to get a [cute cupcake tin] flight, definitely write down beers from the big board while you wait. Don't write down the names, just the #'s as that's how they fill the sample cups. And keep an eye on the board if something changes! They also have a complimentary matching mini board outside if you decide to sit in the patio area.   My first visit was with a fairly large group on a fun light-rail beer crawl we planned. Angels Trumpet was on the plan because of its proximity to the Metro and Yelp told me they have a lot of beer [both true]. One of the girls arrived ahead of most of us so she was able to secure a few high tops next to another - wasn't a problem for the spot. I can't remember our servers name, but he was pretty good for having to deal with ~15 drunk-ish people and all of the beers and food we needed and getting our checks not mixed up. Make sure to order wings mixed in the sauce! They are so bomb dot com.   The most recent time I came my friends and I sat outside as one of the guys brought his puppy! While the beer, wings, and company were fabulous, the service then was just bad. We had a hard time keeping up with our waitress's location when we needed her to order anything, get water refills, and get our checks. I noticed she would disappear for 15min at a time or so. Luckily though another waiter tried to care of us in her absence.  I hope by my next visit that the service improves. Definitely want to check out their cheeky tv dinner and trivia night!

Love this downtown location! Angel's Trumpet House has a great mix of professional, urban, hipster locals in a great and fun environment.  You can't miss it from the street: with the brightly painted angel mural taking up the full length of the building.  Inside, they have a huge selection of beer, with plenty of seasonal selections. On the most recent outing, I tried a gingerbread lager which hit the seasonal spot.  I haven't met an item on the menu that I don't like. I could go on about the pretzels- amazing! I order them every time I'm there. But I can't overlook the flatbreads or the hamburgers. All are delicious.   During the summer, it is nice to grab a cool brew on the patio (which is also dog friendly).  If you are looking for a great spot downtown- add this to your list!

A great recommend by someone from work.. a wow culinary experience and a brew pub superb choice . With wines from my own experience in northern Cali a blessing too . Great experience and I look forward to my next visit and I will surely sit outside to enjoy the city view and misters garden zen view. Will be back soon to partake

This is the best bar that I've ever been to.  When they opened, they had one mediocre thing on the menu, but they removed it.  My friends and I have attempted to try everything on the menu and 3 of us have had everything but the salads.  Sorry, I'll go somewhere else for a salad.  I'm here to overeat and drink great beer.  Try:  spam sliders, pop tart dessert, sausage appetizer, and good luck deciding between the fries with their awesome ketchup or the cranberry coleslaw  They do a good job keeping interesting beers on tap.  I dislike that the flight price went from $9 to $15 though, that kinda ticked me off.  You could bring a date here and split a flight or two and be able to talk without chewing the whole time.  BTW We are the glass stackers!  And last time, we finally broke some glasses.  Well, I did.  I broke your glasses.  :(

Food was great (pretzels and the nutter sandwich were awesome), beers (especially the selection) were great and I loved the vibe and location. Though the service was pretty bad. Took forever for our server to get us anything which turned a quick bite into a long ordeal. I will be back but will not expect to be in and out quick.

Woo! Had a beer flight...fun names for the beers a and quite a variety! Great atmosphere and lively crowds. Wonderful people watching.  Food looked amazing, I can't wait to go back and try some of the dishes myself!

Super delicious!    I recommend the gaucho (shredded pork tacos)   the burgers looked ridiculous and the wings and warm pretzels were bomb!  Pass on the Cole slaw.  Great prices and awesome selection of drafts.

Love this place for a nice day and some good beer and food. Staff is on it. Been there multiple times and each is helpful when selecting a beer or food and your drink will always be ready for a refill. Love this spot!! Only, you'll need to park down the street and keep up your parking meter, don't ever count on parking in their lot. Still love this spot!!!

Had the Caesar salad and the outlaw burger. Honestly. Nothing special about the food. They do have a lot of beer but only a basic wine selections, and very cheap wine at that. It is definitely not a date night spot. It is so loud you can't hear and are kind of force to join the loudness because the only way to have a conversation is yelling. To top it off my glass was cracked. That makes me wonder about the judgment of their staff to think it is ok to serve drinks in broken glasses. I left with a headache from the cheap wine and loud crowd.

This place knows beer. I come here for Theology Pub, a thing my local church hosts where we come drink and talk about spirituality on the first sunday of every month. It's great! What I usually do is get a flight of beer (I think they're $9... anyway, the price isn't bad) and try a bunch of different types of beer. Their selections are always changing, so it's hard to say what's my favorite, but I really come here for the new experiences anyway. I also like that it's close to FilmBar (if I want to catch a cool indie film) and other stuff on Roosevelt. I hate how the neighborhood is becoming gentrified, so I hope places like this last a long time. I've eaten the food here once, but can't say I was impressed.

Not family friendly as there are no menus for kids however it is a house of brews and more suited for young adults and a classy laid back crowd. I enjoyed there big guppy tacos but wasn't blown away it was okay not something memorable. My mom and husband ordered the burritos they said they were good. The food was fresh and although they had a small food selection I would come back again. I wish I would have ordered a hamburger and tasted there beer selection although that will be for another adventure overall pretty alright place not at the top of my list but yeah I would go here again... without the kids.

Downtown Phoenix is by no means lacking great places to drink and/or eat. On any particular night you can leave your house walk into a few bars/restaurants and end up in some fabulous places.  One I frequent often is Angel's Trumpets Ale House.  I belly up to this bar for 2 reasons:  1). With 30 some beers on tap that rotate often, (most within the same night!)  I ALWAYS have options. I appreciate a beer adventure - trying as many as possible - so that I can broaden my beer drinking experience/knowledge.  I've found some great favorites here (ie Hopslam, Pranqster, omg GULP) It's like bringing all of the nation's best beer to one conference, located right here at Angel's Trumpets.  2). Space. There is lots of it. The spread is bright and open and with contemporary, upcycled decor - you really can't go wrong. Have a large group of people? No prob! Easy to accommodate. And with that patio in the back...give me a break! This massive patio (now with misters) is perfect for enjoying evenings under the Phoenix skyline.   But the Beer and Space can't sell this place alone. Angel's Trumpets is missing something -an energy, a feeling, an emotional attachment that is found so easily in other places like Lost Leaf, Crescent, or Brat Haus, Four Peaks and even Papago Brewery. Sometimes I feel like I'm eating in a big cafeteria hall (unless I'm on the patio) in which every conversation bounces off the walls and floors. There is never any music playing - which blows as I feel it should be a crucial part of any outing. After all, music, beer, art and food are such important aspects of the downtown culture. I'm still yearning for more - and I'm patiently waiting.

Road tripping across the states & ended up in Phoenix last night. After some research online we found Angels Trumpet and originally went to try their Tuesday special of a TV night dinner.   Sadly, they were out of the TV night dinner as I guess it's a pretty popular thing in Phoenix.   Instead, I went for the grilled cheese & dad went for the special quesadilla of the day. I am a major fan of a grilled cheese, and I definitely wasn't disappointed. I had jalapeños added to mine, which definitely gave it a kick, but I love a bit of spice so it was perfect! Dad's quesadilla was incredible too and we would definitely recommend the food to anyone thinking of going to eat there.   Alongside this, they had a beer flight of 6 tastings for $9 and trust me, their portions are generous. I went for all IPAs, because I'm obsessed and dad went for a different array of drinks.   Anyway, all in all, definitely a must visit if you're ever in Phoenix :)
I really like this place. It's unique and I love all the options! Hubs and I love sitting outside with wine!

Really good food and awesome beer selection, but the place can get packed at times, and their hours are quite limited. If you have 2 hours for lunch on a Friday, and you want some good beer and good food, you really can't go wrong.   Parking can be somewhat of a hassle, but look at the meters on McKinley if there is nothing available in their parking lot or out front.   Hot tip: if you like variety, their 6-beer sampler is not a terrible deal at $9 because their pours are always more than the advertised 3 oz each. Also, they have a phenomenal selection of stouts right now, if that's your thing.

Went to Angels Trumpet Ale House for beer, but stayed for the food. On Tuesday's they do a cute TV dinner for $9! They had a plateful of variety, enchiladas, a brownie, and more. I've also ordered the homemade pop-tart on separate occasions and it is definitely NOT the type of pop tart that comes out of a box! Happy to report it's gooey and flakey, just like a homemade baked favorite should be. I've also tried their burgers and it's hearty goodness.  And of course, the beers. There's so many beers to choose from it's hard not to find just what you're in the mood for. Solid food and great place to hang out.

I really wanted to like this place, I really did.  My husband and I sat at the bar, and after about a minute my husband had to point out to the bartender that the table needed to be wiped down. Were given menus. We stared at the beer menu on the board, and we probably looked like idiots, but no one ever came over and asked us anything. We finally waved a waiter down. Asked for some suggestions, all i heard was mumbling, didn't want to help, gave us a sheet and told us to put the numbers down of the beers we wanted to try. Gave us our flights, never came over to ask us if we liked anything in particular or if we had any questions... nothing. We also ordered the Porky pizza. The concept is great but there was waaaaaaaayyyyyy to much sage on the pizza, totally overpowering. I had to dig in and take the huge pieces off so I can eat the pizza. We paid, got up, not a thank you for coming, nothing. Don't care.  Thats fine I don't care either and I won't come back.  Go to Four Peaks Brewing in Tempe. Great crowd, great beers, great atmosphere, great bartenders!!!!!!!! Or Brat Haus in Scottsdale!! Great food and servers are very knowledgeable and actually CARE if you like the beer or not!!

Was on a walk in downtown Phoenix and as I walked by was reminded I hadn't eaten here in awhile. No reason other than absentmindedness. So I decided to grab lunch.   First, this is one of those fun hip (yeah I realize using that word may make people question eating here but don't.) places just off downtown. It has a huge beer selection that cover a broad spectrum of tastes from a variety of brewers.   Second, the food here is great. In the past I've had wings and several sandwiches, all exceeding expectations. Today, was no different.   I have 5 words for you: bbq beef brisket grilled cheese! What more could you ask for! The brisket was tender and juicy and the sauce was not overpowering. The cheese was gooey and perfectly melted me it was served on thick white bread, grilled perfectly to be crunchy on the outside but soft inside. Plus it soaked up all the sauce so nothing was lost. It truly was a delicious sandwich. Now I got the coleslaw today and unlike a traditional slaw, this was a oil and vinegar based slaw but lightly dressed. It had a nice covering of feta which gave a tangy salty finish to each bite, plus had craisins mixed in for a sweet balance to the salty feta.   All in all, lunch was great. Perfect way to break up a Friday.

Fun, quirky place with plenty of drinks to choose from. I appreciated that they had a cider for me to choose as I don't drink beer. I thoroughly enjoyed the fish tacos for dinner and friends all had burgers. Very delicious! Favorite thing was the pretzel appetizers that we had to get because we were so hungry. Friendly service and decent prices for the quality of food we got. Only downside was the wait. It was 9pm on a Friday and when we walked in, we were told 15 minutes. However it was almost an hour. We stood there the entire time (a group of 3) near the hostesses and they never once reassured us that it would be soon. A friend went up to them to ask if it would be soon and they couldn't give us an answer. We were pretty hangry by the time we got our food. That's the only downside, though.

I've been here a handful of times now and I can say that I've had a wonderful experience each time.   TONS of rotating beers daily, ~$5 beers, ~$11 beer flights, AMAZING burgers, yummy appetizers. I have yet to be disappointed. If you are looking for a nice quiet place, this is definitely not the place. This place is loud and full of energy.   There is a VERY small free parking lot in front, but good luck getting parking there. But you'll easily find street/meter parking nearby.   Environment: 5/5 Food: 5/5 Price: 4/5 Service: 4.5/5
Food...Da' BOMB! Prices...Reasonable. Service...Da' BOMB!  Highlight: Nice atmosphere and ambiance w/ a vast beer selection.

This is my updated review.  I originally reviewed in February, and I have gone back to Angels Trumpet Ale House a couple times after that.  My second time was in the summer, I stopped in for some beers during art walk and I ordered the poutine again.  I was so thoroughly surprised about how much the dish improved.  It was absolutely fantastic and was even better than home (they put green onions on top which were a great addition).    The most recent trip was for lunch during the weekend.  We stopped by for lunch before hitting up a matinee at the Film Bar that is right across the street.  The patio was a great way to enjoy the weather and drink a couple beers.  I ordered a burger with an egg on top.  I was never so impressed with the presentation of the burger.  The bun had a since shine to it.  It came with a huge side of fries that are very good.  Because of these more recent experiences and the quality of the food, I have increased my rating.

Fantastic place to hang out, great date spot, tons of beers on tap, decent food (sandwich and burgers are the best). Great atmosphere. Staff is friendly. Beers available will change as you sit there so if you find something in a flight you like better order a full one quick. That's Part of the fun.

Just moved to Phoenix from San Diego, CA which is known for its craft beer bars. This was a wonderful taste of home, lots of great rare beers on draft and cool ambience. Bar staff was very pleasant and knowledgeable as well.

This is a sneaky little hidden place but some how crowed. The menu has a very diverse set of eats, however, I've only tried 2 of their dishes. 1 a salad with some kind of champagne vinaigrette and burger of some sort, fully equipped with a pretzel bun. One thing thats tried and true is the beer sampler that I remember well :)

First time here. Service was awful and slow af, on a Thursday night at around 9 pm. There was hardly anyone there so it's not like they were busy. The bartender was a stuck up, rude, hipster, bitch. Like come on, smile, fake it, and work for your damn tips. I wondered how the hell she even got hired. It was my friend's and I's first time and we met a group of 4 people there who had already racked up a bill of at least $75. They also said she had been rude all night to them as well, ignoring them and rolling her eyes at every little thing. I wanted to slap the attitude right off her face. We were so nice, polite and patient with her, for her to be treating us like shit. After ordering our drinks, which took 10-15 minutes with a bar that only had 5 people at, we closed our tabs immediately and moved to a big table hoping to be served by waitress instead. But there was no waitress to be seen, my friend went up to the hostess after about 20 minutes of sitting there, then she sent someone over to us. She was nice but kind of an airhead. She brought the food to us and there was a long black hair on the pizza. Sent it back and got another one, it was delicious. Also the beer I was drinking was wonderful, my friends enjoyed their beers as well. Yet it was $9.65 for the smallest glass of beer I've ever seen.. I want to come back here for the beer and food but that horrible service is really stopping me, I don't think I'll ever be coming back. Unless you want terrible, slow, rude employees to wait on you, hair in your food, and over priced delicious food and beer come here.

Horrible service time after time after time. I'd like to say it adds to the charm but it just doesnt. The staff isn't rude or anything. They just have a habit of looking right through you. And if you want silverware to accompany your meal well forget it. Still, we come back week after week after week because they really do have an awesome assortment of beer and who can resist the Tuesday tv dinners?!?
Had lunch here today. Food came out quickly and delicious. The bartenders were awesome, polite, and attentive. Second time here and it definitely won't be the last.

Beeeeerrr. This is beer heaven. They have a huge chalk board with all the different beer choices listed. You can also get flights and choose 6, but you can ask your server to fill it out if you have no idea what to order like me haha. The IPAs are really good and strong. The food is tasty and pairs perfect with the beer. The only problem is the service is sooooo slow, I get that it's really busy but we had to wait way too long I between seeing our server on more than one visit! Still staff is friendly, drinks are incredible and the people are a good mix.

The food is decent, the beer list is fun, and the bartenders are knowledgeable. However, I've never encountered a more rude or unwelcoming wait staff. I won't be returning here unless obligated, because of the horrible service.

Having been here a handful of times, I think I have a decent handle on it.  -On the positive side, the beer selection is immense, and fresh.  If you like beer, you'll love what's available here.  The food selection is unexpected, and unexpectedly good.   The fries are a hit, the flatbreads are great, the variety of quirky or unexpected takes on what I'll call Suburban Kid Soul Food are creative, fun, and delicious.  That said, I particularly like the hummus because it has a bigger sesame hit than any I've ever had, and I like that.  I'd give the place 4 stars easy for these points alone.    However...  - On the negative side.  Parking is almost nonexistent.  The place closes at midnight even on weekends.  And the staff has some standout nice and helpful folks, but balances out overall at somewhat aloof, dragged down by the likes of Tessa, she of the bitchy body language and poorly hidden eye-rolling.   Net/net, the place is entertaining, but seems kind of clubby, and if you're not in the club, your presence will merely be accomodated.  Maybe even with a smile.  But you're taking up space that could otherwise be used by club members...whoever they are.

Angel's does a nice job of being a solid beer bar & dinner spot. The food is good, to the point and well made. The menu has a nice variety and pairs well with the beers.   The beers on tap are diverse for all types of beer drinkers. The place is spacious, the staff is knowledgeable and friendly, and the pricing is very reasonable.    Even though the place isnt very comfy and the decor is cold and uninviting, I can still see myself coming here pretty often. The beer selection, food, vibe, and staff are really good.

Came in for lunch on Saturday and was quite surprised by the variety of beer.  Our waitress Betsy explained their system to us.  We ordered some unique beers that we had never had before and some super tasty food.  Service was very good and the vibe was cool.  We really enjoyed this place and will definitely be back the next time we are in town.

Food was a nice twist for bar food. Wings are unique and tasty. Matador brisket sandwich was very good. Fries were good as well. Nice variety of beer offerings. Decent prices. Staff was very friendly. The service is excellent. Very close to downtown Phoenix and hotels. Great place to grab a beer.

All around best experience I've had in a very long time. This is a real brew house. When I was there, they had 26 beers on tap. I told the bar keeper, I was a little bit unsure about dark beers so he was gentle--suggested "Blacked Out IPA"--excellent choice! Overall service was a 5 stars. Did not come for the food but holy buckets was the "Guppy" delicious. This was basically fish tacos, but so much better! I was going to say I would come back for the beer, then thought I'd say I'd come back for the service, but oh yea I'd come back for the food. Great experience. Don't pass this place up.

I have visited twice. I loved it the first time. Second time was a disaster. Lunch time on a weekend, the place was slammed inside, but had plenty of space on the patio. After 45 minutes of waiting, we decided to leave. I stopped the bus boy 3 times and asked for them to mention to the server we were ready to order drinks and food. I stopped two other servers who said we weren't in their area, and they would get the person who's zone we were in. She appeared once or twice, quickly running to other tables, while ignoring ours. I can't say I am interested in returning after wasting a trip. There appeared to be some sort of event that that bar was aware of, that they completely failed to adequately staff for (a mid day pub crawl type of thing). I watched a couple of other groups walk out as well. They lost a lot of business that day.

First time here, and called to notify the owners that we had a large group coming on a Sat for a birthday party. The owners greeted us upon arrival and saved a spot for us, let us bring a cake, and accommodated about 25-30 of our guests on a busy night.   Lots of local beers on tap, great food options, and Micah, our server, did an awesome job. He was on it, attentive, and all our guests commented on how great the server was.  Only gripes, parking is a bit tricky, as is any spot in downtown, or along that central corridor. The seating where we were, back, right, next to the windows were a bit hot. It was humid and we were in the sun. But other than that, we had an awesome time. We will definitely be back to try more beers.  Ask for Micah, he rocks!!

My girlfriend and I were downtown riding the light rail looking for apartments. We were looking for a place within walking distance of the light rail because it was hot. It was a five or ten minute walk of the stop. It looks a little uninviting from the outside.. Took a minute to find the door.. But once we got it it was really cool. They had a lot of beers on tap - we don't drink - but they had a wide selection. The food was awesome. I got a bacon burger and she got the grilled cheese. The grilled cheese had honey on it , which sounds weird, but she raved about it. It had a hipster sort of feel. They make their own pop tarts which sounded cool but they only had peanut butter and due to an allergy would work. But overall, we'd go back. Maybe once we move downtown!
Excellent fried chicken sandwich and the chocolate peanut butter porter was amazing. (Achockolypse).

Cool atmosphere. I like the rotating selection of beers, but lately my favorite brews tend to be more fruity beers. I loved the Peche Mel Brasserie dubuisson freres Belgium. They do flights in small glasses in muffin tins. Cute idea. I also tried a sandwich and french fries. Gotta have the fries! Am I right? Anywhere I go, I have to test them! So they fries passed the Lizzle test, they are garlicky and come with house ketchup- it's zesty and I love it! I also think the patio would be a stellar location for some winter fire pit relaxing. Just sayin!

Stumbled upon this place when looking for something somewhat near the Airport. Food was amazing and not your usual run of the mill menu. I'd recommend the Casper pizza. Beer selection is incredible too. Great outside seating area with a cool hipster vibe. I'd eat here whenever I am in this area.

Really fun, cool environment with well educated staff who can be testy at times but are generally good natured and will spend the time if they have it. Coffee shop environment and a good place to hang with a couple friends.

Spam!  They have Spam! Yeah that compressed, salty, meat from a can.     Ok, ok...I realized I may be the only one excited about this, ESPECIALLY since they are known for their FABULOUS rotating beer selection, 30+ on tap at any one time.  They also offer some wines on tap as well.  Order up a flight or 2 (6 tasters of  your choosing of any of the listed beers) and expand your beer palate or go for a pint of your favorite. Their menu is quite complementary to their beer offerings.   Ok, now back to the Spam.  Now trust me on this,  when Spam is done right it can be quite tasty.  They do it very well here.  Their Spam Sliders, as a meal if you enjoy Spam as much as I do, or nicely shared.  It is fried to crisp perfection and served on toasted Hawaiian bread  with a Sriracha mayo coleslaw.   My other Spammy favorite is a Sammy, the Churchill Grilled Cheese, you pay a lil extra for the crispy fried Spam goodness (or bacon, you really can't go wrong here) but it goes so well with the melty deliciousness of smoked mozzarella and fontina cheese.    You have to come and check out their Tuesday TV dinner meal.  A TV dinner like compartment tray comes to you filled with yummies that vary every week (Main dish, side or 2, and a dessert). These are not Hungry Man meals  but you won't leave hungry.   Make sure to follow them on Facebook to see what they are serving up that Tuesday and get there early because it has been know to be a sell out option.     I love this place, but, "Why only 4 stars?", you ask.  Well, it gets quite loud in the main restaurant area.  Every sound kind of carries and you spend your time speaking loudly to have a conversation.  So when the weather is good I like the patio mostly because the noise issue does not carry-over to the patio.    Always, check their Facebook for fun and educational events and "classes".  I recently attended a "Cider School" here on a weekend before they opened for business that day.  In attendance were Woodchuck and J.K. Scrumpy brewers/reps.  We tasted 6 types of apples commonly used in cider making. Tasted several ciders, including some that were not even on the market  yet. Oh don't let me forget the food pairing.  The most fun I have had in a long time.  [That event itself was a 10 out of 5 stars, LOVED IT]
Service is leisurely, but beer selection is well curated and food is top notch  bar food.  Patio is great on warm evenings.  Highly recommend.

Great place to get some awesome beers. I always have fun picking out the flight combination of the night. I realized that I'm a "save the best for last" kinda guy! The food is really good too. But I wouldn't bank on getting in for dinner during peak times...I probably wouldn't even want to with how busy it gets.

This is a great bar and place to go with friends. The flights are wonderful and they display the beers in a fun way on the chalk board. My favorite thing I have eaten here was the spaghetti and meatball pizza. I do not see it on the menu online, so it may been a special. Either way it was delicious. Love the vibe and the simply scrumptious food.

Holy COW!!!  I'm back here  at Angels Trumpet Ale House 4 days later for TV dinner night!!   I also was able to order the Cookies and Cream Pop Tart which was the daily flavor!! Wow talk about phenomenal. Pop tart ordering will become a standard on all trips!!   The $8 TV dinner is so worth it. Tonight was Campfire Mac and Cheese with Beanie Weenie Chili, spinach salad, spicy Fritos, jalapeño corn bread and a s'mores for dessert.  For $8 you can't beat the the complete meal.  Can't wait to try other Tuesday TV dinners!

Angles Trumpet Ale House is what every bar should be like. If i had this place anywhere close to me i would be a hardcore regular.   Parking: Only bad part, small lot and metered parking on the street  Decor: Awesome modern decor with a full indoor outdoor area. The whole place opens up and mesh's awesomely. At least in the spring/fall/winter. Might be crazy hot in the summer  Service: They have a lot of people working there who are all very knowledgeable of their crafts beer and in love with their food  FOOD: I don't want to sound like a white girl but OMG. Everything was just stupid stupid good.             Fish Tacos: They are just dummy good. The amount of fish you get in these things are just stupid good. Every bite was a little bit of heaven. By far the best battered fish tacos I've every had. Cabbage mix, beans, crumbled cheese, uhhhh falling in love again just thinking about it             Burgers: All the patties are delicious. The buns work perfectly with all the additions they put on them. If you love egg on everything like I do, just get any burger and add an egg. It's so good!!!            POP TART: This made me reevaluate my life of desserts. Seriously the flakyness, barryness, sugarness. Just every part of what they got in that thing is crazy good.     Just go, don't think about it!!!!

My friends and I were in town and stumbled upon this place.  We actually wanted to try it out because we saw fellow Yelpers mention TV dinners, however when we got there it was only served on Tuesdays.  Bummer.      There was a football game on so many of us were loud and screaming due to the game, but I'm not sure what the atmosphere is like on a regular day.   This place reminds me of a bar you would see in downtown Vegas.  Being a gastropub, they have tons of beers on tap to choose from.  You can also buy beer in a can and take it home in a brown paper bag.  Super classy hahah     Food.  To be honest, the food was just ok, we ordered pizza and burger, but my four stars goes just to the desserts !!! homemade warm poptarts and warm salted caramel chocolate cookies topped with ice cream ...  I guess they change up the flavors of the poptarts so make sure you ask what the filling is.    If you want to try this place out .. I would recommend to skip the meal and go straight for the dessert !
I love everything about this place. The food is fantastic, the beer selection is incredible, and the atmosphere lively but not overwhelming.
Perfect patio for friends or families with babies and dogs!! And Big Guppy Fish tacos are the best!!
The food is just ok.  The beer was so fun to drink and the staff is really helpful in suggesting what to try.  Will come back here!

Burrito is super dry. And served with fried pig skins! Yuck. Also ordered the fall special shrimp flat bread and it was OK.  Beers are great ordered the Keller Weiss and blonde d orange and both were very nice.  Service good.

I was not a particular fan of this place. Went on a Friday evening after work. A friend wanted to try it because we always enjoy supporting new, local places.  They do have a very large selections of beer but the process is very confusing. All of the beers on tap are written on a very large chalkboard above the bar. They use several different colors of chalk for each selection making it very hard to read. It may be easier if they pick one color of chalk for each type of beer, that way it is easy to find what you want. Or have #1-5 be one type of beer, #6-10 another and so on. My boyfriend spent so long trying to find a beer on the board because of this. Two of our friends were so overwhelmed with the way the selections were presented they just asked the server to surprise them with a choice.   The acoustics in the place are terrible. It was so loud inside that it was hard to carry on a conversation at the table.   Also, no happy hour. This would be a great way to draw in an after work crowd.

Fantastic selection of beer and wine and a few ciders! If you are an avid beer drinker you definitely want to check it out, the food is always pretty good too. Long bar and lots of tables for dates or groups of friends to gather at. A neat place to begin your night at for sure, not the most popping place but perfect to grab a beer BEFORE heading to a concert, event or bar crawl. Would recommend t check thus place out, right across the street from Film bar and Cobra Arcade if you are looking for a fun night.
Great food and service! Although, it is a bit loud inside, they have a great atmosphere.

Delicious food, friendly service and a huge selection of IPA what more could you ask for ? The atmosphere is very cool I came here with my husband and our two young kids. The only reason I couldn't give a 5 Star is because no official kids menu which I knew before we came so I just packed my picky toddlers pb&j's. If they would have or will eat some chicken tenders and fries it would have been perfect. We live in scottsdale and where on our way to the circus and so happy we found this place we will make the trip down here again it was so good!!!! I highly recommend the Outlaw burger they where kind and where very accommodating for my request of no bun and places it on some lettuce it was cooked perfect and the flavors where amazing , my husband ordered the fried chicken sandwich which he said was very good. He's a bit of a beer snob and was very happy to see the great beer selection. Hope they open one closer they would do amazing in N. Scottsdale / N.Phx area .fingers crossed

Absolutely the best beer selection in downtown, and a great food menu to accompany. Service is generally very good and the staff is all friendly. Great atmosphere with a large patio that is pet friendly. Love this place.

Love this place! Always have great service and their specials constantly change.   They have a massive selection of beer and wine. I always can find something to drink.  Gets a little bit noisy at night.
Awesome beer bar if you love beer. Great service and great environment. Food isn't too bad either.

Nice selection of beer on tap but the food is mediocre at best. The pretzels were good, but how do you mess up a pretzel? The outlaw burger was good in concept, but "medium well", does not mean "well" and the fries were soggy. I will come back for the beer, but will skip the burger and opt for a flatbread pizza instead.

A great beer selection, with knowledgeable servers.  The food is a bit strange, but not bad at all.  I have been here now 4 times and will happily be going again.  I'm always in the hunt for places that serve beers I've never had, which is rare, and I always manage to find a few here!
Love their burgers! Beer is also great. Can't say much else about the food because ever since I got a burger on my first visit, I haven't been able to get anything else on the following visits!

Headed out on date night with friends and decided to try This place for dinner based on the pictures on Yelp. Anytime my husband can get a good burger and good beer he is happy. They have a super small parking lot so you will most likely need to park on the street. We were kind of early so there was plenty of parking around when we arrived but it had filled up by the time we left.  There is a huge board behind the bar that lists all of the beers available. While we were there they erased and replaces at least two that I saw so if you see something you want order it! We tried a flight of beers so we could sample multiple. They have a good variety.  My husband had the Outlaw Burger and enjoyed it. I had the BBQ grilled cheese which was very tasty. The fries were also really good. My friend had the Fun-guy flatbread which was also very good.  Even though we were on the full side we decided to split some desert. We ordered the Blueberry pop tart and the salted chocolate chip cookie with ice cream. The pop tart was amazing! Definitely a must order. The cookie was too sweet for me but the guys loved it.  Overall great experience!
First time here and it was great. Although kind of loud and crowded the wings are fantastic
Amazing food.  Amazing beer.  Great vibe.  There is nothing not to love!
Rotating taps. $9 flights. Best pretzel bun in town. I've never left unsatisfied. If I had to complain, it gets super loud in here.

Overall I like this place.  Great and ever changing selection of beer.  Food is pretty awesome. The wait staff are nice, and pretty attentive.  Parking sucks, but that is typical of downtown Phoenix.   Decidedly for the 20-early 30 something crowd.  Does get pretty noisy,  and when busy you can't hear yourself think let alone talk to the person next to you, as a beer hall should.  Sort of hipsterish.    I'd recommend Angel's Trumpet.
The beer selection is always great and the food is surprisingly good. They make a great homemade pop tart which used to be a blueberry but right now it's lemon,  still good though.

This place is great.  We tried to go to Matt's Big Breakfast but the line was out the door and it was a huge wait.  I'm so glad we came here instead.  I had some burger with bacon and eggs on it.  It was very juicy and delcious.  It was a little early for beer for me, but I would like to come back here and try some of the beers they have.  This is a huge building that looks completely remodeled on the inside.  It appears they have a very large patio in the back as well.  If you live in the area I bet this place is packed on Friday and Saturday nights.  I'll be back for sure.

This place is pretty awesome. If my future experiences are anything like my experience last night, this place would be a definite five star. I went with the BF and a couple of friends and we were seated right away (around 9 ish). The bar was hopping. Our server knew a lot about beer and we each gave him a description of what we liked and he picked beer for us. It was awesome! He clearly likes his job and is very good at it. They also have a neat way of doing flights, they have a piece of paper with 6 circles on it. You put the number of the beer you want to try in each circle (and there are like 30+ choices.....ah mazing!). They bring out the six fairly large sample sizes in a muffin tin (cute idea!). We got two flights and tried some crazy beers...a lot of beers none of us had ever tried before. It was also cool that the beers were changing throughout the night...like when one keg ran out, they replaced it with something totally new. We didn't have any food, but it smelled and looked good. The ambiance is comfortable...they have an open wall out to the outside and tables throughout. It is a large bar and has plenty of seating. I will definitely be back!

It was date night with the bf and I've been wanting to try this place out.   I didn't know what to anticipate and it was not what I expected at all. It was about a 30 minute wait for a table on a Friday night that we went. I ordered the Spam sliders and some Nitro chocolate beer that they had on tap. The sliders were good but very messy. I didn't like my beer since it was too thick for me and tasted a bit bitter.   I was a bit disappointed in this place. First, it wasn't hard to find, however they have a tiny parking lot so you will most likely have to look for street parking. I think that it's great that they have over 31 beers on tap, however they have this huge chalk board that they just write everything on. There's no menu with their beers on there. I already have bad vision so I would have to get up and go up there every time I wanted to look at their menu.  If you sit in the inside it's extremely loud. I couldn't hear anything my boyfriend was saying. Their website doesn't even have their food menu or anything on there so I can't really even describe my meal or explain to you what my boyfriend ordered.   The service was really good. However, I probably wouldn't come for dinner. I'd probably come for maybe a drink on their patio.

After my flight arrived at PHX I randomly selected this place to plop down for a couple hours while I waitED for my daughter to get off work.  After my Uber driver dropped me off I realized on entering the front door that I have been here before, over a year ago, and loved it!  The Hop Chowda IPA went well with the Big Guppy tacos.  Nice casual vibe to the place.  I will be back!!

Angels trumpet offers a great combination of excellent beer, great food and an inviting atmosphere. The also have half a dozen taps of draft wine. It may be a bit noisy inside, you can always sit out in the patio. Should you desire beer to go; no worries, they offer "Crowlers".
Awesome food! Great atmosphere and TONS of beer on tap!  One of my favorites in the city!

Great ambiance and place to enjoy some really great beers on tap.  Every single beer I tasted (out of 7) was delicious.  Even non beer drinkers would have no complaints.    My fav: wings & left coast watermelon wheat-- def gave hell or high watermelon a solid competitor.

What? I'm Sorry... excuse me? What!?!  I can't hear a word you are saying. That's basically the theme of the night so be warned. This is my fifth visit to Angels Trumpet House for the fantastic beer selection. I usually don't review on first visit because my opinion might change and I believe a review should be on average. Every establishment has their on nights and off nights. The 31 tab beer selection is outstanding if you are a beer drinker and not looking for the run of the mill domestic beer. The food is interesting I had the chorizo and polish sausage appetizer. Not great but not horrible either. The acoustics of the place are kind of a nightmare, it is truly deafening and very difficult to carry on a conversation with someone right next to you. If they are across the table-game over! It's definitely more of a Phoenix winter place so you can sit out on the patio and not suffer from tinnitus by the end of the night. So if you and your buddy love a great beer selection and don't have much to talk about this place is for you!

What a gem!  The food was great and the beer selection was magnificent.  The staff was highly educated on beer their beer selections.  Atmosphere was great and there is some good people watching.  It's a must do if you haven't been there and it's kid friendly.

Found this place a few months ago and it's quite a gem.  They have different beers and a small wine selection to try.  The food is also good with a slight twist in the burgers and pizzas.  I like that you can come anytime during the week just to grab a cold one.  The staff is super friendly and always have good suggestions for the food as well as beer (because we all have different beer tastes).   The prices for the flights are good (to me)  considering what you get for the price.  I like the ambiance and chill factor this place and come here often when I'm in the mood to just relax and grab a beer.

Is it really possible that I've not written a review for ATAH? Apparently so and its LONG overdue.   I've probably been into Angel's about 20 times over the past few years, attending their Anniversary parties, Beer Week Events, Tuesday TV dinner nights and, most importantly, as a pre-and post-game ritual before Dbacks games. This year I got myself a mini-season ticket package so have been in about 5 times in the past couple months.   This is THE beer bar in downtown. The selection is awesome, I always go for a flight because the pints can be a bit pricey but the flights are always $9 unless they have a rare beer on that's not flight-eligible. The food is incredible here, from the pizzas to the burgers to the salads and of course the homemade pop tarts. The staff can be hit and miss, but, if you sit at the bar you're pretty much guaranteed an awesome conversation with a top-notch bartender. Sam has been working the last few times I was in and is a great beer-fan to talk to get recommendations from, but every bartender has always been really good there.   Downsides, hmmm...well its very loud in there at times, super noisy building. Oh, and they close at 12, which is a bummer if your game went extra innings and you were ready to drink up a few rounds of awesome beer afterwards. But, they don't serve liquor, so I get it -can always head across the street. Really though, this place rocks. Come in, sit at the bar, get a flight and enjoy the awesomeness yourself. You'll be glad you did, Cheers!
Visited with a group of about 8 and everything looked great! Crazy selection of beers! Definitely would go again. Sorry for lack of details but it's been a while. I'm a bit behind with yelping!

Food, beer, ambiance and service was great!!! Locally owned and operated and the passion shines through in everything they do. We had the spam sliders for an app and omg i have thought about them every day since we had them! (They are that good) For dinner we shared the peanut butter and bacon sandwich with mellow fluff and preserves, all of which was homemade. It was all sorts of ooey gooey deliciousness!   PROPS TO THE CHEF who clearly knows what he is doing. You know a chef  has passion and truly cares when he is out  and about doing table visits.  Also the downtown view from the patio is beautiful.  All and all i can not wait to go back!

It's taken me a while to write this review because I didn't want to write it seething mad.   However, its been three months and the experience is still on my mind so I have to get it off my chest.    I was so excited to take our close friends and family to Angels Trumpet to celebrate my husband's graduation.  Angels is a local spot, and since we were downtown residents I wanted to make sure we took them to a special place.  Some of our guests had never eat there and it had been on their "must visit" list for a while.  After my husband's graduation ceremony we made our way to Angels.  We were taking a group of 9 people to celebrate his day.    We ordered our food and everything was fine until my dad tried his food.  He took a few bites out of one of the chicken legs and was turned off.  He asked my father in law next sitting to him to take a bite out of another leg and my father in law was turned off as well.  I didn't try it, but if it was enough for both these men to not want to take another bite, I decided to notify our waiter and hopefully exchange it for something else or maybe just take it back to the kitchen in case it wasn't cooked correctly.    The waiter seemed fine at first, but then when he went to consult management he came back with a much different attitude.  He came back very snarky and patronizing because two of the legs were bitten into.  He said that since they had eaten "half" of the order that they couldn't do anything about it.  Okay, back up for a moment.  My dad took a bite and then my father in law took a bite of another leg to see if the taste was just my dad's dislike or if the chicken was really bad.  It's NOT like my dad ate half his plate and decided he was full and wanted to get a free out of it.    My dad is a little more passive than I.  He didn't want to make it a big deal so he placed another order for a different dish.  I was seething!!!!!!  My dad basically gave his place double his business because his first dish was awful.  This waiter was going to make us pay for the awful chicken, and had the nerve to get offended that my dad didn't like the chicken.  It was as if this waiter was the one who cooked the chicken.  Really guy???!!  We were a large group and, no doubt, we were going to be faced with a hefty bill.  The least they could have done was not give us a flipping attitude.  I decided to look for the manager.  Turns out it was the bartender.  He told me the same thing the waiter told me.  So at this point, it makes sense.  The waiter is just relaying same awful attitude and terrible customer service as his boss.  In the end, they offered to just let us pay half of the cost of the chicken plate.  What a headache and we still paid for half the chicken even though we didn't eat half!!  Look, I don't want to split hairs on what they should have done or what is considered good customer service.  But the attitudes of the manager and the waiter were absolutely unacceptable.  Thats what made it such a bad experience.  Sure one of the dishes was bad, but if they just apologized or did something nice everything would have been fine.  I felt bad for our party because we were there to have a great time and Angels' staff was less than accommodating.  This restaurant is STINGY, rude, and I don't recommend it to anyone.

Great destination for craft beer aficionados or anybody wanting to try new brews. To compliment ~30 of  the finest (and rarest) handles around, the kitchen is putting out great food. Great patio and good service as well. You can't go wrong.

Angels Trumpet is my favorite place. Period. We are extremely fortunate to have an ale house of this caliber anywhere in Arizona, and I am so happy they chose downtown to call home.   Where to begin...? The beer!!! 31 rotating taps and a killer bottle list mean that they have something for everyone. The staff are unpretentious and very knowledgeable so if you're not sure where to begin just ask.   The design and furnishings are very well thought out. The food is dynamite and they run all sorts of delicious specials. The mural on the south wall is totally rad. The view of the skyline from the back patio any time of the day is unparalleled.   So yeah. Favorite place. Anywhere. Hope they experience grand success for many years.

Such a fun pub to head to. Had a really great recommendation of beers. I had a nitro pale ale, delicious. My friend and I split the mess(poutine) and I had the pretzels and he had the sausage platter. The food was delicious. Very much a cool gastropub environment. The parking is a little hit or miss. The spots on the property are a one way parking, but there are plenty of parking spots on the street as well as metered spots. I would definitely recommend it and return. I would love to visit on a Tuesday, they have a "tv dinner" special. Would LOVE to try that out!
Wish I lived closer, great place for good beer.

I love this place!!    Excellent service from a busy, yet friendly waitress.  We ordered a sausage/onion pizza that was on special.  The mess, which is fries, gravy, and cheese curds.  Both of these where large portions, and yummy.  The best part however, was the homemade pop-tart...blueberry!  Not overly sweet, just perfect!   We didn't get any beer, as we were driving back home from Tucson.  The do have a large selection, and good variety for all tastes.    I can't wait to go back and spend an evening.

When thinking about writing my review, I was going to give them 2 or 3 stars... only because THE BEER HERE IS AMAZING. I've been here 5 times now and have loved every beer I've tried. If you're a beer lover, you can't go wrong here. Great selection/variety for anyone!  I mean, 31 craft DRAFT beers in one place in DT PHX... done and done! Even if you're not a beer aficionado, tell your server what you like and they'll make suggestions as to what you should try, AND are always spot-on. Last time I was there I had the Stone Enjoy By IPA... one of my new favorite beers of all time.  Now of the 5 times here, 2 times my party has ordered food. The first time I did not like my sandwich at all, and my husband thought his was okay.  I liked the names and ideas but felt it was executed poorly.   The second time here we started at one table with a handful of people and had Jake as our server (we've had him in other DT PHX restaurants and he rocks -- as always). Jake is great, friendly, knowledgeable, quick, honest... just an all around awesome guy. Then our party grew and we cashed out and took a table outside. It got busy, we got ignored for the better part of half an hour -- but then when we finally saw our new server he was very attentive going forward. Our food was delayed and we felt there was a lack of HONEST communication. Honest meaning don't tell me the food is coming right now then come out another 40 minutes later and tell me the same thing, just tell me how it is. Our server finally got a manager involved (Waylan - sp?) and let me tell you, he was our saving grace. He communicated the issue and was quick to fix it. It was to the point that we were talking about never going in again and he changed our minds. Our food came out after he got involved, it was great, everyone was super attentive to us (we weren't looking to be babied, that's now how I roll).  I know it's frustrating when something goes wrong and you don't have much control over it but you as a manager/server get the brunt of the angry guests.  So over all, my experience at this place has went from meh, to oh no never again, to great, thanks to the customer service provided by the management team. We'll be in again soon for a delicious beer  or five, and I will give Waylan a high five when I see him, and we'll ask to sit in Jake's section. :)

Totally different than I thought it was going to be- thought it would be a biker type/dive place.  Super cool- bright- good feel.  Had drinks and a vegetarian flatbread which was GREAT!  Will definitely be back!
Great selection of beers, good food and plenty of smiles from the staff. Oh and good prices too!

Great atmosphere, beer selection and the food options seem insanely good. I eyed about four or five different dishes that I wanted to order which is rare for me when I go out.   I ended up getting a grilled chicken sandwich that came with BBQ sauce, cheese, bacon and onion straws. Everything tasted great and the portions were generous. The french fries were killer! They serve the food with their own homemade ketchup which is something I hadn't experienced at a restaurant before.  They offer a beer flight which is always a must if the place offers it. Another plus, their beer selection is constantly rotating. While we were sitting there, they had at least four beers change from their menu.   I'll definitely be back soon!

Gotta love the chalkboard beer menu. Excellent & diverse selection (~25) beyond the normal craft and imports.  They turned over four kegs and posted new beers in the time we were there.   The servers were attentive and the clientele was diverse and friendly. Biggest surprise? The food was very good. Interesting, but limited selection of sandwiches and pizza flat bread. Both sandwiches we tried were excellent -  good enough to go back for even if it wasn't an awesome beer destination.

They have a great beer selection and that is about it. The food is an afterthought and they are reaching too far, whoever came up with the menu must be a high hipster trying to copy every other hip places food menu in the area but without the culinary chops to back it up. The service is usually pretty good and most the staff is really knowledgeable about the beer. So maybe if your looking to drink a ton of different great beers and your not looking for a great food experience this is the place for you. Plus they have a cool machine that will can anything on tap for you. It's at least worth a try.

TV dinner was delicious (buffalo mac & cheese!) and the beer flight was perfect. They had tons of selections to choose from and the environment was lively with a fairly young, hip crowd. Service was a tad slow on a Tuesday night, but the place was packed!

Don't let my 3 stars fool you.....I am actually a pretty big fan of this place and look forward to returning. I have been twice but the experiences were different, hence the 3 stars. The first time I went with my husband and we were seated at one of the community tables. They asked us if we were okay with that and it is was fine. The more the merrier! I had a glass of their rose wine and ordered their salad that came with avocados, grapefruit, beets, mint, arugula, goat cheese, and a orange vinaigrette. I asked them to leave off the grapefruit, beets, and add salami. I thoroughly enjoyed it, wow! However, the second time I had it, I ordered it the exact same way (but for take-out instead), and when I ate it, it was way too tart. I could barely eat it which stunk because I was really looking forward to having it again. Other than that, i liked the environment. It is really chill, I loved all of the windows which brought alot of light into the restaurant. I will definitely go back especially since it has become a fave among my husband and friends.

If the Branch Davidians were into craft beer, this is where they'd pray. Mustachioed hipster beer  cultists mingle with business suit clad professionals in search of a great brew.   Very beer-knowledgable staff with top notch bar fare that will not make you feel guilty in the morning makes this gem a must-do for microbrew enthusiasts. Portions are generous and not overtly greasy as is typical of such a spot. Atmosphere is apropos for a beer-centric joint, but don't hesitate to being the family during daylight hours.   Amazing selection of crafts.  Indoor and outdoor seating, you could stay here for a meal, or begin and end your night hours later in bliss.

Wld give 0 stars if i could.  Had the worst service at Angel's Trumpet tonight. Thought we would keep supporting local and have been going there for 3 years now but the behavior tonight was unacceptable. Never going there again!! I've been a server before and to hv a manager and server behave the way they did tonight is unbelievable! ! All we asked was to switch out a beer that we didn't like (after not being offered a Taster) and even offered to pay for for the replacement but the server said "no" and so did the manager after asking to speak with him. It was "against policy"... what happened to satisfying the customers  in the service industry? We ordered dessert - the poptarts and after all the ruckus back and forth we lost our appetite and didn't even eat the dessert nor drank the beer that I wanted to return.  But yet was charged for both. I was told there's a policy on the menu that says you cannot exchange drinks.  Which I thought was ridiculous especially after not being offered a taster. All in all it was just wrong because the manager could have replaced the drink and just said moving forward, " now you know our policy" but nope, he charged us for both items and that resulted in the server not even getting a tip. Very disappointed.  Shocked and will never recommend to friends.
Excellent selection of beers, 25+ beers on tap. Very good food, phenomenal buffalo wings and I know my wings; dry rubbed and fried crispy with amazing sauces.
I liked the atmosphere, what was upsetting was their small happy hour options. Not what I expected
Beer selection is is really kick-@$$, 3 stars is for mediocre service and long waits. But the beer selection and knowledgeable staff make it worthwhile.

Every time people from outside of Phoenix see pictures I post of Angels' TV dinners (only served Tuesday nights), they are astounded that that much food only costs $7. As my visiting NYC friend said, it's practically free _ or at least a killer bargain. It is a little bit like Christmas morning when you look and see on Facebook what Chef Brian will be serving for TV dinner. Past entrees have included fried chicken, meatloaf sandwich, pulled pork sandwich and chicken skewers. They always come with sides (thank god there's only enough to fill those little TV tray compartments) and a dessert.   I would already be a fan of Angels without the creative TV dinner nights. Even though I don't drink, the atmosphere here is fun, lively and so not pretentious. And it's always fun to people-watch. I used to think it was dominated by hipsters but I see white-collar office workers, men showing up in a bowtie and jacket look like possibly an ASU professor. It's very rare that you encounter someone crazy boozy. Also, the patio is a treat. They turn on the misters in the summer and they have a board out there as well with what's on tap.   The comfort food on the regular menu is amazing as well, the pizza and the sandwiches (you have to have at least once the nutter--peanut butter on sourdough with raspberry chipotle jam and marshmallow fluff and for an extra $1, peppered bacon). They also have big, fried spud tacos with sweet potatoes. A little too spicy for me but otherwise delicious. My only beef (or should I say pork?) is why on Earth would you serve spam sliders? I tried one on opening night and I could barely make it through half. Not worth the skyrocketing sodium levels. For the desserts, the "pizza" with marshmallow, pretzels and chocolate is so-so. But the housemade poptarts, I could inhale. A definite treat worth getting!  This has become one of my go-to spots for visitors or if I feel like I deserve a treat for the week. It's one of the best gastropub-restaurants to happen to Phoenix.

Parking is tough in the small lot, but there are plenty of meters around the area.  I met friends for happy hour there.  Happy hour prices wound up being over $15 for two beers.  The service was slow.    Despite the issues, I still gave a $2 tip, which I thought was more than fair for 2 beers delivered slowly.  The total bill was $17.21.  It appeared on my credit card statement as $22.21.  There is no way that they could mistake 17 for 22 and no way a $7 tip on 2 beers delivered slowly is appropriate.  I filed a chargeback and won naturally, but if you go here, pay in cash.  Otherwise, they will add to the bill to see if you catch it and maintained your customer copy.

So my buddy and I had a craving for some brew. Maybe some good eats as well. So, I took to yelp and this was what was presented to me. Pretty cool looking place with a beer menu board to keep your eyes wide open . So many choices, one set of kidneys . Since it was our first time, I chose to order "The Flight" which is a beer sampler. My choices were pretty good. To add to the flavors, we both decided to order the Spam Grilled Cheese Sandwich. Was to die for!!!! Who knew the taste of spam in a grilled cheese would be heavenly? Haven't had spam in decades. Will definitely be back to try some more.

Items ordered The CENTRAL: fried chicken sandwich Review: simple, executed well. Crispy and light batter. The sandwich toppings were perfect cheese, bacon, lettuce, onions, and cucumbers. It all jived.  Poptarts: the dough!  That was amazing. The filling was way too sweet. It was sort of weird. I couldn't figure it out? Maple cinnamon pecan?  Service was slow and tge waiter only came 2 times.  Worth a try.

The food is pretty meh. It sounds good, looks good, but just doesn't deliver. I was excited to try the smoked pork burger but the patty was small and dry. The house made ketchup served with french fries tastes like marinara sauce. They do not have regular ketchup. The flatbread pizza with goat cheese was on the salty side and the goat cheese was not creamy, but more like feta.   The rotating beer selection is great but when I got the sampler last night 3 out of the 6 beers were not very good.   Great place to go before heading over to FilmBar but I wouldn't purposefully come here for the food.

The food is AMAZING! I have to stop in when I can have a beer (or two), 'cause the selection is beyond anything you typically see in PHX. This will continue to be a "let's grab lunch" spot, regardless of my ability to imbibe (or not).

This busy, bustling gastro-pub makes for a fun night out.  Cool, open decor inside with a long chalkboard displaying a tempting list of great craft beers.  Part of the fun of drinking and dining here is anxiously watching as one of the staff removes one beer from the list and replaces it with a new one.    And the food -- so good.  I had the wings and pretzels (just appetizers for me this time) but the burgers, sandwiches and pizza my coworkers had looked good too.  The wings were seasoned and flavorful, cooked perfectly and served with a unique chunky buffalo sauce, an awesome chutney and perhaps a ranch or tzatziki sauce (I wasn't a huge fan of this last one except for dipping the accompanying carrots and celery). The pretzels, though awesome, served mainly as a delivery device for the savory and delicious beer cheese sauce.   Lastly, don't pass up on the homemade pop tart!  Our table split one order and it took a lot of willpower for us all to avoid buying individual ones for ourselves.  That night they served apple cinnamon ones.  They were more like toaster strudels, but that's a good thing!

Great place! I always get their fish tacos . My bf likes to get the spam sliders, sounds weird but they are good too!!! They have a great selection of alcohol and the ambience it just great. I take longer trying to figure out what new drink I want to try lol. The staff is really friendly and does their best to accommodate and answer any questions. They also make their own "pop tarts" and they are soooo good if you saved room for dessert. The only issue I have is the parking is hard to find but that can be expected given their location. Give this place a try!

This place is a great example of a casual bar/beer garden that surprises you with how good the food is. It was bumpin for a Wednesday evening, but it never got too crowded or loud or annoying. There's a ton of beers on tap, and good variety at that. And they do flights. Also, you can you watch them can crowlers behind the bar (lol the machine is fun to watch). I took a while to decide what to eat because the menu seemed ordinary and not very creative. I was so wrong, my sandwich was excellent. I got the "good ole fashioned" with grilled chicken and bacon. Also, the ketchup is homemade which made the fries taste even better. Literally cleaned my plate. The bartenders were super nice and attentive, too. I felt adequately tended to without constantly being bothered, or "over-chatted" with. Always had everything I needed and was able to just chill. Would definitely recommend. If I lived in Phoenix, I would probably come here often.

I love Angels, the poutine (I believe they call it The Mess), is fantastic, I actually have dreams about eating it, its that great.  We also had the chefs special which was different meats and pickled vegetables, it was also very good!  I can't wait to go back on a Tuesday and have a TV dinner and I'm still waiting to get a homemade pop tart!!  It really has something for everyone, as I don't even drink beer and absolutely love it there!!

We met up with some friends recently at Angels Trumpet and had a blast!  It was packed out, but we were able to get seats at one of the shared high-top tables, which is always fun since you never know who you'll end up chatting with.  If you're on a date and looking for exclusivity, it's probably not ideal, but it's always entertaining to start chatting with your fellow diners about whether they would recommend the food they're currently shoveling down their throats in an attempt to escape your rowdiness.  There's a killer beer selection and a surprisingly good couple of wines as well.  We also devoured a set of wings (highly recommend) and the tractor pizza (eggs, bacon, brussel sprouts - weird but tasty).  We could have split a single dish, since the pizza ended up being much bigger than we expected, but we just pigged out instead.  We also tried some of the homemade poptart of the day, which sounds weird and a little gross (if you remember what poptarts usually taste like) but which was actually an incredible dessert.  Definitely recommend Angels Trumpet as a chill place to meet up for a beer or two.
Great Downtown choice! Killer craft beer selection and scrumptious comfort food.

Honestly, i was avoiding trying this place because I thought the name made it sound like something it was not.  After finally going, I am really very impressed!  The beer selection was incredible and the food just as good!  The patio is super nice and large, and as far as ambiance and decor, it doesn't get much better!  Will definitely be visiting this place again in the future.

When we want to get out and be around people in a casual and relaxed city atmosphere that has wonderful outdoor seating, this is our go to place! LOVE that I can get a glass of Pali on tap and the selection of beer!

There's not a lot on the menu for someone who is gluten-free, vegan, or both. I'd recommend getting the fries - yum! - and the spinach/avocado salad that comes with smoked beets.   Oh, and the beer -- great list which includes local and regional craft beers you may not be able to get anywhere else, let alone on tap!

If you love beer more than you love most people, Angel's Trumpet Ale House is for you. With over 20 taps of the finest craft beers, you're sure to find your perfect match. If beers aren't your thing, let me tell you about the food. It's all delicious. All of it. They make everything from scratch (and I'm talking even the ketchup), so you really can't go wrong. They serve gastropub favorites like wings, sliders and hot pretzels, but they are in no way typical. For dessert they have sea salt + chocolate chip cookies and HOME MADE POP TARTS. The proprietors are lovely people who are dedicated to bringing you the best brew and best foods. The patio is big and comfortable; bring your entire contact list. You'll be a hero.

Possibly the best bar in Maricopa county!  Also the food is excellent.  There are over thirty choices for beer and wine.  I often recommend this place when anyone wants to meet downtown.  There is a great patio outside and plenty of room. Sadly Ashley is no longer doing chalk art.

A good and varied beer selection, with affordable flights available. They also appear to have Crowlers available for takeout.  The menu is simple, with a few sandwiches, some tacos, and usually two salads and varies from day to day.  My experience with the food has always been positive. It's not gonna knock your socks off, but it's better than most casual beer pub food.  The service has always been very good to outstanding. Although the crowd is mostly on the  younger side, I've seen plenty of older folks and a few families.

Two Stars for Meh service! A group of 12 people came after work and the server was annoyed that we had so many people. She had an attitude and messed up my beer order 3 different times. I didn't complain the first time. But I did the second and she was visibly irritated. She didn't really care much about our business. I have been here twice and it really is just a Meh. I do like that it is dog friendly :)

People cream their shorts over Trumpet Ale House...why? Maybe it's because it's the only Brewery Downtown? Who knows. Breweries are pretty ubiquitous in Tempe and they don't RUN OUT of anything. Does this make you think that the beer you're enjoying is some how more exclusive? No...it means they don't have room for extra kegs, because they took up the only available slab of real estate in the Arts District.  Also, pretty sure that grandiose sense of self, that the staff possess, has gotten passed down the patrons...  It's a place to people watch and "been seen". Ugh...People treat you like shit, and if they manage to crack a smile while staring in your general direction, you somehow feel like part of the club? This isn't High School...and you aren't in Mean Girls Part Deux.  Thing is? I really wanted to love this place : (  3 Stars because they serve (fantastic) food and beer downtown. Minus 1 star because they run out of shit.  Minus 1 star bc when I order a lambic, I expect the rest of the bottle. I know what I am getting when I order a Belgian Framboise. I also know ya re-corked and reused what I paid for, after you poured a meager serving into the champagne sized flute. Give me what I purchased (like every other bar does).   I'd go back for the food, and not show up on First (Fight the Pretend Art-Loving Crowd) Friday...

Angels is a fun hang-out, but not among my favorites. I've never had a shockingly great food experience, even with items that would be hard not to like. (For example, I ordered their Casper flatbread the other day, which comprises salami, rosemary, leeks, goat cheese, and a drizzle of honey. Sounds intoxicatingly good, right? They layered no less than 35 slices of salami on that single flatbread, so that you can't even see the flatbread itself. On top, they crumbled a full container's worth of goat cheese--the two flavors were so overpowering that I felt nauseous for the rest of the night, had the rest for leftovers the next day, and felt nauseous all over again.)  What I CAN commend are their homemade, seasonal Poptarts. These things are to die for, particularly their pineapple IPA variety (the strawberry-banana was...meh).  Lastly, their selection of brews is top-notch for this area of downtown, and also for this level of character--although the interior is extremely crowded and loud at virtually all times (whereas their patio feels like a fenced-off parking lot in...well, the middle of downtown Phoenix), I'd take Angels' beer selection and atmosphere over the wider selection and nonexistent atmosphere at the Yard House.
