Been here several times. Parking is limited in the parking lot for the restaurant. Plan on paying on a meter on the street. Lots of beers on tap. I don't drink so I don't have a option on the beers. The food is very good. Nice inside and outside patio seating.

I have heard about this place since I moved out here in October of 09', I decided enough was enough....it was time !   It's so tucked away downtown I actually drove past it.  It was about 9PM on a Wed. and inside all tables were packed.  The patio was actually great and I like that they have all drinks written on a chalkboard as opposed to using just menus. I had a red blend of wine which was really yummy, similar to a Cabernet.   The only thing I wasn't that thrilled about was their food selection.  I'm not sure why, but nothing really caught my eye.  We ordered "the mess" and shared between the three of us.  Brown gravy, cheese curds and fries.  They were pretty good, but I thought the gravy left little to be desired.    The thing that would keep me coming back would have to be the mellow vibe and man, I loved that patio.  I will eat before and be happy to quench my thirst on a flight of beers. :)  Want something low key, but a great atmosphere...this is it.

My bf and I came for a small snack and some brews. We got the pretzel and cheese appetizer. The pretzel was very tasty and I recommend It highly. We didn't try the other food, but I'm sure It is equally as appetizing. They have outdoor seating and valet parking as a plus!

Love it here!  Foods is great, they have healthy options that taste fantastic.  The food even has a bit of a classy edge to it from what you would normally expect from a gastropub.  The beer selection is always many and their beer flights are awesomely priced.  They make homemade Pop Tarts... enough said!

We went in there about a week after it opened and had a really bad experience there.  The beer was good, and the server we had was good, but the food was awful and the experience we had with the manager was what ultimately ruined the experience.  We ordered wings, and a quesadilla.  The wings looked and tasted either like they had been sitting out for an hour, or they were deep fried to a crisp.  The quesadilla had decent flavor, but was only about 1/8 of an inch thick and had very little filling, definitely not worth the $7 for such a small amount of food.  There are a lot of places in downtown I can go and get full for $7, this was like a 3 bite snack.    But, since we live downtown, and we like to support our local businesses, and considering the fact that they had only been open a week or so, we thought we'd give some helpful constructive feedback to the management in hopes they might improve.  So we asked to talk to a manager to tell him about the food.  So this guy comes over and we tell him the wings taste way too overdone, and the quesadilla tasted alright but was a poor value at $7.  We told him we were local, we were polite, and that we knew they had only been open a week and we  wanted to help them work out the kinks.    The manager immediately got really defensive and tried to tell us that the wings were fine (and that everyone else in the place who ordered them loved them)  and that they only use the very best ingredients and that's why the quesadilla was so expensive.  Then he basically tried to tell us that we were wrong and that there was no way that the food could have been that bad.  We were just trying to help a local place succeed, and this guy put a really bad taste in our mouth.   Arguing with a customer and trying to convince them that the bad food they just ate wasn't really bad is a perfect example of how not to run a restaurant.  All he had to do was simply say "thank you for the honest feedback, we will consider your recommendations, and we would love it if you would come back and have a free appetizer on us so that you can see we're committed to improving."  We would have been back a dozen times by now, and told all our friends about it.  But instead he was a jerk.    We thought about coming back again after a few months, but every time we think about it, we just think of the manager.  And besides, there are lots of other great places in downtown Phoenix that have better, cheaper food, and good beer too.  So we haven't been back, and we probably won't ever unless something changes.

traveling to a city, you never know what someone elses idea of "great local restaurant" is - this was "excellent" - I am not a beer expert, but everyone else in our party was.  They loved the broad selection of styles and brands to try.  The food was awesome - our party was divided - half got burgers, half got pizza and everyone loved their selection.  When we got there they said it would be 30 minute wait, but 5 minutes later we were seated outside, enjoying the balmy weather of Phoenix.  Enjoy the brews, enjoy the food!

This place was recommended to me by a few local Yelpers. So after arriving a day early for a business trip, my coworker and I stopped here for a few beers and a late lunch.  The place is interesting with a long bar, high top table seating as well as regular sized table seating, a mid-century modern corner seating area and a large outdoor patio with plenty of additional seating.  The beer menu is on a chalkboard above the bar. I had two dark beers while I was here which were good but I was eally craving a sour which they did not have any on tap. Oh well.  For lunch, my coworker and I both ordered the Matador sandwich which was beef covered in havarti horseradish cheese, peppers, onion and mushrooms on a pretzel bun with a side order of fries. The sandwich was great and beautifully presented. The one criticism is the pretzel roll was a bit dry. The fries were good also and the ketchup was amazing.   Really enjoyed the place and talking to our server. But still would have liked to see a sour on the beer menu. Apparently sours aren't as popular yet in Phoenix as the rest of the country.

Beer Stop 142 ----  Angels Trumpet was a 10 minute walk from my hotel so I decided to check it out, braving the extreme heat and all.  My first impression of the beer list wasn't all too positive. I was expecting some more local AZ breweries on the list, but rather a lot of the beers were also distributed in San Diego. Oh well. After striking up a convo with the bartender, he did provide (2) local selections - Peoria DIPA and Phoenix Pale. Both were good choices!   Moving on to food, the wife and I split the flatbread and wings. Here is where Angels Trumpet really shined! Delicious food at a reasonable price! How can you go wrong?  I really liked the layout of this place. Maybe the heat effected how I judged the taplist, but there is always time for another visit !

Great place for happy hour or a weekend funday. The wings are totally awesome, highly recommended. They have an excellent selection of beers too. Great location and close to a lot of other downtown establishments.

Listen up people. Try this place.   Two words: Burgers and Beer.  What else could you possibly ask for?  They have an almighty chalkboard with their rotating beer menu on it and it is legit.  The outlaw burger is always my go to. (Add avocado...you're welcome.)  They also have super bomb pizza as well as sandwiches and "the mess". (Poutine)  If you are looking to crack open some cold ones with the boys or have a GNO with some craft beer and junk food involved, Angels is the SPOT.  BB's Rating: BURGER + BEER = IN THE CLEAR

Great late night spot - our last stop on a pub crawl in downtown Phoenix. Loads of terrific choices on tap and good service. We didn't have anything to eat from the menu, but would definitely visit again and try something. Clean, with a pretty hip vibe.
Awesome food, good beer and wine... great prices..try the desert!! ... Disgruntled waitress.. Cranky,not friendly nor a sense a humor! Great place to hang out with friends.

We arrived for our anniversary, early in the afternoon with high hopes after reading reviews. It was not very busy and we were seated by the nice hostess. This is where it went down hill. It took 25 min before our drink order was taken, we are aware of the time as we set a timer due to using metered parking so we didn't have to worry about a ticket. The waiter was not personable at all. I ordered a cider and my husband a flight. I was half way through my cider by the time his flight arrived from the bar. At this point it had been close to 40 min and we decided we were not ordering food since it had taken so long to just get drinks. We saw many other people seated during this time and it appeared their wait staff was extremely attentive. An hour later after only seeing our waiter a total of two times (once to order drinks and once more after) we had to flag down another employee to get our check (who was extremely friendly). It was a very disappointing first visit. I would love to go back and try their TV dinner which is served on Tue, and if we attempt will probably just sit at bar. We left and had dinner elsewhere that night.

The avocado salad is one of the best I've seen eaten.  Dressed in champagne vinegrette.   The grilled cheese is another great dish served with non greasey fries and home made ketchup.  More like marinara. Spacious. Sports on the big screens. Corn hole in the the back yard. Plenty of outdoor seating. Sunshade over half. 30 beers on tap. Half a dozen wines as well.  I had a Bundaberg ginger beer. Yum. Haven't had one since Australia. Kind staff.   3 non gender bathroom stalls. The music was decent for us old folks.  Billboard top 10 of 1984. I just wish this place was adult only.
Happy hour deals are amazing here.  $7 flatbread pizza are generously portioned.  $4 draft beers can't be wrong either.  Food was excellent

Two words "Brûlée Burger". Now, go get one! This is a great place for anyone looking for a great beer selection and food choices that go beyond the typical pub menu. Angel's Trumpet has something for everyone (save some room for the pop tart of the day). The only draw back is that they don't have a full bar (beer and wine only) but don't let that stop you from having a great time here!
Cool place to come and have a beer, knowledgeable friendly staff, outside misters. And no smoking,  yea, great

I really enjoyed this place is a good place to hit on the first Friday is your class a Gastro pub reminded me a lot of Portland the food was good the beer list was fantastic and they have beers and wines from all over the country which was really great I couldn't give it five stars because my waitress didn't really know the revolving tap menu which took a star away sorry I'm almost positive Alyssa will get it right the next time on there.... Love her

Holy crap, that was good.  Had dinner here last night after a super fun time across the street playing video games, and we left duly impressed.    I had the seasonal Summer Salad with assorted greens, candied pepitas, feta, mango, strawberries, red onions and side of grilled chicken (extra), and my better half had the smoky beef tacos with a side of refried beans and freshly made chicharrónes, which he sweetly split with me.  Our food was fantastic, our server was friendly and efficient and the price was fair.  We will be back...soon.

The place is very modern, unisex bathrooms. Great place for happy hour, many many good selections of beer. The food, stick to the basics. Pizza is good, wings always a bit dry. Hummus is bla, had the viva something tacos with brisket. I didny enjoy them, brisket was dry and tortillas cold. I will keep going for the beer and pizza. Good date selection.

Fun, active ale house with a strong selection of brews to choose from. Nice to see some options on Nitrogen and that a few local breweries are on tap. Menu is solid gastro fare. All in all, a great spot

This place is my Underground Olive Garden. It doesn't serve noodles with ketchup sauce (to my knowledge) but if its name wasn't Angels Trumpet it would be Underground Olive Garden. It just feels that hip.   It's the type of place that "The Middle" by Dj Snake would play ad Infinitum. It's chill yet hip. Diverse yet monochromatic. Liberal but conservative. The place truly caters to all personality types.  I got a burger because I had just watched that episode of SpongeBob when he dueled Poseidon for best Kraby Patty - and also because I need to eat something to stop that rising feeling of drunkenness.  Legit though. Their craft beer and hamburgers are on point. I got a cider and it did not disappoint. Like dat Appleseed boi himself made it. And then the hamburger and fries were to die for. I legit zoned out my friends talking to me for at least an hour (I am not a fast eater) because I was too focused on eating my burger.  When I was done, I got the check in a timely manner from a kind waiter. It was quite affordable!   Angels was a nice stop to refresh and  refuel before I went back out on the town. If you're a Phoenix resident - get in there now and chow down, it will be worth it. If you're just passing through, make sure half your stay is here. For real.

We went here after a Dbacks game on a Sunday. The place was moderately busy but loud. They have a HUGE selection of craft beers and a decent selection of food to go with it. The service was so-so. They had 3 guys working behind the bar and only one really took the time to converse with us.   This is one of the newer business on Roosevelt Row so it is a typical trendy place in downtown Phoenix. Overall, not a bad place to grab a beer downtown. Just don't go expecting much conversation with your bartender.

What a cool place. Love this place. Want good beer, go here. They have like 50 on tap all of the time and the service staff knows their stuff (they get a "shift beer" when they work, even). I like their outside area but they need to enforce the no smoking. Inside I always sit at the high tables.   Their pork burger is to die for. We love their PB&J and their pizza is to die for. The only thing I hate is their ketchup, which is like homemade crushed tomatoes. Yuck.  I'd go more if their WIFI was stronger. I have to sit near the bathrooms to get a good connection. The staff promises they're trying to fix this. Also, please please make a huge north facing sign so more people know you're there.  If you are lost, find Film Bar. They're across the street.
What can I say? Easy parking, fresh food and service with a smile? No complaints here! We will definitely be back. But next  time-we're playing some cornhole!! Who's WITH me?!?!

Awesome place to grab a beer after work! I have had several of their craft beers and the servers made great recommendations each time. I enjoy sitting on the patio and hanging out  when I'm there. Also, the owner Mat is very friendly and does a GREAT job making this a fun place to have a brew
My favorite bar to go to in Phoenix!  Great selection of beers! And the food is absolutely delicious! Also I love the environment!!
Flat bread and poutine (the mess) were delish. Super busy on a Friday night. Our server was great, will have to come back and try a flight.
The beer list was huge and the snacks we got were delicious. It has a "yard" feel to it but without the little kids running around.

Visited here a week after they opened. Cool atmosphere and loved the finishes inside the place. The server was friendly but it took us 50 minutes to get our two beers we ordered! The beer list is located at the back of the bar which was a little difficult to see honestly from all the tables.  I would say the food was just so-so and seemed greasy to me.    We tried the spud tacos (a little blah and lacked a whole lot of flavor),  the avocado salad (which had greens that were extremely bitter and three small pieces of grapefruit) and the 810 sandwich (which had okay flavor but was greasy). In total, our dinner, took nearly two hours! Luckily I was not in a rush that evening or I would have been extremely frustrated.   Hopefully they'll get the kinks worked out as they are open longer but I can't say I'll be going back.
